We lost power during a storm last week for about 12 hours, with power coming on for short periods then off again. When power was restored for good, the switches were still working - nice.

The switch was easy to install. The app makes installation and handling very easy. The switch never fails to work. Works very well with Alexa and with Google Home.I am almost done switching all my smart switches, plugs and bulbs from WeMo to TP-Link/Kasa. WeMo devices cnstantly give me a hard time being recognized on my Wifi. Even the Wemo app can at times not recognize its own devices, let alone Alexa. Wemo plugs and switches really have been hot and miss in this regard, while the TP-Link devices always work. Always!

First of all, once you get this setup, it works great. I now have 3 outlets and 2 wall switches.The biggest problem with this switch is that it that the housing is too thick compared to other switches in the same switch box (see photo). The result is that the switchplate cover does not fit flush to wall (see photo). I dread the dread the day my wife notices this.

I love the plug and switches, I wish you made an in wall plug so I don't have a wart on the wall. The dimmer would be cool too. I'm happy you guys finally fixed the app so I don't have to reset my devices after every code upgrade! Scheduling features are cool. If you could have them follow daylight that would be fantastic so I don't have to continually change the on and off schedule as the seasons change. Google Home integration and IFTTT would be fantastic too. I know you say Google Home integration is coming but I 'd like to know if there is even a tentative when. I'd like to get more of these throughout my home but that's a holdup.I'd also like so see the ability to connect this up wo a 3 way switch setup. My home has 3 way switching everywhere and It'd love to replace that without removing all the switches. So we still have physical access to switches when we need them and still have the automation capabilities of the switches throughout the house.

The instructions with the device refer to an IOS app that does not exist.  Going to the support web site, the same thing.  The IOS app shown does not exist.  I finally found a KASS application to work with to at least have the device turn a light  on/off. After a lot of trial and error I found out how to get it to turn on at  sunset.  I came very close to sending it back.  There is no reason to purchase this device given the difficulty of getting it to work.Don't miss the need for a "Neutral wire".  This wire is not usually connected to the light switch that is being replaced.  It is topically available behind the switch under a wire nut.  Unless you are familiar with electric wiring, this is not a home, do-it-yourself project.

Decent light switch. My first. Works remotely so that what I like. Would be better if it worked with Siri and home, but can control with Alexa and other Kasa app or widget in iOS. Easy to use but may take some time to get used to install and set up at first. Only con would be the light when it’s off but I use it with a fan so I keep it on turn off using the fan remote. Has a great wake up or sleep feature for each day or if you travel.
1. It works - I just say "Alexa, turn on House Fan" and it goes on!2. The wires are a tight fit in the electrical box

These switches started a much larger project than I intended to undertake because they showed me just how easy it was set up home automation. They allow you to use an app to turn them on/off, monitor their status, control multiple at once and even have an "away mode" that toggles them on and off at random to make it appear you're home. Buy a smart device like an echo and these things really shine, commands like "Alexa, I'm home" can turn on specific lights and commands like "Alexa, I'm leaving" allow you to turn off all the lights at once so you don't have to wonder if you did or not after you've left. If I had the need I'd buy a dozen of these. As it is I'm loving the 5 i do have.

This is a nice looking switch that was very easy to install. I was a little nervous when no instructions came with the switch but once I downloaded the app it had a step by step installation program in the app that made it very simple to fallow. My only complaint is the app is slow when loading to turn the switch on and off with you mobile device. Speed up the app and this switch will be perfect.I will be buying more of these.

The TP-Link HS200 works great. Just take your time installing the wires as per the colors. The app works great and easy to follow. Connection to Amazon Alexa is also very easy and works all the time. I have installed 4 switches so far of the HS200 and they all work great. I am happy so far after 10 days of using the product. If you have issues with installation, search YouTube and you will find a lot of videos on how to install.

I bought this and set it up but not without difficulty.  I have a one year old house, built new.  The light switch I replace didn't have the neutral (white) wire. The switch HS200 will not work without the neutral white wire.  I called TP-Link's tech support twice.  Eact time I was disconnected from being next in line for a tech support person.  Extremely frustrating!I managed to find the neutral white wire folded back in the light receptacle box and get the switch to work as designed.

The switch itself is a great product.  I'm using it to control my street light and have it set to turn on/off according to my local sunrise/sunset.  Installation is very easy, with the Kasa app providing illustrated instructions.  I gave it 3-stars because I paid for a new item but mine was clearly open-box and had already been installed at least once.  I know this because the Kasa app tells you the total time the switch has been on and mine already had 16 hours of use.  Some of the installation hardware was also missing.  Just be aware of this when you make a purchase.

I'd give it 5 stars but the price remains high, so it gets a ding there.  the kasa app isnt super simple, but if you poke at it you'll be able to get through the setup. once setup it works well most of the time.  a little weird and it takes getting used to that the rocker doesnt rock, it just clicks, which makes sense given that you want alexa to be able to click it also.  I set this up for my daughter so she can turn on the lights without being scared of the dark, and it works great for that.  install is about the same as for a regular light switch, which may or may not be a warm fuzzy for you.

It worked fine for about 2 days and now it won't stay connected to wifi. Nothing in my network changed it is just faulty.I was contacted by TP-Link support after this review and was asked to reply to some questions via email. I responded with the requested information and a couple of days later received an email saying that they were going to close my ticket if I didn't reply with the requested information. My reply with the requested information was clearly the last in the email thread.

This switch will not work with the most common type light switch wiring.  Most switches are wired without a neutral wire.  Check your wiring, if you only have a ground wire and two others you cannot use this switch.  Most switches break the line wire, and a neutral isn’t required.  This switch requires a line wire a load wire AND a neutral wire. (It also has a ground connection). I like  theTP-Link Smart Plug, but the switch is useless in my home (built in 2001)

I've setup quite a few other Smart Home products and I have to say, this was very easy.  I'm good with home electrical work so this was a breeze.  Like the description mentions, you need a "White" neutral wire to tap into.  The device isn't as deep as a GFCI device so, no problems.  Kasa app on Android was too simple!  I didn't notice any lag as others mentioned.  Maybe cuz I have an awesome Galaxy S10+.  Highly recommend this product!

I installed 6 of these last year and should have gone to these first this time, but no - I decided to change to a cheaper smart switch where 2 costs the same as one of these.  Tried the cheaper switches and neither worked, so returned them and ordered another pair.  Ultimately, I spent 8 hours before I gave up on the cheap switches after 5 didn't work.  I then ordered 2 Kasa Smart Light Switches by TP-Link, they both worked, spent 15 minutest installing both of them and they work great.

I bought 4 of these switches. Also own 4 of the the smart plug mini's. No issues hooking them up. I use the dusk to dawn feature on the front and back porch. The rest are being used for Christmas decorations right now. Will be used for lamps when I go on vacation instead of timers.  Be sure to update the firmware.  You can do this through the app.  If you have trouble connecting it, be sure you are connected to the non-5G WiFi in your house.

I have had this switch HS200 for 3 months and cannot stay on connection with the wifi. I also have a Kasa light plug and have zero issues with it. I also have a Belkin switch in two different houses and have never had an issue. I need to call Kasa tomorrow to see why this item continues to disconnect. I will update my review once i hear speak to them and see if we can resolve this problem.

Installation was fine, but I had to upgrade the wiring to the socket I wanted to use in order to get it functional. In the end I moved the unit to another location because it will not work in an older 2-wire box.Works fine, no complaints, but there should've been a clearer statement in the description that the unit will not work if there's no ground.

The instructions for install are awful.  The electrical terms used are not normal USA terms.  I had to go on YouTube to find out what the real connections were supposed to look like.  Therefore, I was very careful to connect, triple checking the voltages.  Turned on the breaker and "pop" it was dead.  Returned to Amazon as defective, got another one, and this one worked, connecting it exactly the same way.  The WiFi range seems to be pretty good.

Love it. No hub required; we have 4 of these; control outdoor night lights, scheduled with APP to come on at dusk and turn off in the morning; also used to control colored pool light (which is 50 feet away from the house and still can be controlled via WiFi); we can scheduled on/off or just tell Alexa: "Alexa, kitchen on"....she says "ok" and we have light. Nice feature when I need to walk from one end of the house to another. I can turn lights in kitchen on from my bedroom (Echo Dot in there). No more stumbling around in the dark.

Easy to install and easy to connect to Amazon Alexa.  I put this in our kitchen and I was concerned that we had a switch on both sides of the kitchen and would that be a problem.  It was not!  We just keep the other one on all the time and it works great.  The other thing I like is you can just touch the switch and it turns on and off as well (if you don't want to yell an Alexa command).One warning...it will not work if your current switch doesn't have a ground wire (nearly all wall switches do, but just check to be sure.

these are great, i plan to purchase more of them to continue upgrading my house.  that being said, you need to use light placements that have a neutral wire.  this device requires a positive, ground, and Neutral wire.  this is important because most houses do not have a neutral wire in the light switch boxes.  in my bedroom lighting,  i was able to tap into an existing neutral line to provide the required neutral to the switches.  it may be difficult to place these around the house without hiring a electrician because of the neutral wiring requirement.

I love my TP-Link kasa smart switch. It works great, setup was easy, and the wiring was simple once you understand electrical wiring basics.  I found out that my house was wired weird, but was still able to get the switch to work. Once I configured the switch, I matched it up with Hey Google and now I can turn my lights off from anywhere with the command of my voice. I will buy more as I automate more of my house.

I was quite optimistic that this would be ideal for my front porch.  I was looking forward to the timed interval (On/Off), schedules and remote access.After replacing the first unit which was defective, I'm finding the operation of this one to be sporadic.  The switch is approximately 15' from my wi-if router and still seems to drop in and out of service.  Unable to setup schedules (reports an error: nul).  Based on the other reviews, I would like to give this the benefit of any doubts.

I bought these on Cyber Monday. They certainly by Wednesday and I had them installed wed evening. I'm lucky and all of my switch locations have a neutral wire even in the boxes where it wasn't being used. The install help in the app worked great, the Alexa integration works, and the app works.I can't figure out how to get 2 of them to trigger at once with Alexa yet though. You're supposed to be able to set a scene in the Alexa app, but the switches don't show up in that screen, and scenes in the kasa app (which work) are only on or off, not toggle. Bummer, but I don't know if it's just something I can't figure out.

This is a review for the light switch. Easy install, easy setup, and it's running with Alexa. We had to do a bit of extra wiring in our box (we had ground and neutral in the box but they hadn't been connected to the existing switch). Easy connection to my home network (we have an Apple dual band router), easy connection to Alexa (see the hint about turning on Remote Access).My front porch light is one floor below our living area. I can voice control turning it off and on, or put it on a schedule.

Work as advertised. I'm very happy. Purchased 4 at first, to start automating some lights in my house. The purchase of the first 4 was at 34.95 a piece. I purchased 4 more, but the price has gone up to 39.95. This is the only reason they get 4 stars. Apparently, only because they are actually "that good" TP-Link has decided to earn more per piece, which is, IMO, bad business sense.I was about to recommend these to my friends, but seeing as they are going that way, I will probably be looking at other options from companies that are more customer centered.

I have a pretty extensive ecosystem of TP Link smart home products and I’m very happy with them. I’ve been asked to help friends install their smart home items quite a few times and from experience with other brands I can say that TP Link is far and away the best. They’ve put more time and energy into their app and products than anyone else and it shows.

My goal in home automation is independence from any proprietary system like Iris or Nest. That way I'm free to choose gear that fits my needs/budget. I like the Samsung SmartCam for this reason, and I like the TP-Link gear for same.These are GREAT stand-alone Wi-Fi switches. No hub necessary!!! The Kasa app allows for all the programming/scheduling I need. I've even played with IFTTT Kasa beta to turn lights on/off at sunset/sunrise.
It is acting exactly the same as the switched outlets I purchased.They have to be in a very good mood, to actually do what they are designed to do.

my house is so smart now, I bought 14 of these and converted all the major light positions. I can come home and say turn first floor on, turn kitchen on, turn bedroom on stuff like that. They are super easy to install, looks clean and low profile. I've had them for around 3 months now, and they've worked flawlessly with no issues so far. Setting up was a breeze, and the app is clean and professional looking.My only issue is the switch 's plate where you use to screw in to the wall is kind of thick. If you need to put it over an existing plate rather than the ones they provide, it may stick out a bit. No biggie.

I use my Smart Switch EVERY DAY!  It's on a program to automatically turn on my porch light at a certain time and off just after dawn.  If this weren't enough, I can change this any time AND when I need something else I can change it at the drop of a hat and have it on or off with a screen tap with the app.It works perfectly!
I just installed 6 of these, and I LOVE THEM!!!The first one I bought was a Wemo dimmer, which lost connection some times, but overall works OK.

Worked fine for only 5 months then started blinking the lights uncontrollably.  Started an RMA with TP-Link who required me to enter a credit card during the RMA process.  Why would they need a credit card for a product return??  I refused and abandoned the RMA since I shouldn't have to pay them another dime more for their product failure.TP-Link later contacted me to let me know that I can select their "Basic RMA" option which does not require a credit card up front, but does require me to ship the defective unit back to them AT MY COST.  So, I am required to pay almost $15 to ship a $30 defective device back to TP-Link.  No Thanks, it's just not worth having to end up paying $45 for a $30 product.

Muy facil de instalar.  No requiere ser un electricista para realizarlo.  Hay que tomar en consideración del espacio y las dimensiones de la caja electrica antes de instalarlo.  El switch es bastante grande (ancho, alto y profundo).La configuración en la aplicacion Kasa es super sencilla para luego enlazarlo con Alexa.  Tan facil que  pude guiar a mi hijo de 4 años para hacerlo.

We replaced our old not smart switches with these and they are great. They work well with Alexa and are easy to set up. This is for a single switch without a dimmer. We have it on a light and a fan and it's fantastic for setting up routines like going on when it's dark and shutting off at "bedtime." I highly recommend them if you're thinking of making the "switch." 💡

Bought 4 of these from this seller. 3 were new, 1 was NOT. Package had been opened, wires on switch had been stripped down more and soldered, and 1 of the screws was missing. Obviously a return. Seeing as I had everything taken apart by the time I opened it, I put it in and hoped for the best. Well it worked, but if I buy something from a place and they say it's NEW I expect NEW, not someone's return. These are fairly easy to install other than getting all the wires back in the box with the switch and making sure you have a neutral wire. I own 10 of them now and will buy more. Just not from this seller.

First time homeowner and first electrical "project" I did to the place was this switch. The app was super helpful in the installation, but it is tailored to someone who knows a bit more than I did about changing out switches, so I had to consult a couple of other YouTube Electric Work 101 videos.Now I want one for every switch!

I am not a shabby handyman but even I was able to get it going in one go. Installation was a breeze after i watched couple of installation videos. Now I have one less chor to do every day, turning the porch lights on. Very happy with the product. Alexa can find it and can turn it on and off. Schedule it. Etc. now planing to get some more for other parts of my house.

Relatively straight forward for the wiring. Everything is color coded according to wiring standards. I didn't realize how much space is taken up by the switch. I had some issues fitting it back into the light switch receptacle as the wires in combination with the switch really FILLED the receptacle box. Had to shorten the wires on both units to allow for fit - really limited space!Connections and programming are easy, working well - just as advertised!

This is easy to install and requires minimum electrical knowledge, just identify Hot (usually Black) and Neutral (White) and start connecting cables. Do cut power to the switch before attempting installation. Easy setup with WiFi and Alexa. It light up at night when switch is off to easily identify the location of the switch in a complete dark environment.

Using the switch to control the outside garage lights. Very easy and straight forward install. Use a needle nose to gently fit the wires back into the box as you’ll need the room. Faceplate snapped right on and fit perfectly. Quickly found my Wifi, logged in and set up my first schedule. If I don’t have any problems I’ll definitely get more. I would definitely recommend this switch.

In the end, the switch worked as promised.  I can turn it on/off manually, with the app on my iPhone or with Google Home.  I have a couple of minor complaints (hence, only 4 stars):* I put the smart switch into a bank of 4.  Given it is oversized, it was tight getting it in.  I doubt I could replace all 4 switches in the bank with smart switches.

This was very easy to install and integrate into the app.  Just make sure you have a good wireless signal at the location you're installing it.  I setup several of these for my elderly parents and they love them.  I set up a schedule to turn off lights in the garage  after 9pm and turn on the porch light at 4am. They don't have to worry about it.  I get an alert on the app that the lights were turned off.  Highly recommend them.

Great switch that sets up easily and works great with Alexa. Does have a couple negatives though. The wifi notification light on the front lights up (the round thing in the picture) lights up and stays lit up at night and is actually very bright. Amazing for use in hallways and such, but rapidly becomes an issue in bedrooms if you like to sleep with your room as dark as possible. Secondly the button is very sensitive, and you will find yourself double clicking the light on and off when you are in a rush. Overall however these are definitely worth the price and I'm very happy with them.

These are so very easy to install! They worked flawlessly from the git-go.They work with Alexa. I have bought several of these TP Link smart switches along with the TP Link smart outlets/plugs. They can be grouped together by room or left separately. Grouping them allows you to turn on several lights with one command either in a room, whole house or just one light. Very handy when coming in at night. I would definitely buy these again. Also great when coming downstairs in the AM and having the lights come on with a voice command. The new three-way works well. I also like the Sunrise/Sunset function which turns lights on or off based on the sun rising or setting in your specifc area.This "old" house rocks!

Works well but the switch is huge. I can hardly fit it into my electric box. So I currently have it installed but it hangs maybs 1/4" out of the wall. Debating if I should dremel the back of it or not. Also a bit disappointed the the entire thing is plastic. For nearly $30 I suppose I expected more. It does work great with Google home.
Great light switch.  This is the 4th switch I have and they work beautifully.Easy install into a standard box as long as you have the neutral wire.

They don't say "connect the neutral wire to the neutral wire BUNDLE".  If you have a bundle, add the neutral wire to the bundle - don't pull one out of the bunch and connect that to the switch.  Won't work.It took some doing to figure this out, and added a fair amount of time to the installation, but it's in and it works.  Doesn't dim, in case you didn't notice that in the Q&A's

I have several TP-Link products and this is the only one that gives me grief.If the router goes down or is reset due to software upgrade, this product doesn't automatically reconnect to the router; you must push the Restart button for it to reconnect. All other TP-Link products I have automatically reconnect. To gain access to the Restart button you must remove the cover plate...a bit irritating.

I've purchased eleven switches so far with plans to obtain two more. Very easy to install. The Kasa app was easy to navigate and very user friendly. Set up was a breeze. It's nice to be able to control lights from my cell phone. Will really come in handy when away for extended periods. It's been about three weeks since installations and so far so good. Had to contact customer service regarding issue with one switch which was not helpful. Ended up returning the switch for replacement and problem was solved.

The control box on the switch and wires are an extremely tight fight in every wall I've installed... To the point of frustration...I'm handy around the house but in no means an electrician. I have been able to install all of these without major incident. So it can definitely be done on your own. Always use caution when working around electrical outlets.

I spent two hours trying to research how to install this switch. My electrician friend knew exactly what I needed to do. You need two black wires, a white, and a ground. If you don’t have a white wire into your old switch then you are probably confused like me at what to do. I just had two black wires and a ground going into my old switch. I won’t tell you what to do - you should call and electrician. Here is what I did, though. I turned off the breaker so that I did not take the chance of shocking myself. And then I found all of my white wires for all of the switches in that box wire-nutted together in the back of the switch box. I took a new 10 inch piece of white shielded wire that I had, and stripped & wire-nutted one end of it into the wire nut that my other white wires were in. The other end was the white wire I needed for my new smart switch. I hooked up my white wire and my two black wires and my ground wire to the Correspinding pig tail wires on the smart switch. And it worked. But I don’t recommend doing it yourself.

Trust me when I say "you have just found the best product on the market".  The Integration with Alexa could not be more simple, I had my Alexa turning on and off the lights in a matter of minutes.  You can struggle with other switches and feel uncomfortable giving 3rd party vendors your information if you want. For me this is the safest, and the easiest hassle free setup I have ever installed. Thank you guys so much and you can bet if a switch goes in my house, it will be a Kasa TP-Link Smart switch.

I have purchased hundreds of dollars of this brand. These are the best on the market. Setup is simple and the app is great. I love the scheduling in the app. You can set these to turn off or on at sunset and sunrise. I use Google home and the integration is seamless. Don't buy the GE crap. Its expensive and the app is terrible.

I mainly purchased the HS200 because it didn't require an additional smart hub to work. I installed the switch in a store room on the rear of my house far from my Wifi router and have never had any issues with loss of signal. I originally set the switch up as local only without and an online Kasa account and at times experienced connection problems and was not able to control the switch via my iPhone. This issue was not Wifi related, the app would fail trying to locate my online account.The issues with bad connectivity ended once I reset the switch to work with the Echo Dot that I received for Christmas 2017. Since I setup the switch with an online account and linked to Alexa I have not experienced any issues. It's been working flawlessly for two months now both from my iPhone and Alexa.

This is a great  product.  Easy to use and the app is easily navigated. For me, the only drawback is I needed an electrician to install (you may not).  He had challenges finding space in the existing switch area as these wi-fi light switches are more bulky than your average switch. It took him 30 minutes to install, and he knew what he was doing.Still, highly recommend this item. Works as advertised!

After struggling with a similar device for over 2 years. . believing its substandard performance to be as good as it gets, I finally threw it in the trash and ordered a KASA. The KASA was simple to install and works perfectly... MILESBETTER than the other device. I'm  so tired of frustration and disappointment. From now on I'm going with KASA!

The switch works great and the app is simple and clean to use. The best feature is how the switch is illuminated. When on it looks like a normal switch. When off it has a very  subtle white small light ring. I didn’t want a bright green or distracting light on the switch. It’s perfect. The only feature I works love is if they added the ability to dim the light ring slightly.

Works well but mounting tabs TOO THICK for standard wall plate so stuck with plastic one that came with it that does not match rest of room.  Picture shows the switch I am replacing that was older technology X10 switch that had metal tabs which are thinner thus allowed for standard switch plate.  If I used my standard plate i would be able to fit something fairly thick behind the switch plate.  It would look less than desirable for a $30 switch.  I will be looking for a different brand for the long run.

I have purchased 2 of these and installed them on switches for the security floodlights at the corners of our home.  I wanted to be able to turn on these lights from the upstairs and/or basement levels, but the only switches were on the 1st floor.  The switches were easy to wire, since I had accessible commons in both switch boxes, and easy to set up for remote access.  My only quibble is that the face-plate housing could be thinner and the visible switch part extend forward farther, so that the installed unit will cosmetically align better with other switches in the same box once the cover plate is replaced.

Decent product and not to difficult to install.  Lousy customer service.  Had one defective switch and it required jumping through endless unnecessarily complicated loops to get it replaced.  No one speaks clear enough English to have a conversation with and they ask the same question over and over.  If everything works good its not a bad product but don’t count on any assistance if you have a problem.
I never thought it will be that easy. first i made sure that i have the white N cable behind my regular switch that i am replacing, then i ordered the Kasa Smart Switch.Setup:

First of all this wifi enabled switch works just as expected and was very easy to set up once powered on. The smart functionality is great and was very easy to connect to my google home devices.However, what is not displayed on any details given by the manufacturer, this is not a standard sized switch. The plastic not only extends further out from the wall than a normal switch but it also is a few mm(s) higher than a normal switch. Normally this would be fine if used in a single gang outlet, but will not work in any dual or triple gang setups. When trying to place the wall plate over my two switch setup I am not able to get it to fit without being both crooked and misaligned. I will be trying to modify my electrical box to accommodate but I will likely return this device as it may not be possible to make it work.

Using it with Amazon Echo to voice control the house.  The back of the switch is BIG and was difficult to fit into the wiring box, though I did manage to shove it in there with a good deal of effort.  It probably won't fit in some boxes.  Having said that, the WiFi works very well, and it is easy to use manually by pressing the button as well.  There's a light on the switch that comes on when it's off so you can find it easily in the dark.  It's not bright, but it might not be ideal for bedrooms.  The button is a bending press button, not a toggle, i.e., when you press it, it goes back to the position it was in before you did so externally (I'm sure there's another switch on the inside that's toggled).

The TP-Link HS200 wall WiFi wall switch is a very good choice for a 'smart' wall switch using the free TP-Link Kasa app or Amazon Alexa technology and is much less expensive than many other similar switch technologies.  The installation is straight forward by connecting the wire connections using the Kasa app prompts to install the device.  The switch is accessible via a 2.4G wireless connection either remotely after establishing a free TP-Link account using a user ID and a password or locally with the WiFi connection without logging into the Kasa account.  For those who are do-it-yourself individuals and are competent performing household electrical and WiFi connections the installation is a breeze, just ensure proper electrical safety measures are followed.

I have a total of 5 tp link smart switches and one smart dimmer installed in my condo. They have never disconnected from my wifi network, they look sleek, and were very easy to install and setup. I have them connected to my Google Home but we like to use the switches when we are walking from room to room. We use Google Home voice commands when we are in bed or on the sofa or leave a room and forget to turn off the lights. We love having the old school option of actually using a switch and not just voice commands.

Works great with an easy to use app. The onscreen install instructions that pop up in the app the first time you open it are easy to understand. I knew how to wire a light switch anyway but they were nice to see. I have it working in connection with my Alexa devices for voice control of my lighting. The Kasa app is also great for turning the lights on and off without walking to the switch. Connecting it to my home network was as easy just follow the app prompts. It also works like a traditional light switch just push it to turn on and off if you want.

I have several smart switches in my house to turn on and off lights and fans using Alexa. I'm not an electrician, but with the instructions and some basic knowledge, installing them is fairly easy. Good documentation both online and in the Kasa app. Setting them up is easy too. Just give each device a unique name and connect to your wi-fi and that is pretty much it. I have been please and find these switches a great extension of Alexa's abilities.

No Hub! Great connection at all times! Outlets, switches, plugs, powerstrips! The entire Kasa product line is amazing, with the basis for each product being great software, affordable prices and excellent, reliable products. I have switches and plugs in my house and I am planning to add more and more switches. No more expensive smart bulbs. Just buy LED bulbs and make the switch smart. If you are looking for an ecosystem to join to make your home smart, look no further than Kasa.

Was never able to connect to it via the app. The LED was alternating between colors, indicating it was in configure mode. After multiple resets, restarts, and trying the app on three phones, I gave up trying to get it to connect. Returned the product and sticking with a more reputable, albeit more expensive, brand.Although I do have extensive electrical, computer, and smart home experience, I did find the product to be very user-friendly to install. I'm unsure if my faulty unit was a one-off, or if there are larger problems with this product line.

I was replacing an old Belkin Wemo smart switch that just died on me.  I like TP-Link products (business and personal), so I thought - why not.  Let's try this light switch to control the porch light.  I'm very comfortable around electrical stuff, so it wasn't difficult to install.  The software setup.  Even easier.  Downloaded the Kasa app.  Connect my phone to light switch wireless.  Fire up the app - finds the light.  Connect to home wireless.  Firmware update.  Setup my schedule.  Done.  It works.  I even went as far to turn off the wireless for a few minutes.  I see the light switch disconnect.  Start the wireless up again.  The light switch reconnects with no problem.  That's all I can ask for - something that works.

Installation was a breeze, works well with alexa, had an issue with connecting it with the iPhone vs Android, not sure if other ppl had that issue. But using Android with alexa was simple. Only thing is the outlet box is a bit big for the wall space that we had. But we managed.Light can be turn on/off via alexa or the switch. No issues at all with switching between the two.

Tech support is Awful. I called with a question, they just said you need at least 3 wires, then they told me it wouldn't work. They wouldn't help any further or really even listen to my question. Apparently they can only read the FAQ. I had an electrician friend come over, it was simple and worked as I had assumed.The switch has been working as expected since. The first night the Internet went out for awhile and the light went off later than it should have, then came back On in the middle of the day. I did the Reboot and it's been fine since.

Bought with the Alexa show and some smart plugs for my wife because she always forgets to turn the lights off when she gets in bed and having Alexa do your bidding when you’re all cozy in bed is so much better. Setup was very simple After downloading the app and linking Alexa thru the Alexa app install requires a neutral wire

Great product, but poor choice of over plates. Because this switch comes with a snap on, screwless cover plate you con only use it in a single switch box. They should use the more common screw on cover plate so it can be mounted in a double switch box. The fist picture is the actual product, the second picture is where you CAN NOT install the product because you will not be able to screw the cover plate back on.

Already have a handful of Kasa smart mini plugs. Wanted to try out the wall switches too. I installed myself (41yo female). Easy install and wifi set up. Fit under the standard dual light switch cover/plate. Couldn't be more happy with the switch and performance with the Kasa app and also the use through Alexa. I'll be getting many more of these switches to make my home smarter.

After reading so many great reviews I decided to purchase one.  The installation was simple, and the feel and design of the switch is excellent.  I use it to light up my outdoor coach style lights from dusk to dawn in front of my home.  The app works well and it allows me to program the switch and do many settings.  I was using a digital timer switch before that was less expensive but I hated adjusting for time changes etc.  My needs may different from yours but I highly recommend this switch.

Kasa branded switches and plugs have been the most stable of all the brands I'm running in my house. Their installation is straightforward. And their online videos offer good support if needed. The app is outstanding and walks you through not only installation but connection to your network. I own Amazon branded plugs, Wemo (Belkin) switches and plugs. And by far, the Kasa/TP-Link products are the most reliable.

It the TP-Link switches loose wi-fi, you are doomed. Most smart items will regain their connection when wi-fi resumes. Not the TP-Links! The switches will just flash a small light to let you know that the switch has lost wi-fi connection. The phone app doesn't have any options for reconnecting the switches, or help sections, or phone numbers to call, or even a customer service number. There are no YouTube videos showing how to reconnect either.

I use this for my front light. Got this after two other digital timer light switches failed. You can turn light on and off manually with switch or control remotely with free app. App allows setting schedule. I use the sunset/sunrise schedule and it works great. Has been in use for several months. Doesn't lose settings after power failure which happens a lot.

I don't care much for messing around with electrical stuff and this didn't change my mind about it at all.  The reason for 4 starts instead of 5 is the design of the part that has to go into the electrical box.  There's a part of the unit that really sticks out pretty far in the back (compared to normal outlets) - and that has to get shoved into the electrical box along with all the wires in there and that was tough.  Now that it's in place (after many attempts) it works great - no complaints about how it operates.  I love the fact you can operate the switch manually, via Alexa, or via my phone.  Over all it's a good product - I just didn't like the installation part of it.

Easy to install and connect, but requires a neutral wire to actually work. Unfortunately, the switch that I wanted to replace only has a live, load, and ground, as is common in older houses. Some posts online have mentioned getting it to work by connecting the neutral to ground, but others explain that that's dangerous, against code, and can void insurance claims.So, my advice is to check your switch/wiring before buying. If you don't have four wires (live, load, neutral, and ground), you're going to need an electrician to run another wire, to install it safely.

Like all the other Kasa products I have, this was easy to intstall and setup.  I replaced a much older electronic switch that was controlling my outside lights but was not tied to my house systems (Alexa).  Now the outside lights turn on and off either based on a schedule, or from all my Alexa devices.  Love it.

I have 2 TP-Link dimmers, 5 TP-Switches (like this one) and 2 TP-Link 3-way switches controlling lights, fans and even a fireplace. All work perfectly with Alexa. Just use the KASA program from TP-Link to setup each device. They only wink out once and awhile to get automatic firmware updates. If there is no WiFi, they work as regular switches.

I was lucky to find a neutral wire in the box to get this unit to work.  I am using the switch to control an outdoor light (sundown-sunrise).  The installation was on an older (circa 1955) conduit box. I had to use a hacksaw to remove some metal from the box in order to have the unit fit. (see photo:  note the difference in right vs left side of conduit box)  I also needed a 1/2 inch box extender bracket.  The switch works with Alexa, with the Kasa app on my iPhone, and also manually.  Very pleased.

I have 2 Kasa Switches installed in the same box, about 10' from my router.  This switch has not worked consistently since it was installed.  The dimmer switch is fine.  I have gotten time sync error and wifi disconnected error.  Totally useless to set my outdoor light on a schedule.  Extremely disappointed.  It's not the cost of the switch, it's the inconvenience of having something not work, after taking the effort to install it.

I bought this to turn my kitchen lights on, but spent about an hour trying to identify a short (press the button and lights flicker before just returning to the off position). After unsuccessful troubleshooting, I called customer service. They tried telling me I need an electrician to check my wiring and then they sent me a YouTube video. This “how to” subtlety mentioned that the product does not work on banks of lights. Would have been very helpful to know this before purchasing, before installing, and/or even from customer service. Thankful for Prime return shipping being free...

Really always switch...it looks like a up/down toggle but it's really just a momentary click.  You have to push the bottom of the switch for on or off, not intuitive and we couldn't get used to it.  Traded for a leviton after a few days.  Physical install and app setup were actually very nice, just an awkward design on the switch itself.

Wife always refuses to turn the master bedroom light off before heading to bed and forces me to get out of the warm and comfortable bed to turn it off. This guy was easy to install and can just tell Alexa to turn it off and it's instant on/off is super impressive. Week 2 with product and quite impressed. I do get confused sometimes when turning it off/on manually because only the bottom part can be pushed for this, but this is a non-issue with all the other benefits that this light switch has.

I now have two TP-Link Kasa Smart Wi-Fi Light Switch's, two Kasa Smart Wi-Fi LED Light Bulbs, and one Kasa Smart Wi-Fi plug, and they all work great; I like being able to schedule lights to go on and off, or when I am away from my house, to be able to turn lights on or off from my smartphone; I also like being able to control my lights with Alexa (Echo Dots); so far I have not had any problems with any of the devices; they work consistently, which is exactly what I need and want.

This switch was installed to control an outside pole lamp.  I had tried using a photoelectric LED light bulb, and when that didn't work, a screw in photoelectric cell.  Either the lights didn't come on at dusk, didn't turn off in daylight, or were affected by small amount of lights from other sources.The Kasa Smart Wi_Fi Switch by TP-Link can be set to come on a dusk and turn off at dawn or another predetermined time.  And it can still be turned on and off manually.

I have a couple of the HS200 wall switches and one of the HS105 mini-switches.  These are really great and work as-expected.And just an FYI, I am controlling these switches just fine with IFTTT - as these switches are now compatible/controllable via IFTTT.  I believe that support has been added recently, so all of the comments that these switches don't work with IFTTT are based on out-of-date information.

I bought a dozen of these at a discount because they were 'used'.  Once on the inside of the box, the devices were brand new. I am THRILLED with my purchase.  I almost sold the one TPlink switch I had because I didn't own anything else TP link but at this price point it was worth it to swap out several switches in my new house.  I've never had a problem with TPlink in the past; reliable & stable with all assistants.I put these on exhaust fans in my house

Love it. Worked like a charm. Easy to install.Works great to control my fan/light combo(single switch). It was mainly used to control the fan to turn on/off with Alexa.  The fan is preset to medium with the lights off and my room is lit with a separate lamp with smart bulb to control separately with Alexa.

Great product to control multiple lights from one switch.  Your home must be wired with neutral wires for this product to work.  Note that the device is on/off only, and if your application requires dimming, you will still require the purchase of individual lights.  I bought this one to control three lights as an alternative to buying three new bulbs, as it is cheaper than three new CREE bulbs.  If I want to dim these three lights, I'd need to get the bulbs, though.  I bought a second one to use as a remote switch to control porch lights as a security measure.  Works great and easy to install if you have any home wiring knowledge at all.

The only problem was removing the face plate on the switch.  It is attached really tight and you should sort of push it without breaking it.  Other that minor thing, everything is great so far.  Make sure that you have a neutral (white) wire and two black wires in your switch box. In most cases the neutral wire is attached to to the neutral wire (the one going up to the light) in the wall directly.  The black wire (hot) from fuse box attached to switch at one end, and on the other end another black wire goes to the light.  Download the app and it will guide you.

I've zero electrical wiring experience and was able to install this switch on my own on the first try. I love how it looks; its very minimalist and clean. It's a single button that toggles the power on and off rather than a lever switch. I like how there's a little glow on the switch so it's easy to see in the dark. I use it with Google Home and it responds to voice commands flawlessly.

Good product is all respects so far (connectivity, ease of installation, aesthetics) except for the cover design.  Rather than the typical two-part design where the faceplate is screwed into the switch and brought flush with the wall, the faceplate actually has small plastic arms that grab the switch component from behind.  The switch has to be slightly out from the wall in order for the arms to reach around and lock in.  In my case, this has resulted in the faceplate also being slightly detached from the wall, so that the whole mechanism sort of floats and is not totally flush with the wall.The problem is worse if the socket box is crowded and you'd like to use the faceplate to push the switch in as you screw it.  Could be corrected using screws, or some other technology that I haven't thought of :)

I am remodeling my home and as an electrician, purchased these switches instead of installing timers and controls, I put these in so I can program on and off times with my phone from anywhere. The only thing I wish for the app’s sake is grouping multiple switches to one set schedule. As far as I’ve seen, you need to make a schedule for each switch separately. I purchased 3 so I had to make up three identical schedules for all switches. It only took an extra 5 minutes, definitely not a reason to avoid the product.The existing boxes in my house are metal, which are a bit smaller in height than newer plastic boxes which made it very tight for these switches. They still go in, just with some persuasion.

As far as installing a light switch goes, this one is pretty easy. It would be nice if all these products that say "Alexa compatible" could be connected through the Alexa app (but that's more on Amazon than the manufacturer).What takes a lot of getting use to is that the physical button is in the off position of a typical light switch and it is used for both turning on and off.

Love the ease of installation (if you have a neutral wire available).  Took 15 minutes to get it up and running and its all integrated into the same Kasa Account.  It is really dependable and the switch feel nicely made.  Love being able to control via voice or app and it nice to have a brand product that I can trust.

These are great and so handy to have.  I have about ten in my home now and can control them all from the Kasa app my phone, and also with voice commands using Alexa.Now that the TP Link dimmer switches have fallen quite a bit in price, I have been replacing my dimmers as well.  They are getting very close to the price of non-smart dimmers, so I consider them a bargain now at the current price point.

This was part of a larger project. When I finally got to wiring the switches, I noticed my house only breaks the load side of the circuit at the switch box. The neutral doesn't come down to the switch box, so I can't run this switch (not without some major in-wall rewiring). So, just be sure you have a neutral wire in the box before you order, especially if your home is older than 25 years.Other than that, the switch is nice, and very easy to install.

For aesthetic reasons, I was only interest in hardwired smart switches, and this product fit that bill. The fact that I did not have to buy an additional hub was also a huge plus. In general, the product works as advertised. Unfortunately, three of its limitations have been more than a bit frustrating in my home. First, the installation requires a neutral power line - something that some of the switch boxes in my home (built in 1994) do not have. Second, due to the size of the unit, it is not supposed to be installed in a multi-gang switch. Third, although I have not personally tested it, online blogs and the installation materials warn that the switch will not work properly with a 3-way switch setup. When you combine these three limitations, there are only 2 or 3 switches in my entire home that are compatible with this product. Despite the installation warnings, I am currently looking for a multi-gang faceplate that will fit this switch (it is too big for many options and the faceplate cannot be metal) because having that option available will allow me to install the switch in a more convenient location. I have given this product 4 stars under the assumption that I will be able to locate a multi-gang faceplate that will work.

You can't beat the price. It's very easy to connect to alexa (it also connects well to Google - if that's your thing). Two issues.First, be warned, the switch is pretty big. You'll need to push wires around to make room, otherwise it won't close properly.

Overall this product works great.  It is a bit bulky and the plastic mounting tabs stick up a bit so a normal wall plate may not sit flush (you need to either get an over-sized plate or cut back your drywall a bit so it sits back).  Make sure you have a neutral wire though -- and you need to wire it into the neutral wire bundle if there are a bunch wired in together....I'd like to get a few more -- waiting for them to go back onto deal of the day!

I think these are great but I had a circuit breaker trip last weekend and it took out a den and all backyard lights.  I could not reset the circuit, it would just trip immediately.  It turned out to be one of these switches shorted out.  Cost me $350 to have an electrician figure it out.  Hope this finds somebody searching for a solution and save themselves $350.

I used this to replace analog timer switches that I had on my porch lights.  The analog timers were a nightmare to program, would not work with LED bulbs, impossible to synchronize, and had to be constantly reprogrammed as the day length changed.  The TP-Link switch was relatively easy to install and program. Best part is the Kasa app allows you to set the switch to go on at dusk and off at dawn.  Automatically adjusts to day length.  Easy integration with Alexa.  Set it and forget it.  Just make sure you have a neutral wire in your box.  I had to rewire one of my switches to get it to work.  Best part is that it works without a smart home hub.

I have installed a great many TP Link switches throughout my home and have 'Zero' problems with my devices. These Kasa products provide seamless integration with my Amazon Alexa network. They connect easily to my internet wifi and all are simple to wire and install. The TP link App is actually easier to navigate and has a better layout than the Alexa App in some areas of access and function settings.

I have had two of these for a couple of years now. Works great with Alexa or Google - we use both! I only wish they made it with a normal light switch instead of the rocker switch. Easy to install but bulky. What you name it in the app is what you'll say to Alexa or Google. The app is so easy to use.

I like the way it is integrated with Alexa and the timer function.  I used to own Insteon products but their software was so bad I ripped them all out.  For the second go around I decided to go with a company familiar with networking.  I only wish you had regular toggle light switches instead of the press at the bottom type.  The other short coming is the choice of white or white.  Some other companies offer different colors or replaceable covers in different colors.  But all in all I bought the switches for the automation aspect and that works very well.

installation process was pretty straight forward. connecting to the wifi took a couple tries but once it was connected it works smoothly.  connecting to Alexa was a breeze.  Works perfectly, i love that it has the little light on it when it is off. it takes a bit of time getting used to how the switch works

I finally gave up on this, I just couldn't get it to work, I just left it in the wall and ceased using those lights. Today, my electrician came to do some other work and he shut down the power. When power was restored, the switch was blinking orange and green which is the signal to add it to the system. I went through the set up and as usual, was informed there was no internet connection. I ignored that and finished set up and it's now working perfectly. Frustrating but worth it in the end.

Love this product!  We installed three of these switches and use them with Alexa and with our smartphone apps.  Installation of the switch was simple and using the app (and connecting to Alexa) is easy and painless.  I like it that you don't have to leave the light switch "on" all the time, but can turn it on and off manually and still use the app or Alexa as needed.  We have a small home so I wasn't sure how much we would actually need these, but it turns out we use the "smart" functions quite a bit!

I purchased two of these devices as a trial run before updating all of the switches in my house. One of the devices installed without any issues and worked perfectly. The other device turned on the light one time but would not work after that to control the light. I tried to troubleshoot myself with the limited info online, reset the device, uninstalled from the app and reinstalled, verified that the light bulbs were functioning correctly and not burnt out, and even though the device was successfully added to my app, I could never get it to control the light.I called customer service for help and was incredibly disappointed with the level of service. In the middle of troubleshooting on call #1, I was told to verify that the wiring was done correctly, and in order to do that, I needed to turn off my power. I was told to hang up while I did that because it was going to tie up the help agent and that I would be wasting his time sitting on the call.

This item I bought because I was trying to "tech out" my room, and honestly this is just useful! It's so easy to say "Hey Google" or "Alexa" turn off the fan, and the remote capability could come in handy. Say you are just on your way home and it's hot out and you want to have your fan on the cool off the room before you get home, simply go on the app and turn it on. You could also set timers for it and that's great! But on the downside, the installation was trial and error. The minimal instructions found with the product made it hard to install, but after a few tries, we finally got it working. Since then, it has been working flawlessly and looks good too!

These work amazingly well for the price. I was worried about the alexa integration but I figured i would give them a try and boy was I impressed. Definitely will be buying more for the house.PS. If you have anything more than a single swithch box, Save yourself the trouble and order a matching plate for it. Saves a trip to the local store. Would be nice if they offer a package.

How many times have you gotten in bed and forgotten to turn on the ceiling fan? or turn off the lights? Or perhaps you are like me and don't want to get out from under the covers with the fan on!  This is your answer!  I love it!

It was my first light switch of any kind to install.  The instructions helped.  The biggest challenge was getting all the wiring pushed back enough to allow the switch to fit. The switch has more depth than a normal switch.  Other than that, I’m so glad I added this switch.  It is so much easier than controlling 4 smart bulbs that sometimes don’t behave.

Looking at the different wifi switches, Kasa seems to be the best for its price. Installing it took me the better part of an hour, but I feel it only took so long because it was my first time and I had to switch out one of the previous lights in a row of three switches.The Alexa integration and wifi signal worked quite well, but I noticed that there is a warning that metal may block the signal emission. As I am using a metal faceplate, the signal from the app did not connect at first, but manual adjustment of the faceplate got it into a position where signal connection was fine.

The oversized wall plate has to be used, regular wall plate screws interfere with its normal operation and strip out easily.  I had 2 of these to install and they are the same.  Bought an extension box from H.D. Due to the shallowness of the existing boxes in my house and can’t use a standard gfi opening wall plate, looks rediculus.

Bought it to use with the Dot, which worked great, but wife doesn't like the whole voice command thing. Oh well... However, I'm still really pleased with the Kasa app functionality when paired with the switches and plugs. Have a few of each setup throughout the house, especially exterior lighting, and so far everything is working as expected. Really happy that I spent half the money on the wireless light-switch than I would have on new exterior lighting with the scheduled on/off functions. Also a lot easier to wire up, no ladders needed.Only gotchas I would relay to people considering these switches are:

These work super! Use it like a regular switch or set up any schedule you like for on and off. You can be on vacation and still turn your lights off and on from anywhere or just let the switch do it for you! Just set it...and forget it! Regular lighted or Christmas lights or whatever plus bet if all...NO HUB needed! Heck for the same price as having to buy a hub for some other brands just get 3 more of these switches and enjoy!

I have nothing but good things to say about Kasa switches, been using them for years, a little hard to install for not so handy people but once it is installed and it connects to wifi, it is always connected, also once you turn off and back on, it connects really quick and easy to Wifi. highly recommended.

Works as advertised and then some. Hardware not the easiest installation in the world but when dealing with electrical it rarely ever is. The app as usual is absolutely outstanding, easy, easy, easy to operate, user friendly and straight forward. I hate to say it, but the Alex app should take a few queues here. TP-Link, my go to IOT device vendor. Keep up the great work!

I've tried several other smart switches, including the TreatLife switch.  This is my favorite.  It's sturdy, looks good, feels good when you press it.  It's not too loud when it turns on/off (like the TreatLife switch is!).  It has a pleasant illuminated circle on the switch.  All in all, it's the best value of all the smart switches I've tried.

I bought these to put in the lower level of my home.  Unfortunately, the wiring in my home is old and is not compatible with these Smart Switches.  I was able to use them in other locations in my home.  I wish that TP-Link would offer a three-way dimmer with a Three-way switch option.  I have an opportunity in my home for such a combo.  I now have 4 setup in my home and all are working as designed.  If there was more options (as in the 3-way dimmer with 3-way switch, I would purchase and add to my home to further make my home smarter.

I love this! I originally bought it for another room but it couldn't be used there because there was no neutral wire. My kichen did because we had just remodeled it, so we put it there. This turned out to be a good thing because it's much more useful there. It works extremely well. I use it with alexa as well as using the kasa app on my phone.

I was a little hesitant to buy this, but have been really impressed a few months in. Easy install and setup. Good app to control. I do not use voice assistance products so I cannot comment here. BUT for ease of use, quality and cost, you cannot pass this up. If you are looking to automate, start here.

Does exactly what it says it will do. I have many TP-Link smart light bulbs so I figured it would be easier to stay with the brand and not have to download another app. So far I've had zero issues with it. It was easy to install and it updated itself with not issues once the setup was complete. I have a google wifi mesh network and that did not present any problems. I've only had it a week but I will update my review if I notice any issues in the future. I'll definitely be updating a few more switches with these.

Good product and it integrates easily with amazon Alexa. The app is very easy to use too. Wiring was easy but when it came to fitting the wallplate that has two other switches it became a little difficult. This switch is a hair larger than your regular decora switch (the tiny two buttons make it so) so I had to do a it of maneuvering and it still doesn’t look that great.

Very easy to install and good instructions although the instructions implied some tags to help identify the wires that weren't included. This is a minor point. The loss of one star is because it doesn't quite fit in a three switch frame like ordinary switches would fit so it bends the frame a little bit. Interface is very easy to use and set up was a breeze. Only caveat for this product is if you're replaceing a manual light switch in a multiswitch frame.

It was super easy. I bought two for my bedroom to see how they work, I had these two switches installed in less than 30 mins. The hardest part was stuffing all the wires back into the gangbox.Once I got the switches installed, the linking to thr kasa app was seamless. I did make a mistake when I initially set them up on Kasa and named both switches the same because I wasn't certian which one went to the fan and which went to the light. Once I figured which was the ceiling fan, I deleted the remaining switch and did a physical reset on the switch. Once it was deleted and reset, the re-linking of the switchurch wentry without a hitch.

Got two of these for use with Alexa.  After trials and tribulations along with a lot of positive contact with Support, it appears that the switch programming app, Kasa and the Motorola Moto X Pure phone do not play well together and we could not get the switches hooked up.  Kasa app is not available for PCs or Kindle Tablets.  The potential was great, but neither of the switches will connect.  The Motorola phone is about 9 months old and the netgear wifi router was new this summer.

Packaging and look are excellent.  Download the Kasa app and follow instructions.  Installation step by step instructions were easy to follow.  Then came programming.  This operates on a 2.4ghz wifi only.  My wifi is multichannel so I had to make sure my phone was connected to the 2.4 before i could get this to work.  Don't count on tech help from TP-Link if you have problems.  I called and found only one person with a script working on a Saturday.  That was frustrating but I kept turning the system on and off as well as resetting it.  Eventually got it connected.  Then the rest was easy. Set an on off schedule.  Connect to Alexa. All easy and I just bought outlets to get everything hooked up.

I now have three of these switches in my home (all shipped and sold by Amazon.com) and they all work flawlessly.  Replacing the conventional switches with these was easy (with proper tools and prior knowledge of house wiring).  Setup over Wi-Fi worked without issue using the Kasa app, integration with Alexa was painless.  I setup schedules for some outside lights to turn on at sunset and off at sunrise (so the actual timed event "slides" as sunrise/sunset changes) and it's worked great.  Alexa also happily controls them.  So far, so good.  I'll update this review should anything change.

So the switch works fine, pretty standard wiring and configures easy enough.....my issue is that for my purpose, this is one of the switches installed in a two gang box.  The tabs that attach this switch to the box are substantially thicker than the tabs on the standard rocker switch.  This causes the wall plate to come off the wall a little more than 1/8". The gap can be address with caulk - but its something I shouldn't have to do.  The TP link device comes with its own deep recessed wall plate, but they need to understand that not every installation will be in a single gang box - nor would I want a deep recessed wall plate when every other wall plate in my house is or standard thickness...Good functionality, Poor design.....
***Update***Light will not stop turning off and on. I’m having trouble finding anything about this in troubleshooting.

This switch installs easily with basic wireing knowledge.  You will need to tie it into the nuetral wire in your switch box.  It’s “deeper” than a normal rectangular wall switch, so it may be tricky to stuff all the wires back into the box when remounting the switch.  Also the switch sits a little farther from the wall, so your existing switch plate cover may not for quite right.  The switch does come with an integrated removable single switch plate cover that works great, but ona duplex switch your current plate may have fit issues.

Love these switches! I have 3 now and will be ordering more. I like that there is a little light circle on the bottom of the switch rocker so you know by a glance if it's on or off. I so appreciate not having to get out of bed in the middle of the night to turn the light in the back patio on when the dog needs to go out for a potty break. Also have one to operate a switch that's hard to reach. So handy to just give a voice command, and it's done. Time to get these for my bathroom, garage, and hallway lights!

I bought this switch to replace a WEMO switch.  The Wemo worked most of the time, but even when it worked it was not real quick with Alexa.  This Kassa switch works and it works fast and so far everytime.When I need more switches and plugs, they are going to be Kassa.

Great product. I will purchase again. It was easy to install. Just follow the directions that came with the box.Update:  I've purchased more and have updated the switches in my home.  It is very easy to install and I like it that I can control the switches remotely, schedule the timing when I need the lights to be on or off, and set the timer to how long you want the lights on.  The set up is so much easier once you set-up one.  The app is connected with my Alexa so it also helps when you don't have your phone with you.  You just need to ask Alexa to turn on or off the lights and it is done.  You can also group the lights together.

Install was fairly easy. Just be aware that since the box with the electronics is much more bulkier on the back than a regular switch, then you'll need to have a little bit of room in your wall electrical box.The big issue is that mine disconnects from the wifi network at least once a week. This is a very big problem that makes the device close to unusable.

The app walks you through step by step instructions. Just make sure you shut the power off at the breaker (which it tells you to do) to make it safe to install. I have had for a few months and nothing is more great then falling asleep on accident leaving the lights on waking up at 2 am and not having to get out of bed to turn off the lights just saying "hey google turn off my lights". Or asking google to turn on the lights and not stubbing my toes when going to the restroom at night.

I love this item. I first started with Kasa smart plugs. I liked them so much. I decided to try these. Each morning we turn on all the ceiling fans in the house in order to keep the house at an decent temperature. Sometimes we go to bed and forget to turn them off.  Now we Turn them on and off from the app.
I bought 2.  Works with Alexa. Works with Kasa app.CONS: Wires are cheap braided aluminum. There are warnings on the internet about connecting aluminum to copper wiring.

Switch works well and integrates with Alexa easily but the Kasa app has limited functionality.  The physical switch looks good, but is very touchy.  It is a paddle style looking switch but it functions with just a tap and not a rocker style.  Because it is so easily tapped it is easy to double-tap the switch or bump it accidentally.

The switch is so much better than the light bulbs. It is far more reliable. I have yet to have one drop. I like the fact that I do not have to worry if someone uses the switch on the wall unlike the bulbs where if someone manually uses the lamp for example, it will no longer work. In fact, I will be putting in as many switches as I can And replacing the smart bulbs where I can. I also like the plugs better than the bulbs but again if someone manually uses the switch, you have to start all over.

I have used this switch to control my exterior lighting, having it turn on at sunset and off at sunrise. Since it uses the timing of these events from the internet I don’t have lights being left on during cloudy days like the light sensors did. In the 2 plus years it has worked flawlessly without losing connection ever. I just added a couple more  indoors to automate some more rooms. Perfect!

I am not sure how TP-Link expects you to fit a switch and house wiring in a single switch box. It literally would not all fit. Maybe with a spacer, but that wouldn't be to code. I decided to return it. I have one TP-Link outlet that works fine and a second one that is a paperweight. I tried to get TP-Link to swap my DOA outlet for a refurbished one and they just kept wanting to try this and try that, reboot this, until I decided I had enough.At the moment I am 1 for 3 with TP-link. Didn't want to purchase a hub, but it is starting to make more sense to me.

Works great.  Installed in minutes and paired with phone/network.  Simple setup.  No hassle for settings.  Used it for outside lamp post and it's ideal for that.  Scheduled the on times with sunset and specified an off time.  Paired with the Echo and works great.  If you're thinking of buying a digital timer for your lights outside, think again... this does much better and in most cases costs a lot less then a hardwired digital timer.  You'll be very pleased.  Thanks TP Link!

I was easy to install and made it work with Alexa, but then I wanted to create a different account associated with another email address. So I reset the device to factory defaults by holding a reset button. I deleted and reinstalled the Kasa app and went through registration again. That step worked and switch works with Kasa App. But I can no longer discover it with Alexa. I don't know why, possibly the old account and password for TPLink is somehow saved by Alexa. I don't know but the point is that after I changed the Kasa account the switch is no longer discoverable on Alexa app. I will not but another one of these devices for sure.

Easy to install. Make sure the switch you want to install this on has pass through wiring in the wall because it REQUIRES 1 white (neutral) 2 black (live) and 1 green or bare copper (ground) wires to function. The WiFi requires that power be applied at all times. Even though this LOOKS like a rocker toggle switch, It is permanently in the down position, and when you click the top it switches on and off but the rocker stays in the down position.

Among other devices, I have these in my house. They are definitely easy to setup, easy to use, are reliable and look good. I have Home Assistant at home and these are just great addition to my home automation setup. I bought some when they were more expensive than they are now. Just bought some as backups. Totally recommend.

Works great for my front porch and garage lights. Only issue I had was connecting it for the first time. During the setup on my iPhone when connecting to the devices network my phone beckoned me to change to cellular. You can’t do this or it breaks the connection with the device and doesn’t setup.

Easy to install. Was a little harder for me because my switch is also in another location. Make sure if doing it you make the switch is one and the other is off. I had is backwards and messed it all up. After I figured that out, I love it! Also haven't been able to connect with my Alexis dot yet. I have the skill but it can't find it...? But the app works great so I'm happy.

The device functions as expected. Few issues though.First, it took a while to set it up. Following the instructions was easy. But device would just take a very long time to connect with my phone so that I could connect it to my wifi network.

These are great... I always forget to turn off the light and then have to get back up... with these... I just ask Alexa.  Super easy to integrate with Alexa... initial WiFi set up may take a few tries but once’s it connects it works like a charm... buying one for every switch....

This Switch worked as expected. I find the app to be user friendly and well designed. This works well with Google home and Alexa. This also works with Smartthings perfectly using a unofficial device handle. I have 3 of these is my home, all working with SmartThings Hub. I also have their smart plugs which also works with smartthings using the same device handler. I expect to buy more of these as they go on sale. The only done side to the TP-Link smart devices is that you cannot turn off the LED lights on them. This is my reason for dropping a start.

This is my third TP-Link Smart Switch that I purchased. I have been very pleased with the product in terms of installation and functionality. Just make sure to follow the instructions carefully. Wire nuts are included and if you want to make sure the wire nuts don't come off your wire connections when tucking the wires back in, use electrical tape and wrap it around the base of the wire nut.

These are great switches.  I love that you can set scenes to be able to turn on/off multiple switches at sunset or sunrise.  I would definitely recommend them for anyone looking to make their house more "smart".My only critiques would be that it is difficult to fit the switch with all wiring and wire nuts back in the gang box after wiring.  I have used multiple smart switches and this is always the hardest part about installation.  I have also noticed some inconsistencies when trying to run applets on IFTTT with these switches.  But these are minor minor issues.  All in all very pleased!

Easy install, linked to my wifi in seconds.  Works perfect.  Put one in each of my kids bedrooms to turn the lights on at 6am for school. Plus added a Alexa Sharknado alarm clock (with Tari Reads voice) and with both working perfectly together..helps me with getting my 4 kids going each morning. Kids like it better then me ripping sheets off and reminding them to get up 10 times...lol

He comprado dos veces estos interruptores 3way , en la primera ocasion me funciono perfecto, en esta ocasion , cuando enciendo el dispositivo desde la app de Kasa , el dispositivo enciende pero en la app se vuelve a apagar pero el dispositivo sigue funcionando y si desde la aplicación la enciendo se apaga. Ya le he dado reset varias veces y nada. Alguien tendrá alguna idea de que puede pasar ?

We love it! I ordered one as an experiment, to see how I would like it. It communicates perfectly with my Alexa, Android, and iPad. One of the things I tested was how it might handle power failures. After my husband installed it, I tried flipping the breaker switch off and then back on several times. Each time, the switch reconnected promptly and schedules I programmed were saved. The scheduling function allows great flexibility, including a feature that can turn on my lights at sunset. It's nice to know that I won't need to adjust the schedule as the days get longer. I ordered 8 more switches today and I can't wait to use them to create custom groups!

Works great. It's not in the wall yet, but it's wired up and working with both my smartphone and my Amazon Echo and Echo Dot. Even when I stick it all the way in the wall (it's a bit of an unusual installation) I doubt there will be any connection issues, since it's almost line of sight with the router. Very simple setup, and the status light isn't any more intrusive than a standard lighted wall switch. The only pain is having to have a neutral wire, but if you're wiring this up new, that shouldn't be an issue. I'd buy more if I didn't have to fish an extra wire through the walls just to power these switches though.

My home was built in the 80's when it was common to only have a live load (black wires) run to the switch.  I did not have a neutral wire available in my switch box.  So, I was able to run one from a nearby plug switch.  This was the only unanticipated install challenge I had, which was not the fault of the HS200 switch.
