Guess if I had read the reviews of this product before I purchased it I would have understood this requirement better.  Once I ran the neutral line (White) to the switch box, the rest was easy.  Luckily, I did not have any issues with the install, Kasa wi-fi app install or the firmware upgrade.  Device works well with both the Kasa app and Alexa app on my cell phone and with the Alexa Dot 3rd gen.  I am happy with my purchase at this point.  I have two more switches to install.  I am loving all my smart home devices!
Works as described.Also, it is actually compatible with existing faceplate which was not initially clear from the description.

My dad likes turning on and off the outside lights at sunset and sunrise... this ensures the pattern occurs while he's away from home. Took a little bit of figuring out how to install it (I now know more about electrical wiring than before). If you're not adept at figuring out electrical diagrams and wiring, get a pro to install it for you.

I particularly like this option for use with the Echo/Alexa, because it works equally well whether operated remotely, or just used as a wall switch. The installation and setup was pretty straightforward. I've been using it for months, and I don't think it has lost connection with the router a single time.  Looks nice, and I like the little LED circle that comes on when the switch is off.  It's just one of those rare products that simply works as intended, and becomes part of the normal background of your environment.  I plan to buy more.

Product didn’t work out of the box and Amazon’s supposed “product expert” was useless. It appears the item was previously returned and sold to me as new because the setup wizard said the switch had been previously setup and asked me if I wanted to clear the old data. The switch powered on but refused to pass voltage to the outlet it was supposed to control.

I originally intended to change out a few switches that would benefit by having a scheduled timer, but the Alexa integration made we realize I had several spots that would be beneficial to be able to voice control if my hands were full or such.  And then I like the look and feel of the switches that I decided to go for consistency and did the entire house, and added a few plugs, too.  At this point, only 4 switches are not converted - 2 Four Gang switches (as there is no solution for that), the garbage disposal (no benefit to that!) and the fireplace (it had no common wire and was not standard wiring).  Since I already had a smart sprinkler system, thermostat and Ring doorbell, I now have a smart house.

I switched out 7 WEMO plugs and 3 WEMO 3way switches and haven't had one connection issue since. I have noticed that WEMOs have more capabilities but I never used these for more than turning stuff on/off so more capability is not really important to me.

Our power went out and I think since this powered on before the WiFi network was up it didn’t connect.  I cycled the breaker and it connected and worked perfectly.  Why doesn’t it retry connection periodically when it is disconnected from WiFi?

I ordered two switches in 2017. One of them is still working. Another one lasted for 3 years. It got stuck in the "on" position forever.  Then I ordered a replacement. It lasted only 3 (THREE) months. This also got stuck in the "on" position forever.

I have used other smart light switches (WEMO) and everytime there is a power interruption, they would need some sort of reset.  The last time power glitched, I could never get it to work.  I gave up and looked for alternatives.  This tp-link switch came back after a power outage with no problems!!!!  Finally, a product I do not have to keep futzing with.

Works great and was easy to add to my existing TP-Link network of smart outlets. **A disclaimer... Not responsible for your your wiring setup or install; if you have no clue hire an electrician. : My wiring install took a little longer than it should since I have installed this on a three way light setup (front porch and driveway lights) that have a switch in the house and one in the garage. The MOST important thing:Turn off the power AT the Breaker box!!! The next is you need to ensure you have a common wire (usually white) or the HS200 will not work! (see the notes on the amazon description). I had to dig in the back of the two switch box and fish it out took the most time (had all the joined commons of the light fixtures). This process of moving the already cramped box was a pain. My wiring setup had one red wire, two blacks to the switch. You will need to determine what black wire stays hot (usually labeled "common" on the switch). The hot black goes to the black on the HS200, the red went to the other black, ground to green, and white to the aforementioned common that was jumbled in the box. *VERY Important: you must leave the other switch (if you have one) to the on position (or complete the circuit if you want) to get the power to the HS200!  And the next longest part is the final cram: the HS200 is pretty sizable I had to cut and clear some of the extra wire and re-bend in the junction box (there was a lot) in order to get the HS200 into it. I included a picture to show how my jumble of wire looked. Again, your wiring may be different, and if you don't know what to do get help from a pro... I used to wire houses and "many things" for the military, so I have a pretty good knowledge. Also check out the Q and A section under the product. The user "spinnern" said it as good as anyone can say in regards to how to determine a setup. But you don't know how your wiring is until you open the box up.After the wiring, it was all easy to add the switch and test out via the Kasa app and add the new switch to Alexa via the Alexa app. If you dont already have the Kasa app or Alexa control enabled this will take longer since you have to make an account, add wi-fi network, etc.

The TP-Link Smart Wi-Fi light switch is a smart home set up for dummies (that would be me). It installs like a regular rocker light switch and sets up easily via the Kasa app. Within minutes after installation I was able to control an outdoor porch light via remote control through my smart phone as well as by voice through my Echo Dot. I like that no hub is required to set this up and I have since added a TP-Link smart outlet to the system. There are no special technology skills required to get this up and running - definitely the simplest way to begin setting up a Smart Home. I will be ordering more...

Don't waste your money.  The switch cannot maintain a proper wifi connection even when it's less than 20 feet away from my router.  I wake up to it ever morning flashing orange that indicates it lost connectivity to wifi.  To further the problem you're left to pop the cover off the switch to reset it.  Lastly, the switch itself is cut off in the app - I can only see half of the words indicating what it is.

I had no problem installing the switch and the app works fine, but the switch looks awful when used with a double wall plate because it's too thick. See attached picture, there's a gap between plate and wall due to thickness of switch flange.  You would have to cut the sheetrock to make it fit right.

This thing worked great for about 8 months. Then, randomly, it started losing connection to my WiFi. Reboot, reset then finally factory reset several times each time it happens since there is no way to get it to connect again. Their iPhone app is extremely buggy. Every time there are different issues. Finally, lost connection again and the app won't even recognize I am on WiFi (even though I could log in), it's terrible. Read the other reviews, their customer service is worthless. Move on to another popular brand, this one is worthless.

I almost never write these, but this product is great so far. I travel for work and my home is often unattended. I have video cameras, but I also wanted the deterrent of my home appearing occupied while I was away. I was able to literally watch my home lights come on via my camera system, within seconds of turning them on remotely, on a plane, over Greenland. My house is in California. How cool is that?It was super easy to install and set up. I’m not good with wiring. In fact, it makes me nervous. But this was so simple, I had no reservations about it. The WiFi bulbs are also great for lamps. I hope this company keeps up with great products and doesn’t decline as so many do. I have and will continue to recommend this product to family and friends.

I have installed 3 of the single pole switches and one set of three way switches. The install and app are wonderful and easy to use. The pictures are easy to follow and the app works well.The only reason for not having the 5th star is for the scheduling software. Since these are light switches there should be some kind of feature for sundown, or sunrise events. Just turning on my outside lights at a certain time every day will not work for sundown throughout the year.

I have purchased two of these switches, and four kasa smart plugs over a period of four months. They work well. I have my router on the second floor, and three smart plugs in the basement. Two smart switches out in the garage. My only issue was the signal in the basement was weak. Certainly not a problem with the product. Like I said my router was a long way away. They did loose connection once in a while, so I purchased a WiFi range extender. Completely satisfied with all kasa products.

This is a nice touch for an outdoor light - We were considering this or just a smart bulb for above our outside doorway. The only thing I don't like about this is that it doesn't match the standard Leviton switches well. The shade of white is brighter, the trim is thinner, and it just looks a little odd in a row of 4. Otherwise, I'm happy.

Never worked correctly.  I used to be able to control it from the Kasa app... never from Alexa. Can't use it with either now. I have 9 other devices connected to 3 Echo/dots with no problem with TP PLUGS but this has been a dud since day one.  :-( . Constant aggravation.  Just spent a couple of hours and it still won't connect (and it is a pretty straight forward process)!

These work well with Alexa but DO NOT fit standard wall cover plates. Beware if you have a multi-gang swith ot switch-outlet you’ll need to modify the standard cover to fit these plugs. Also is it too much to just include wiring instructions with the switch, perhaps spend less of the unneeded packaging and include wiring instructions. If it was possible to setup thru Amazon Alexa and not create another unnecessary account to track these would be 5 Star

Smooth, easy and had a perfect amount of hand-holding during the installation/set-up for a newbie as myself when it comes to household electrical stuff. Install walk through is done via their Kasa app when adding the switch to your devices. Faceplate fit perfectly! I did need to buy a live wire dector pen for the install.Google/Alexa integration was easier then brushing teeth!

I bought this to work with my Google Home. I believe a neutral wire is required for the install, which luckily my home had. It was easy to install and set up, and works perfectly with the rest of my smart home. One of the switches did randomly disconnect once (in the one month it's been installed so far), but it was easy to reset by holding down the buttons on the bottom of the switch. I would recommend!
(This is for the light switch. Some of the other reviews are for the wall outlet.)PROS

I love that I can use this switch with my echo dot. We have a front yard light but the switch is by a door we never use. With the wifi we can either use our phones or the dot to turn it on. Works great most of the time.This switch does require power to it all the time to maintain the wifi connection. So if your power comes from the light fixture, it won't work for you. If you're somewhat handy and have access it isn't hard to rewire. I'm sure there are other work arounds but I just rewired so power went through the switch first.

So let me start off by saying the seller and the actual product are/were GREAT!MY sole reason for NOT five stars is the instructions.  With more DIYers smart-ifying their homes it'd be nice to have simple instructions so that even a five year old could install it.
It simply don't work. DOA. Clicks but no action with the light....LED or incandescent...nothing. App can see it and cycle on off....but nada.
Love this thing. I honestly cannot complain. All works and looks beautiful!Update****

Very happy with the product and the easy of install and use.  The associated app is basic, wish it had a few more automation features and easier access to usage history, but I use it with Alexa and won't knock a star off for the app since that is common to most wifi devices.  as far as the hardware and integration into my current system, I have no complaints.

I have bought three units.  The first one works great, the second unit failed within one day, but it took me a while to install and a little longer to trouble shoot so I was outside of the 30 day return window.  RMA costs $14.99 for shipment for $17.99 switch

One switch lost connection one time but thats about it. Works good so far. Except that I still have 2 switches left uninstalled, just because my specific switch in the kitchen doesn’t have a neutral, and that’s because my house is old. TP link must include instructions on how to create a neutral wire. Haha. Good thing I remembered, it didn’t respond well to my IFTTT app. I like the round light and wifi symbol on the switch.

I love this product. Kasa has worked well for me since I started purchasing their smart products. I have their plugs prior to this but this was my first smart switch. The switch was very easy to install and looks great. I find the switch to be much more responsive and easier to use than the smart bulbs. I will be converting my whole house to this product eventually but will probably wait for the next sale.

I have been making my entire house smart. I did the lights individually because I wanted color changing on the ceiling fans. But the back porch is hooked up to the patio lights. So a switch was needed instead of a bulb. Hooked up with ease so anyone could do it. Love it.

I have Kasa smart switches and plugs throughout my home. It’s super handy to have and love being able to set certain scenes (movie time, bedtime).  They were really easy to install and setup on my phone. They also work well with Alexa. I highly recommend these!
I have 3 of these Smart switches now connected in my home for under cabinet lighting, Outdoor  floodlights and a back door lightAll worked wonderfully with Amazon Alexa.

Worked like a charm. Easy to install and setup. Only issue is the remote control to be used when on a LTE mobile network did not work with the Kassa app?  Maybe can setup on the computer but did not have the option to enable on the app. But was able to do it with Alexa which works just as good or better.

Unable to replace any switch with this device. The wiring on this device did not work when going wire color to wire color. The light would come on momentarily and go out, would not stay on. There has to be a wiring problem, but the box instructions are inadequate to say the least. Maybe an electrician can wire it, but not me (DIY).

Would love it if it worked consistently. Set-up was pretty easier although it was a tight squeeze to fit into the recepticle given the depth of the switch. It loses connectivity to my WiFi on a regular basis and resetting it is a pain - requiring removal of the switch plate to access the reset button. Hope they can make this product better.

It is easy to install and setup once. It has been working fine until I recently changed wifi credentials. It stopped working schedule but able to operate manually. I had to recollect KASA account details to re-setup.

What can I say.  It works as it should and never fails me. Integration with Alexa is flawless.  I'd buy again. As far as switches go, it is attractive and I like the little light that glows when the light is off making it easy to find in the dark if you need to for some reason instead of using Alexa..

I have low expectations for 'smart' devices. I expect them to be confusing to set up and I anticipate spotty/flaky operation. I couldn't have been more wrong. Incredible job by TP-Link.+High quality look and feel

I have to admit I’m biased. I have a bunch of Kasa outlets and they were super easy to setup unlike other brands that’s had tried.  This Kasa switch did not disappoint. Easy install and super easy setup. They look nice and can operate like a normal switch or with Alexa.  I’m going to order a couple more.

Could always make it more compact, as it was a bit difficult to get this to fit back in the wall with the space required for the wires, but I was able to get it in. The nuts and wiring provided worked great with what I had; no wire stripping required.Had no issues connecting it to home wifi (note: upgraded to google onhub from a netgear afterwards and the latency from triggering via Alexa went from ~5sec to <1sec) and it just works. Scheduling was super easy to set up and works well; I use this for my exterior lights to keep them on at night and off during the day.

To be honest I don't have it installed far from my router but it works great, even after I reset my router it detects when the wifi signal is back and automatically reconnects to it. Makes life simple and feels like a quality product, I will say it is slightly deeper than a regular light switch so make sure you have room in your box but other than that I'm impressed.

I’m not handy but watching a bunch of you tube videos I got this switch installed in my 3 gang panel (there are 3 switches total on the one panel).  Hardest part wast stuffing all the wires back into the outlet box.Once back in and on the set up was really easy.  Using this for an outdoor post light so that it will turn on at dark(you have to set the time it doesn’t detect dark) and turn off around 11pm.

I had to get installation help from my building engineer because our neutral wire did not look like anything in the instructions or on the Internet. (It was not cut, just a white wire passing through the switch box. He cut it and finished the installation for me.) otherwise it’s been great.

I have changed all of my switches to Kasa switches. That is, with the exception of 7 fan switches that provide light control and fan speed control. If Kasa where to offer a fan on/off/3-speed fan control only switch, I would replace the seven fan switches. I already control the lights on the fans with Kasa Light switches, so a fan control switch would be great.
First of all, it works without any issue.I took 1 star off because it doesn't support IFTTT. Wemo light switch supports that.

As an advanced and experienced DIYer, installation of two switches was not difficult, but for someone less experienced I recommend an electrician for the installation.  That said, the Kasa app walked me through installation every step of the way.I wanted a sunset to sunrise timer for an outdoor light and this switch with the Kasa app delivers!  Once installed, setup was quick and easy and the response is near instantaneous!  The second switch is to over can oversight when we built our house...we did not include a second (two way) switch for our garage for the exterior entry.  We can now use the Kasa app to overcome that issue; easy peazy!

Wiring was a pain, but once I finally got it installed, it worked great. I will say that the installation instructions in the Kasa app are pretty good, but unfortunately my house wiring was not exactly like that described in the app. I still use the switch most of the time, but it is really handy to be able to turn the lights on in a dark room using Alexa or when entering the room with my hands  full. One warning. The switch will only replace a standard one-way switch. If you want to replace a two or three way switch (2 or more switches operate the same light), you are out of luck.

This was easy to replace in my mid 1980's house's bedroom's single pole switch and gives you the convenience of turning the lights on when you enter the room, and shutting the lights off without getting out of bed.  A luminescent circle on the switch makes it easy to find in the dark.  The only reason that I'm docking a star because it stopped working at one point and I had to do some Internet research in order to figure out how to reset the unit (it's a tiny button under the switch).  I've had no problems since, however.

Used with a dual light switch and this takes up a lot of space. The previous small standard switch was flush now the switch sticks out. If the housing has a slot of space don't worry but if you don't have much space don't attempt. This will probably better searve a single light switch replacement.

I bought two and then immediately bought another two and the mini plug. Very easy to install (other than there is not installation instructions in the box). The app and set up are easy to set up and use. Alexa recognized them and everything is working great.Kasa app Con: If you want to have other people control the smart devices on their phone/tablet, you have to give them YOUR USERNAME AND PASSWORD. THIS IS A MAJOR SECURITY ISSUE IN MY OPINION.

Works as advertised. I used it to replace another brand that crapped out after a few months. The Kasa has been in for about 6 months with no problems. As with most of them, make sure you have a separate neutral wire. You can’t just wire this inline like a regular switch.

This was very easy to install and works great. Only problem is the switch is little big and when installed in a two gang box it is hard to put the existing face plate on and you will see some gaps. It is ideally meant for for a single gang box however in newer houses it is rare to find single gang boxes.

This switch works well for me.  I use it in conjunction with my Echo Spot.  But, you can, of course, do it manually.The only thing I will warn you about is the switch is DEEP.  Meaning, if the box your switches go into, must accommodate a bit more than the average electrical switch or outlet.  I had no problem doing the wiring, but I had to have an electrician replace the box in the wall so it would fit.

I suppose I can't really say much about the physical switch itself as I use it with Alexa (Amazon Echo) but for me it works great.  Switch was easy to install (except for one switch in my house that had jacked up wiring that I had to fix to install it but glad that was taken care of either way) and hasn't faltered yet.  Have two in my house and will likely be replacing more with these.

This switch is easy to install and links with alexa easy! You can set schedules and control from your phone when you are not home. I always forget to turn off our outside lights during the day so I installed this controlling the outside lights on a schedule and it has worked great since the install! Will be buying more!

It works well and simple to setup, but it's only rated for a 15 amp circuit. If you use on a 20a circuit (not advised but whatever, freedom and all) be sure you're aware of amperage current. Watts / Volts = Amps.

The light switch was easy to install as the wires are clearly labeled and wire nuts are provided.  This was the first light switch I integrated into my Amazon dot to be controlled by Alexa. I have to say that was the easiest part.  Once I created a Kasa account, Alexa was able to connect to it through the Alexa app and find my switch.  I'll be adding a lot more of these switches around my house.

The only reason that I gave it two stars is that it works with the kasa app, but with Alexa, it always takes arounds 10second to response and it usually fails to call.No one going to use it's owb app, the main reason is to use it inside your smart home system, so it is useless.

Added these to control the lights outside our front and back doors, great upgrade.  Easy setup with the app, and easy Alexa integration once the Kasa app is linked.  Now I've got Alexa routines to have the outside lights come on after sunset and turn off automatically.Easy install if you know anything about wiring, just make sure you've got a neutral in the box before ordering.

Gotta know how to wire it which is fairly simple. I easily turn my fan into a smart fan. However you can not control the fan settings so you gotta pick a setting and leave it on that or manually change it. Overall it does the job pretty well

I’ve used TP-Link plugs for several years and was delighted to learn that wall switches were now available. I bought two (front/back door) and two three-way switches (garage and walkways). Installation was simple, connecting to my WiFi was a breeze since I am familiar with the wall plugs. Setting the timers on the app was a snap. I was so pleased with my new switches that I ordered two more immediately after installing these for use inside and outside. No more going outside to turn off motion sensor lights that freeze.

I had a 5 year old electronic timer installed for my front porch light, it adjusted for changing sunset times and worked OK. I have 3 TP-Link smart outlets and they all work great so a light switch was my next move. R+R of the old electronic timer took 5 minutes. setting up the TP-Link switch was as easy as doing the smart outlets. I can tell Alexa to turn in on/off or do it from my phone. Otherwise it follows the program I set up in the Kasa app.

Make sure you check your wiring before buying- this model works with a single pole switch only, and just because you have only one switch controlling something doesn’t automatically mean its single pole. Installation instructions have to be found online, and still require muddling through the hookup a bit. Unless you’re really comfy with electrical stuff plan on a $50 housecall from an electrician.Once installed it works fine.

I really like these switches. I bought the first a few months ago and now bought another. I have one complaint which is why its not a five star.I have occasional short 1-2 second power losses and these do not recover the wifi.  I have to turn off the power circuit breaker for a minute or two then back on. Then everything recovers and works well.

Right now I mostly have smart bulbs and plugs because I live in a apartment. But one light fixture I couldn't use bulbs. So I asked my landlord and they approved this. I love the switch way better than the bulbs. Definitely going to switch the light switches over smart bulbs when I get my own place. Sometimes you just need to physically hit a switch.

I just got this switch a few days ago and it was super easy to install and get up and working. The switch has a little light on it that is not very bright, which I like. You can see it but its not glaringly bright. Also it was easy to link to Alexa and it is very responsive. I have bought TP-Link products before and they were always high quality and this is no different. I will definitely be buying more of them in the future.

I already had a TP-link switch and have used it for over one year.  Love it and had no issues so when I needed another,  I naturally had to go with TP-link.  You won’t be disappointed plus the new switch was about $10 cheaper now.  Extremely fast shipping even with the New Year’s Day holidays.  Excellent app and installation instructions. Step by step instructions that anyone can follow.  I had it up and running in under 15 min.

After having owned and successfully used several Kasa smart devices I tried additional automation. Easy enough to install ( like any switch) and pair. Lost connection in 45 minutes. Mind you, this is 3 feet from Alexa, and 4 feet from Fire Tv and those distances make the switch CLOSER to the WiFi router. Total distance from router is 12 feet! The switch will not stay connected after repeated attempts. It’s now just an expensive standard light switch. It will get returned after I find a switch that will work. STAY AWAY, far, far away.

I've had mine for close to 2 years.  No issues.  I had to upgrade my wireless network to a mesh to cover my whole house, but well worth the upgrade.  Lights turn on when I get home, I can shut off select lights with different Alexa commands.  I can set up sway schedules for vacations.  I have my outside lights on timers.  Pretty awesome all around.  The hardest part is memorizing what you called things, but if you use the app, repetition works.  I will be installing these in my next house as well.

Bought to replace my 5 year old smart switch that went kapput during a power bump. Easy to install and program. Works as described at an amazing price point. So far, good. I would order again! Will update if anything changes.

Once installed and configured  works flawlessly. Very happy with the product. Installation wasn't that easy. Had to setup a kasa account on tplink and that took forever. Needed to set a password for the account and normally I use a scheme  that has a rather long password. With my fat thumb typing, I couldn't enter the password correctly on my smart phone. Eventually used a very simple 4 character password to get it to work. Then had to sync it with Alexa. I got a tplink smart plug and was pretty much a breeze to install, kasa already setup with a simple password and alexa integration straight forward with alexa already synced.  I don't know if there is a way to set up the kasa account and alexa syncing  on a pc but if you have problems correctly typing on a smart phone, you might consider this route.

They work great.  Not hard to install but if you aren't familiar with electrical you might need someone to do it for you.  Switch works well as an ordinary I really like it.  As a smart switch it's amazing.  I think I've had it about a year and it works perfectly.

In case of you have a old black, white, red wires like me, here is some hints to skip your researching time I have already spent on. Generally black wire refers live; white one refers neutral; red refers load and green refers ground. To whom need advices to connect those wires, use either one black connects to live, another black connects to load( which usually is the red lane), white goes to neutral and green goes to ground. This is a tip from electrician: if you dont have ground wire, connect it to your box if it is metal box(eg. If you live in ny)

Good Price, the switch was nicely packaged, and appears to be of good quality.  I had a neutral wire (White) in the switch box, so it was very easy to install.  Setup was easy also, using the app.  I set up a schedule to turn on and off the lites outside my garage.  Integration with Alex was also very straight forward and also worked very well.  I am impressed with this product.  I now have 1 switch and 2 plugs.  I ordered more plugs and a dimmer switch.

I originally bought the WEMO Light Switch but it didn't work (see my review). Once installed, when connected to it to configure the WiFi connection it would never see my router's SSID (it would see others but not mine). I tried their app on both an Android and an iPhone. Both were the same. When troubleshooting I read comments from many other people having issues with this product. So I trashed it ... goodbye $50 and 2 hrs I'll never get back. Then I ordered the TP-Link. I should have done that first. Installation was a breeze. Same installer, same location, same WiFi .. and no problems with the TP-Link seeing my router and working. I now have it linked to my Amazon Echos (2 of them) and my Dot. Works perfectly!!

If anyone got that reference and is looking at these, get them. We older people may want a 'smart house' may even buy some things to make us more tech savvy, but then becomes too much of a pain in the arse to set up, let alone work the darn gadgets. These will make you look cool to your children and friends and you can be super lazy at the same time! It never gets old having Alexa turn on my outdoor lights. Now, if she could just grow legs and bring me wine...

I love this so much. Couldn't be easier to install, even if you have very little experience installing light switches. Just googled some pics and videos of 2 and 3-gang setups to make sure I had the neutral and ground wires connected correctly since my neutral and grounds weren't previously in use. HELPFUL HINT: Take a picture of where all the wires are coming and going BEFORE you disconnect the old switches. The picture I took helped me solve my problem when I couldn't get the switch to work on my first try.

Warning!!!!! TP link switches are not compatible with standard "Decora" style wall face plates. So if you only want to replace one switch in a bank of two or more they will not fit the standard face plate!!! I bought one to test out before outfitting the rest of my house, now I have switched to a different company. I don't know what the TP-Link designer was thinking of. The "Decora" standard has been around for decades. Too bad.

Let me begin by saying I'm not an electrician but I'm handy enough to tackle most home projects on my own. I've changed many basic switches and outlets so if you can do that, or follow basic directions, you an install this.Install took me 10 minutes. Here's what I did

This smart switch was easy to install with basic wiring knowledge. The back side is larger than a standard switch, so be sure you have plenty of room. Downloading and adding the app was very easy and had the switch added and schedule set with little effort. Will be buying more of these switches.

Bought it in September. So far it's a great switch. Installation was easy. You remove the switch plate and old switch and replacing it with the twist of 3 wire nuts and two screws to secure the switch two screws to secure switch plate cover. Follow the setup on iPad and it you are good to go. Very quick and easy. This switch controls my porch light using the sunrise/sunset to turn it off and on. The App is intuitive making it easy to program. I also can use Amazon Echo to control it after setting it up in Echo. Easy! And if you want to go Old School you can control the switch with your finger.

I buy all TP Link smart light products because they don't need a hub.  Why the heck do any of them need a hub.  Just another way to get us to spend money.  These all work well with the Amazon Alexa.  TP Link has a perfectly good app that I can use to control them as well.  I love that I can name them all kinds of creative things and link pictures to them as well.  Easy and Fun.  And while one of my outlets was complicated and I had to get an electrician to do it, I easily did another one with the help of Youtube videos.

Could not get it to connect to internet. I have 3 TP-LINK smart plugs that had no problem getting setup, so I don’t think I’m the problem.It’s now been two weeks and I’m still waiting for customer service to get back to me. That’s way this is being returned.

I like the Kasa app. It is easy to understand and user friendly. Installation was simple for me but then I have done a bunch of electrical work. I had to cut some of the wires shorter in the junction box to fit this switch in. That's common though because most electricians leave lots of extra wire. It would be better if this switch was a little smaller but it is workable.

I would have given this a better rating but just for the hour of suffering I’ve gone through trying to get the switch plate on that’s impossible to install. Well no stars for you. The switch itself was easy to install. you'll need to download their app and create an account. you can then enable the Alexa skill to get it to work by voice command.

Have been using two of these for the past month or so. Easy to install (my skills are no where near electrician level). I bought these because I wanted voice control without having a buy an additional hub. Works seamlessly with the various Google Home's and Google Hubs I have in my house. Will probably be purchasing a few more of these soon to replace various outlets!

I got this to replace a simple switch.. & the price was good so I thought I'd try it out... Literally the hardest thing about installing this yourself is fitting all of the wires back into the switch box. Those thick wires are really... really stiff. Besides that, it looks super clean & it's only controlling one hallway light so I actually don't use the scenes or anything.. that's what my LifX lights are for. Still though, if you want to get into the smarthome game & you don't want to pay too much this is a perfect tester for that.

We had a motion sensor switch, removed it and wired in the Kasa Smart Switch. We can turn our outside lights on with ease - no more turning them on and off by moving around.It was very easy to install and set up.  I am extremely pleased with the product.

Install and set up of the switch was as easy as a standard light switch.  Connection to Echo and Google Home was simple.  Just make sure you don't have older wiring first.  I originally purchased for the kitchen, but that’s an older part of the house without two live + neutral + ground.  I ended up using in the family room since that's a newer addition.  Only complaint I have now is that the five year old forgot how the light switch worked when our internet went down.  Sat in the dark waiting for Alexa to turn on the light.

Been using for well over a year and haven't had any trouble with it.  Easy to install, setup and use.  Using it with Alexa and it integrated smoothly and just works.  Recently I wanted to move the unit to a new house and got confused over the wiring.  Customer support was very patient and finally figured out where I was messing up.  That's when I decided to leave the review.  The product is great and I would buy again based on that alone.  However, after my experience with customer service I can enthusiastically recommend.

Works as described, and integrates with home-automation / smart-home applications.I do not know about longevity -- I believe it has a 2-year warranty -- but none of the units I've purchased have been DOA.  This is good.

I got sick of my outside lights not being on and/or off when I needed them.  Installed a few of these around the house to fix that. 6 months in they are all working well. Easy to install, easy to connect to my wifi, app is easy to use and reliable. Would buy again.

Purchased to try it out in hopes of automating and making more of my home smart. This switch was a breeze to install and has worked every time. I use it with both Alexa and Google home Mini. I will be buying several more plus the 3 way switches and dimmers offered by the same company.

I purchased these to use with ceiling fans in two bedrooms. They were easy to install and link to Amazon.  They have worked perfectly.  We can now lay in our beds and control the fans without moving a muscle, except our mouths.
Originally I had another brand that was harder to install and never picked up Wifi.  This brand was simple to install and hooked up to Wifi and Alexa seamlessly!!

Fairly simple to install IF you are either an engineer, electrician, mechanic or handy enough to understand electricity can kill you.Make sure you pull the circuit breaker to the switch before you start!

I got two switches for the outside lights in the front of the house so I no longer have to remember to turn them on and off. Easy and convenient setup. The MAC address is on both the front and back of the switch, very convenient if you restrict access by MAC address in addition to a strong WiFi password (even though the merits of MAC filtering are arguable). A week in, I'm pleased.

Switch works great.  Was easy to wire up.  Works with Alexa.  Just won't fit in regular switch box.In my house it is impossible to put the switch inside the outlet box.  Adding three wire connectors to go along with the neutral wires and connector in the back.  Add to that the unit is 1 1/4 inch deep.  You need all of the wires, four wire caps and 1 1/4" inch of free space for the TP-Link switch for this to work.

I like the look and feel. The software is awesome too. Be sure to check if your light switch fixture is compatible. Mine in my office space had 3 wires behind it. This switch has two hot wires, one ground, and one neutral. If your fixture has anything short of that you have not enough.

After installation and connecting to wi-fi turned lights on from phone,Switch cycles on and off.  Contaced support by phone only to be disconnected, they had my phone number but did not call back.  Tried

I install smart devices along with numerous other products. This was the most difficult I have had to do. It wasn't the installation, it was the set up of the device to the network and to an Android phone that was difficult. Contacted tp link customer service and while they sent me an email on how to open a port on the will find router it was not exactly an easy fix. I initiated a return I got so frustrated.. I had a person familiar with networking come in and even then it took 30 minutes before he could figure out what was wrong..

When I purchase a technology device, I install them when I know i have two hours of free time, as installation is usually not straight forward.  The TP Link Smart Wi-Fi Light switch was easy to install, easy to link to my wi-fi, easy to link to the KASA software, and easy to link with Alexa.  I had the installation and software done quickly with no issues.  Then i waited two weeks to see if problems will pop up.  To date, no issues.On the critical side, the instructions are not clear.  I happen to be proficient in wiring and knew what to do.  It might be intimidating for someone without experience.  Also note, that you need to have a deep electrical box so the unit fits inside it with the existing wiring.  I feel the item description should notate that.

This is my third TP link switch.  As with the others, the installation is easy for a do it yourself job.  No problem linking up with my WiFi, and the remote timer is perfect and easy to set up.  This switch is much less expensive than the Leviton, which I also have and also works great....and the TP link is even easier to set up.

I usually read all the bad reviews on a site to see what problems are being reported with a product.  I usually base my buying decision off those bad reviews.  This product was cheap enough that I went ahead and bought a couple to test for myself.  I have been using them going on a year now.  They were fairly simple to install and I have never had any issues with functionality.  They just work.  I see all the bad reviews and all I can assume is that these people either got a bad switch or they are having other issues (maybe network related) and are blaming the switch as a result.  I just had to write a review and give it 5 starts.

Great product! Not a paid review! We have over 20 KASA devices installed now and slowly continue to add more. The quality is great and the reliability is bar to none. Very happy with all of our Kasa purchases! 6 months of time from initial purchase to this review.

The best thing about these switches over all others is the look, they offer a very clean look and tactile feel when pressed. More over, when you look at the brand as a totality their offerings cover the whole house from light bumbs, smart outlet and even outdoor outlets. It's nice to have one app to control it all.

These smart switches are incredibly easy to install, easy to set up, and easy to use.  The Kasa app is great.  I haven't had any issues requiring a reset yet.  They also fit with my existing faceplates, so they only look marginally out of place next to standard rocker light switches.The only reason I didn't rate these five stars is they don't support Apple Homekit out of the box.  It's possible to hack together a bridge yourself - but it's a fairly technical project.

I bought 5 switches and 2 plugs. It is the most unreliable wifi product. Out of 7 tp-link smart plugs and switches only 2 remain accessible away from home. They just get disconnected one after the other. And has to be reset and start from the beginning. I am away from home otherwise I would have returned all of them.And to add insult to injury I once spent an entire day trying to call them for help, and they never answered, sometimes I stayed 20 minutes waiting for their courtesy. But the Wemo may go off line occasionally but always comes back. Tp-link once it goes off line it almost never comes back.

It was kind of hard to install but that was for me I think you should watch the video of installing it before getting it or get someone that can do these type of things it also doesn’t work with two different light switches in different locations controlling the same light or plug

Got one of these to try out - am buying more!  It's easy to install (or get the installation) and it lets you control the lights either by the switch or alexa.  I've gotten the plugs as well, but this is by far the better way to go.  It does require the Kasa App to link to alexa, and I'm not keen on adding apps for everything, but TP-Link Kasa was pretty easy to maneuver and if I wanted to now, I could control my light from my phone.The only thing that was a bit different is that it is not a typical rocker switch (push up to turn on, down to turn off) - I was afraid it was broken when it first came.

I have about 6 of these setup in my home and i had to return 2, one for not working and another for wifi going in and out regadless of me having a Nighthawk X6 that is within 20 ft of the switch and my router was saying the device had 75% signal strength. The ones that work have worked flawlessly but TP-Link needs to add Scenes to be accessible by the Echo devices, not having scenes or not having their product function with IFTT, or Smartthings, or Harmony Hub, or Yonomi, or Stringify. Can we get some support here and get a functional product?. Thank you.

The product is easy to install and connect. It comes with everything that you need. The connection from the app to see the devices in Samsung Smart Things is slow sometimes. The biggest problem I have is with the Kasa app. It does some really great things and has neat functionality. What really got me is that you can only have three smart functions active at a time. I have 5 switches installed and I have even started outfitting my house yet. I don't understand the limitation.The Kasa app has some easy functions that smart things doesn't do so it is annoying not to be able to use the smart functions going into the future.

i replaced a $50 Wemo wifi light switch,  which had hardware reset problems and the worst software ever. The Kasa hardware looks identical but the software is 10 times better. Keeping fingers crossed.
Been a fan of TP-Link stuff past 5 years or so. Their routers/extenders are phenominal !As usual,  products, packaging & guides-manuals were all done well.

I have 10 of these through out my house. I have one that has failed after 6 months. It disconnects regularly from my home network. The switches feel cheap and seem to be of low quality. Don't waist your time on the RMA service. I wasted 30 minutes on the phone with the moronic 3rd party CSR just to have my RMA canceled because it was purchased on amazon through a 3rd party retailer.

I love these switches! I have one dimmer and one standard switch.  The app is easy to use and the as an ol electrician, very easy to install. I have timers set for both of the switches via the app and appreciate the opinions to set it and and forget it! Also you have complete control of the dimming and turning on/off via wifi.

I purchased the TP-Link HS200 to replace a mechanical light switch timer that I had been running for several years. My setup is fairly simple: I have a porch light which I want to turn on at dusk and turn off at 10:00 p.m. The clock on the mechanical switch would slowly drift so while the switch did work, it was never as accurate as I wanted. I spent about a day researching the available options and the HS200 seemed to have the best reviews and provide the best value. Even if it didn't work correctly, it was fairly inexpensive. Since the unit connects to WIFI, if it worked, then it would fit right in.I purchased the HS200 to replace a mechanical light switch timer controlling my porch light. I was looking for something that would provide greater accuracy than the mechanical switch since the clock would drift considerably. I have been using the HS200 for about 3 months and it has been great. Setup was simple and easy to connect to my wireless network. Programming took almost no time using the mobile app, and now I just let the switch turn on and off automatically. Given the price, this is a great value if you need a simple switch timer. The only thing to consider is if your overall plans for home automation. At some point I may add more light switch automation, and I am not sure that TP-Link will provide the best integration. That being said, I highly recommend this product for anyone looking for a simple light switch control.

One of the best smart switches on the market. Very easy to integrate with Alexa.Only concern that I feel that Kasa can improve: ensure back part design of the switch not to be bulky so as to fit easily inside the switch block.The switch plate was little hard to adjust.Bottomline not a bad option.

This is the simplest switch to program as I had tried many other expensive brands that weren't able to program remotely like this one.  I have had it installed over a year now and it still performs flawlessly.  Great product!

Used it for a pool light. I had to run a neutral since it was originally hooked up to an X-10 module that went bad. Now Alexa can turn my pool light on for me. The hook-up to Alexa was ok, but the KASA app was a little weird to figure out at first. Once I clicked on what I needed to let Kasa be a controlled skill Alexa could use, it worked like a dream. Definitely looking for other uses/excuses to pop in another one of these.

Direct replacement for a single pole switch. LED replacement bulb in a fluorescent fixture powered from a gfci outlet. Kept triggering the gfci on the load side. Put it on the line side and finally worked. But the led bulb burned up within a few minutes. The bulb was new. Seems to be working with a fluorescent bulb now, but concerned to let it running while I’m not home. Not sure what is happening inside of the switch but this was working fine before this switch. Disappointed.

I have a full TP-Link network in my home, I have their WiFi access points, unmanaged switch, PoE switch, switched outlets, and now their light switches.  They work perfectly, the app is great, integration with IFTTT and Stringify is seamless.  My only complaint is if you are installing these into a multi-gang box with another switch, where you have to use a trim plate that screws on, there is no support for the screws.  I solved this problem by taking a tab off of my old 97 cent switch and placing it behind the TP-link switch.Also, if you don't see a neutral wire in your box, make sure you look in the back.  Often times the neutral wire is in the box with a wire nut and jumpers up to the fixture.  I thought I couldn't use these at first until I examined all of the wiring, now I have them all over my home.

Easy enough to install... Just a outlet...  But it couldn't identify my WIFI... And I have four 2.4 Ghz signals going here.Customer support is there... although it took me an hour to get to chat to somebody.

This light switch was very easy to setup and start  using.  You will have to know how to wire a single pole switch and know basic wiring knowledge.  It only took me 20 mins to wire it and add it to my smart home Kasa app and to Alexa.  Two minor, aesthetic things to note:  When the light is off, there is a small glowing light on the switch.  The switch is not a true toggle switch.  It looks like a toggle switch, but it actually is just a one button switch.  You hit the bottom of the switch to turn it on or off.

I have bought multiple  TP-Link switches and this is the first time I received a switched that looked used. The switch didn't have the usual protective film on it. The switch has scratches in multiple areas. This is an absolute first time I received a piece of TP-Link equipment that look like someone re-packaged the device. Please check your devices before installing. I will be returning it.

Great smart switch. Easy to install and set up. Great "Kasa" app interface allowing smooth integration with Alexa or through my phone. I'm slowly replacing all of the switches throughout the house. I set the one in my bedroom to come on every morning with my wake up alarm and then off an hour later (in case I forget)When away on vacation I have my lights go on and off to simulate occupancy.

I wanted a simple light switch for the front and back porches for when I'm away. Nothing tells people your out of town better than a 24 hour porch light. With the step by step instructions it only took about 15 minutes to install and set-up. So far (about a month) there has been no problems.

The good: easy to install, the kasa app is simple and allows for sunset/sunrise timing events. My wife loves the little icon that lights up when the light switch is OFF. Works with Alexa although I don't have one yet so no comments on that.The bad: no IFTTT support, no published API to integrate with a raspberry pi. My short-term objective is to have my Ring video doorbell turn on the front lights for 10 minutes when (motion is detected AND the time is between sunset and sunrise AND the light is not already on).
Easy to install and join to WIFI.  Had mine working in 15min.Kasa App is easy and intuitive to operate as well.  Had no problems adding devices and adjusting settings.

Ok. This switch does exactly what it says it will. Set was very easy. Works great with Alexa. So why only three stars? Because it doesn't work with IFTTT. Doesn't work with Smart Things hub, (not sure what other hubs it does or doesn't work with). This makes it something less than a "smart" switch IMHO. There are work-arounds but again that makes the work-arounds smart, not the switch.

I have two Kasa One way Switch, both of them keeps on loosing signal when connected to home wi-fi. Issue is it cannot access 5G connection, you would have to use 2G connection. Even my phone can access 2G connection when I am standing outside my main door of home, but this switch cannot. One switch does not show signal signal on it but works from phone, other one I have to reset it every hour and you have to keep adding smart switch on Kasa app. So I have now permanently removed it. Second one is of no use. I am thinking of replacing them later.

I ordered a Kasa smart switch HS200.  It git delivered in 2 days.  I was so excited because I have used a lot of Kasa smart plugs with no issues, so I would like to try the smart switch.  I was so disappointed to receive the item,  because it was an open box and worst of all, if contained a standard single pole switch and not the Kasa smart switch (photo attached).  Have to return it.

Love the convenience of being able to turn off and on the lights in the house with a simple command. It is great when carrying items or turning off the lights after getting into bed. You may want to hire an electrician if your not comfortable with changing out the light switches. We had a little trouble at first due to our houses electrical.

This switch replaced an older meshed network switch which operated by use of a hub and at times would not work.This new one works so much faster to alexa command and easier with it’s paddle-type switch.

Everything is so simple on this!! It was very easy to install, connect and use the app. It automatically reconnects after an outage. You pretty much forget about the lights after you put it on a schedule.

I have tried to other cheap generic Wi-Fi switches on eBay and they were unreliable. This one it was so simple to use it’s absolutely worth the cost. I installed it and had it working with in a couple of minutes. I wish I would’ve just bought these from the beginning.

Product arrived on time but the seal on the box was broken, everything was still inside luckily. Install was real easy, wired white to white, wired blacks to blacks and wired the green to ground. turned power back on and the setup was easy too. Now when I come home with hands full of groceries I just ask my google hub to turn on the kitchen lights and they light up. Life is easier.... Life is GOOD :-)

This smart light switch is the best.  Put it in the kitchen.  I have my hands full often and this makes it so easy to turn light on by using my Amazon dot- Alexa turn kitchen light on.  Wala. Bought two, so am trying to decide where the other should go that would be best.

these take a bit of 'finagling' but they work great once you understand the process. I ordered 7, after ordering 2 earlier. Of the 7, I have a big issue with one of them and am hoping they will replace it. We'll see how this goes. Otherwise, I have used them while on the road, as long as you have a wifi signal they work. I have used them with ALEXA and with my phone. It's nice to know I can make my home look occupied while I'm traveling.

These make it so easy to set our lights on a schedule , and turn them on and off as needed.  Alexa is being a jerk lately, "I'm having trouble understanding" for the past month, so I have no comment on the Alexa Integration.  Good idea in theory, but I just use the Kasa app.

I have two of these installed in my house right now.  One in the kitchen and one in the bedroom.  The bedroom one kept going offline while the kitchen one was fine.Thought I may have had a bad switch but my TV in the same room also loses its WiFi connection once in a while.  Changed out the access point that runs the whole house and the problem went away.

For what it is, it works great.  My only issue is, because of the way amazon reviews work, I mistakenly thought the HS200 was dimmable.  Because I waited too long to install it, I now can't return it and will have to replace it with an hs220 (which is dimmable)  Honestly, for what it is I give it 5 stars, but because of the poor way in which reviews for different products are smashed together on Amazon's website, (something that has always been a bit of an annoyance) I give Amazon 1 star... averaging out to 3 stars.  Not really sure what I will do with it now.

I bought several of these to upgrade my house. The plugs once installed work perfectly. My only issue is that they can be a little difficult to install in older boxes. I'm not sure if this is due to the box or the switch not being standard size. The integration with Alexa is on par and the Kasa app makes it simple to program.

Have multiple different Kasa units this is my first light switch. Works Great, easy to install, integrates well with my google home, easy to use with the Kasa app for scheduling and such. Love their products. Great luck with all so far.

Such a cool switch I used this switch for some lights I installed on the exterior of my home next to my garage and had to install the switch in the garage by adding this switch I can turn my lights on and off from anywhere so convenient and great price!

Having purchased some other brand, I have not settled on KASA, particularly to work with Alexa (I had trouble with others).  The wiring is simple, they are very durable and attractive, and I now have 5 in my home (switches) and several wall plugs.  They all work seamlessly and I REALLY like them.  Instruction and App are also very good.

Great product! I did slot of research on different smart switches before I settled on this one. Glad I did!  Easy to install! Especially if you know how the electrical lines work if not get a professional.  The one thing I was worried about but not disappointed with was the size of the box, it fit nicely even with all the wires.The app is great and syncs with Alexa very well and I have not had any issues so far!

Bought this item to control the outside lights of our home. While it may not require a hub, you’ll notice one of the first uses in the app suggest you buy a TP-Link router for a more well rounded integration. Having Google WiFi, that wasn’t going to happen any time soon. For the record, this does connect to Google WiFi without issue which is refreshing. My main complaint is the Kasa app. I had been using it for weeks and found it very limited, even exploring third party apps such as IFTTT to control sunrise and sunset lighting. Only until my 3 year old had gotten a hold of my phone did she uncover a secret part of the app that allows for scheduled activities. It would be nice if the app itself, which by the way is the only automated way to control this device was more intuitive and not a sly sales pitch to buy more WiFi products from TP-Link. Lastly, the faceplate that comes with the switch is custom designed for it. I had to grind a standard 3-gang wall plate so that it would sit flush.

I bought a few TP link plugs and liked their build quality and app. The switch is also beautifully made. Installed in 10 minuets, work perfectly. One thing is counter intuitive in my use case. There is a indicator LED on the switch. It is on when the light is off, off when the light is on. This is fine if the light is near by, but when the light is outside the house, this indicator becomes confusing. They should make it configurable throw the app.
I was able to replace 4 outdoor light timer switches that were difficult to program and work with.  The new switches work much easier and the manual override makes them even more convenient

Love love love the Smart Switch we can turn our front porch light on from anywhere I also works with our Alexa's and Google home. This is way better than the smart plugs which work when they want toUpdate we are on our second one we had a lightning storm and apparently these short circuit very easily let's see how long this one lasts if it shorts out again I probably won't purchase another.

I have these installed all around my house. With basic knowledge of electrical outlets it was very easy to install. Rarely glitches, I use a lot of other products from TP-Link Kasa and they respond very well with my google integration.

I hooked it up to several different lights hoping I had a neutral wire. Ended up putting it in the garage instead where I knew that new wire were installed and had a neutral wire. For a DIY project, if you have a neutral wire it's stupid simple to install. You have to own a smart phone to set it up (or iPad), but after that its easy.Now, if the manufacturer would get off their rear end and make it so that you can install without a neutral wire, I would spend the money to make my house automated.

It works perfectly and installs very easily. The app is great to. I had no issues at all. I have 11 of this switches installed in my house. They fit in 1, 2 and 3 gang switch boxes with other switches without a problem. When they are turn off the light a ring at the bottom to see them in the dark.

As a non-handy man of my house, I am glad this device was relatively easy to install. All necessary parts were included and once power was on, adding the device to Alexa was a breeze through the Kasa and Alexa apps. It is wonderful to have Smart schedules for my garage motion activated spot light now.

Does not work will never buy again so this only work if you are in the house went out of town and the app comes up and said the light was on but my Neighbor said it was not and the app said it was on and got home and it was not but if you are in the house it works so I don’t plan to buy an more of these things

I don't know if the issue is the software or the hardware, but I set this switch to turn off after 15 minutes.  It works about half the time.  The rest of the time it stays on until you shut it off (like the old dumb switch)

I was looking for an affordable yet reliable smart switch with SmartThings integration. It’s a perfect match. Easy to install and super easy to connect to wifi. I am very satisfied overall. Hopefully it will last years.

Did a lot of research into what switch to buy..namely one that could connect to Alexa.  Bought this one, installed, easy set up, easy to link to my Dot and Tap. Works perfectly. Just download the mobile app for remote access.  Will be buying plenty more.UPDATE: I've now bought and installed three switches. The setup was even easier after doing the first one. They work perfectly. Scheduling is a breeze.  Have it set up for remote access which allows operation from anywhere.  Very happy with these switches. Well worth the money.

I’m not a strong person and am constantly bringing things in and out of rooms.  Also I often will be in bed or something and not want to get up.  This thing has solved the problem for me.  I bought like 8 of them and had my husband install them in strategic areas of the house.  The installation wasn’t that difficult, it appeared as I watched him do it, but he’s used to doing things like that so maybe for your average person it is, I don’t know.  Either way once set up I do not regret it.
Could not be more impressed with this product! I did not know how to do electrical work but I looked up a video on how to and did it!! And now I can control my ceiling fan with my Alexa and phone!
The idea was great but my house wiring was an issue.  Would have been easy to wire and use.  Had to return because didn’t want to pay electrician to come rewire my whole house at this time.

The back of this wall-switch unit is very large and may not fit in your electrical box.  Before you buy one make sure you can push all the wires and wire-nuts to the rear of the electrical box leaving an 1-3/8" deep open cavity/space to accommodate this unit.  (And before you do that remember to turn off the circuit breaker.)

The level of technology of smart switches and voice operated electronics is in flux. It gets better all the time. In addition to the Kasa Smart switch I also use some Phillips lighting system. I have far fewer problem with Kasa than I do with Phillips which becomes muley on occasion. If I had to do it over again, I'd use all Kasa switches. I reommend this product and would buy it again (and have).

I've got two of these so far in my house. They were easy to install (just swapping out basic lightswitches), work great with my Echo Dots, and make for less running up and down the steps when my kids leave the lights on.I plan on buying at least a half dozen more over the next year or so as I gradually change all the lighting in my house over to smart switches.

TP-Link Smart Switch integrated well with Amazon Alexa and controls my ceiling fan well. The only issue (docking a star) is that the switch protrudes more than normal from the wall. If used with the supplied single wall-plate this is not an issue, however if it is installed in a multi-way box with other switches a standard wall plate may not properly fit; I had to carve out the back of the coverplate by a couple of mm to allow room for it to fit over the switch.

This looks beautiful, sturdy and reliable. Overall, well built. TP-Link devices always makes me happy.The only drawback is, I cannot integrate them with Logitech Harmony or any Hub, which is compatible with Logitech Harmony. It can't be found as Wi-Fi devices as well by Harmony.

These switches were super easy to install. The app is clean and simple. I've been running them for months without a single issue.Just to note for perspective first time bites. Neutral wire is required.

I love all the Kasa stuff so this was not even a disappointment! It integrated great with google home and the app is amazing! I love this device! I think the best smart switch there is in the game right now at this price point!

I have had zero issues with my TP-Link switches and outlets.  I have had the power go out but they reconnected when the power came back on.  I control through my phone and Alexa with no issue.  Very simple setup.  Make sure there is a neutral wire for wiring up and you are golden.  I am looking into if I need the SR20 to get more out of my TP-Link products but not sure if I need it.  TP-Link, if you are reading this, i would love to try one out for free!  Anyway, my livingroom, kitchen, dining room, porch, outside lights, movie room and a few lamps are controlled by TP- Link Products.  Very convenient and has come in handy.  You can trust TP-Link.  I will buy more from you again for phase 2 of my smart home.

I think this would have been a great product if we could have gotten one that worked, upon installation the lights kept flickering the entire time.  We thought that we wired it wrong but that was not the case.  I did call the service number and they basically walked me through the same steps i had already tried, i gave up after that.

Purchased light switch for the light thats outside in front of my house. Installation was easy and the app setup was easy as well. Love that i can set up a schedule, now i dont have to remember to go turn on or off the light, it automatically turns off at sunrise, n turns off at sun down.  Love it.

Does what I need it to, I have it connected to my attic fan switch and using IFTTT I have it set to turn off my fan when the temperature goes above a set temp.  Working great for that.Recently all of my tplink switches have had to be unplugged and replugged when I reset my router.  For this one it means going out and switching my breaker to get it to reconnect.

Having tried at least 5 different brands of smart lights and switches, I've found TP-Link's setup to be the most straightforward and reliable, their hardware to be of good quality, and their software is well polished.  Even the firmware update process is smooth.  I cannot say that about several other "smart" switch/light brands. I have started adding more and more TP-Link products since purchasing this, and am very satisfied.

I have  at least 9 WEMO plug and light switch devices.  All work as they should, but recently purchased another WEMO light switch for another room and it totally refused to accept my router password.  Always, new hookups connected without a problem. Frustrated knowing  other devices were working with my current password  I decided to try the TP-Link as it was on a special sale.  Very easy to install after installing  KASA app on my tablet and updating Echo with the KASA app for voice activation.  Time will tell, but I think WEMO has some competition.

Fantastic.  Installation was a breeze.  The problem was connecting to the Wifi.  Took about an hour and couldn't figure out why it was constantly disconnecting from the wifi.  Finally realized that I had tightened the bottom screw mount too tight and it was permanently depressing the reset button.  loosed the screw and it connected and setup without further problems.  Works flawlessly with Alexa and the scheduling feature is awesome for when on vacations.  Wish I can scatter these around the house but most of my switches are 3-way switches.

I love the functionality of these switches but they are kind of cheaply made. When i had one i loved it and then installed them all over. I have trouble occasionally with pressing them and the light not coming on and having to press them again.

Great smart home product. Love being able to operate when not at home and establish schedules. Helps control power consumption and gives peace of mind. Loved it so much, bought smart switches for appliances and some cameras too. Also got the wifi extenders, this company rocks.

Works flawlessly. It never explains how to remove the beauty cover. I had to google it since it feels like you’re going to break it off. The wiring was easy and the app walks you through each step which was awesome. My wife loves having both the voice control and physical control (that you don’t get with smart plugs or smart bulbs). Would buy again if they get back around $30, but it looks great and works perfectly. Highly recommend.

I've only had it installed for less than a day. So I'm not sure if there'll be any problems down the line, but the instructions were very easy to follow and it was super easy to install. I have a few "smart services," and this was probably the smoothest one to pair with Alexa; it worked on the first attempt.

I have the Kasa outlet plug that I use it on a daily basis, so it was a no brainer to purchase this product. I hooked it up for my outdoor lights, and it works great! I initially had some issues trying to connect them to the wifi, but once I got one of them to connect, the others went in quick succession.

Even though the Kasa App gives you a way to enter your network credentials manually, this did not work for me. I first had to Un-Hide my SSID and then select it from the list of available networks. After the switch connects and is successfully set-up, you can then go back to hiding the SSID. I hopes this helps.We like this switch better than the other brand we tried because cosmetically it is cleaner / sleeker. The only time there is something illuminated on the switch is when the switch is turned off and then there is a small, subtle light ring that glows. Its not as bright as the picture would suggest.

Between bulbs plugs and wall switches I would choose a wall switch if it all possible because, although they require installation by someone who knows what they are doing... they are the easiest to use. If you have a lamp plugged into a plug chances are, 99% of the time, that lamp has an on-off switch. People turn off lamps without asking Alexa. A wall switch can be turned off or on manually without affecting its "open or closed" state.

The switch has trouble keep a connection to the network. I'm a tech professional and have ruled out all my equipment being the issue. One other thing I didnt like is the application requires permission to personal data or you can't proceed in using the smart features. I dont like giving my personal data away especially for free. Returning item.

Great product so far. Installed 2 of them - 1 to control the 2 lights on our front door and 1 to control the lights outside of our garage. I originally had analog timers but decided to replace them with these after someone gave me an Amazon Echo for Christmas. Easy to install (followed the directions closely) and configure with TP Link's Kasa app and was easily added as another smart devices that Amazon's Alexa can control.

Excellent product. The switch was very well package and arrived in good shape. Installation was strait forward and with basic electrical knowledge a very easy install. Connecting the WiFi was even easier. Get it connected, create an account and it’s up and running. Total install with registering was 10-15 min. I incorporated it with Samsung SmartThings making it very convenient for us.

I've used Wemo devices for years but wanted to set up another unit in the same house with smart switches and wanted them to be on another app.  These things are really great to set up.  The setup is straightforward, the companion app is simple, and the connection process is a lot more reliable.  Plus these show usage time per day which is kind of cool.  And yes they do work great with Alexa.  If you use the wemo manager app in the google play store, these actually work with that app too.

I was a bit concerned at first replacing a normal switch that controls my pool lights with this one. But after installation and hooking it up to my Wi-Fi it worked better than I expected. I’m so happy that I chose this light switch and can now turn the pool lights on and off with my phone app.

Ok what I LOVE about the Jinvoo app are the scenes which not only include scheduled on/off times but also weather, humidity, sunset/sunrise, and temperature. Think about the endless uses. I put one to control my coach lights and they turn on and off based on actual sunset and sunrise times that vary year round.

I put two of these in my bedroom, one at each enterance.  They are great.  I wanted to voice control my bedroom lights but each of my two ceiling fans in the bedroom have four lightbulbs each.  Using the wifi bulbs would have cost far more than using these switches.  Now I can keep the basic bulbs in and still control the lights with my voice.
This is exactly what I was looking for! I used to have the timer, which you had to manually program and it was a nightmare! This was easy to install and the app makes it so easy to use! Perfect!

big fan of 'smarting up the house'.  a little finicky to install.  bulky back of switch and an ill fitting foam backing for the face plate  make this more than a bit difficult to put in.  bought two.  one isn't installed yet because neither of us wants to do it...that said - it works well and now alexa can turn on/off the ceiling fan.  yes, well at two am when you're cold it's nice to just tell her to "turn off the fan" without getting out of bed.

I hooked them up, and it would not come on. The lights will not come on. So then I called these handymen who were not exactly electricians but they do a lot of electrician work. And they still cannot get it to come on when they hooked it up. I'm starting to think that the product they sent me was defective. I'm thinking of calling a real contractor but that's going to cost a fortune just to hook up something as simple as a light switch. 😠😣😣

Easy to install. The mobile app (Kasa) is well-built. Connect to Google Home seemlessly. I never has issue with wifi range, had 1 install in detached garage - far from wifi router, but still work. It allow convenience scheduling - through the Kasa app, not Google Home - by time or sunset/sundown time.

This was easy to setup and use.  The only issue I had was knowing which black wire was the load and which was the lead.  They are next to each other are labeled with a single label.  I had to switch them once to get it to work and after that, it was fantastic and easily connected with my google home.  I would buy again many times over!

Have a few similar products. Integration isn’t as easy as the others. Alexa tells me  “Isn’t responding” about 50%. Not sure what’s going on here. Fastest fios you can buy and 2 signal boosters. Not impressed.

This Kasa Smart Light Switch by TP-Link, was almost to easy to install. The electrical was easy,  linking to the internet was easy, and linking to Alexa was easy. Yes, I'd buy one of these switch's again.

This is a great product,  But if you do have a unit good bad it will become easier to throw it out and buy a new one.  I have over 30 switchs.  I had one stop working after 2 months.  Called support line,  after 1 hour of going back and forth with them, they are willing to replace it under warranty.*** You are responsible for the shipping and must ship the defective unit to them first,  then they will ship you a new unit.  So you need to buy a switch first to put in the wall while you wait for the replacement.

Works well, although not as fast as caseta wireless switches. But these are less than half the price of those. What I didn't realize is that this switch stays in one position at all times (doesn't toggle down). So keep that in mind when installing.

Very simple to install I never once installed it wrong. It works fantastic with Alexa. I feel like Bill Gates when I walk into a room. I have harnessed the power of the gods with speech. Also they have a really nice look and don’t seem to attract crud the way old light switches do.
