I have four of these now.  The first from a couple years ago and they all are still working fine.  Note they require a Wi-Fi router that runs on the 2.4GHz frequency band.  Will not work with 5GHz.  Also they cannot be used to replace a light switch that has dual switches (the ability to have two physical switches activate the same receptacle).  Works great as long as you know those two things.

i am currently having problems connecting it to my phone and alexa, i thought it was because the wifi from my router, so i moved it. didnt help. then i thought it was because the j-box was metal, so i changed to to plastic, didnt help. im wondering if this switch might be defective.***EDIT*** 2 stars to 5 stars. turns out i received a defective switch. they took care of my problem very promptly and worked with me to get my switch working properly. 2 thumbs up for customer service and the switch works great!

I have a few TP-Link smart plugs and wanted to upgrade a programable switch in the garage for our driveway pillars. Not sure why I waited as this switch works great and makes changing the schedule so much easier. I was unsure if there was ample wifi signal in my garage, but the switch works perfect.

This overall is a great switch however, I  had to go on YouTube to get more information on the black line/load wires as neither is marked. Apparently it dosent matter which black wire is "line" or power . Either way you hook it up it works. It would have been helpful to say that in the manual. That being said, I'm a retired IBEW48 electrician and feel that this would be very easy for someone to install the switch as long as theres a neutral wire in the switch box. You should have at least 2 white wires and 2 black wires in the switch box in your wall. If not, your going to need an electrician which was the case for me.

Alert! Alert!  Alert!  The HS200 is not designed for 3-pole lighting  configurations, only 1-pole.  What this means is that if you have more than one switch, such as a switch at both ends of a room or hallway, the switch will not work, you need a 3-pole switch.  It took me more than 4-hours of frustration to figure this out. I am returning the switches to Amazon since nowhere on the site does it mention this deficiency.

The switch doesn't fit in the box. The box is an "old work" box. It would be deep enough for the wiring and switch, but small bumps on the inside of box stop the switch about 1/2" in. Had to reinstall the old switch.I have installed these in other locations before. I just expected they would fit all standard size boxes.

I love these smart switches. I had to get an electrician to install but he said the installation was easy and it was fast too. Now I don't have to come home to darkness.I can turn on the lights around my house when I am going to arrive home late.

My house is old. My house the way it's wired you have a power a neutral and ground. This device didn't work for me. I will advise to make sure that you have 2 hot wires before buying this smart switch.

So I ordered one and it appeared to work for a couple days then started making my lights flicker.  So I returned that one and got another.  So far so good.  Hoping that the first one was just defective.  Setting it up is very simple and works really well with Alexa.  I will probably stick with this brand since it works well.  Hoping the first one I got was just a fluke.

Replaced unreliable 10X switch (well, it was) with this WiFi enabled switch to control my porch light. Perfect operation every time. Don’t worry about not having a ground wire to hook up, it works just fine without one. However, I had to modify the stock twin switch face place so this would fit. Looks wonky, but I don’t care! 🙂🤷🏼‍♂️

Wires were user friendly. Instructions could be a little better. However using the app was Great. I linked this brand with Nest and it works awesome. That’s one of my reasons why I bought this particular smart switch. Installation took a little longer bc I’m an amateur when it comes to electrical work. Very important you must have a white wire in order for this to work. I will buy a few more in the future.

Had it setup and working in 5-10 minutes. The light turns on/off via the app within milliseconds!Important feature missing: The ability to have the lights automatically turn off/on at sunrise/sunset would seem to be an easy feature to add (just tell the app the location of the light; this is a basic IFTTT function), but that ability is inexplicably not integrated into the app itself; requires IFTTT, which is probably too involved for many people).

This item is truly amazing...I can now tell my Amazon Echo Dot ..."Alexa...turn on the front light" and it's on! Or, "Alexa, turn off the front light" and it's off! Tip on installation....this item uses 4 wires....the two black wires are a simple single pole switch loop (the ones that went on the two screws of my old switch)...the white goes to neutral and green to ground. Remember to turn off power before doing any electrical work. Once installed,  follow the directions on how to create a TP-Link cloud account. Then, you link your Echo account to the TP cloud account and you're ready to rock and roll!

Worked great in my application. I wanted a switch that I could control from my phone and set a timer schedule for. Followed the video on YouTube to install. At first I wired it wrong by joining the two black wires from the unit together with the two black wires from the old switch.  Once I separated them with their own wire nuts problem was solved.  Very easy to join to my wifi and sign up for an account. Now I can expand the system.

I’ve personally used only Lutron’s smartswitch, so this is the second brand I’ve used and I highly recommend it. The installation was relatively straightforward. Although unlike the Lutron, this switch has the wires attached that you must connect to your houses wires. Only complaint, is the size. It takes a good amount of space, not too large by any means but definitely created a tighter fit. Other than that, I’m lovin’ it.

TP-Link smart plug. 3 StarsI really like being able to control my lights from any where!!! But the unit needs to be reshaped. Its next to impossible to plug anything else into the outlet. If you plug the TP into the bottom outlet it blocks the top one, if you plug the TP into the top outlet it sticks down so far only the skinniest of plugs will fit (even then I had to file down some)

Works great. At first my husband couldn’t get it installed correctly and it turned the power off in the entire room when switched off, but he figured it out and it works great. We had to change the bulbs to regular bulbs since we didn’t have the correct LED kind.The app is good and easy to use with the light.

These are definitely worth spending just a bit more to get the higher quality and better integration than the other smart switches and appliances. I use these with google home minis and they work PERFECTLY. I also use several Kasa Smart plugs and using the Kasa app I can link plugs throughout my home to the switches allowing for my smart switch to control several lights throughout my house.

I've installed two of these so far and they are overall a great product. They are fairly easy to install (I have zero experience with any kind of electrical work prior to this, just watched a couple of quick YouTube videos), easy to connect to your wifi through the app, and a very user friendly app interface. The only things preventing a 5 star rating is the fact that the lre is no dimming capability and the wires are connected in to the switch permanently, so you have to use wire connectors (which come with the product) to install the device in your wall (instead of just connecting the existing wires in the wall to the switch via a screw). This is not a big problem, but it makes fitting everything into the wire box in the wall more challenging since the connectors take up space. Once you get everything in, you're golden.

I needed an electrician to install it due to my wiring not being as simple as the instructions implied (switches next to each other connected). I just wasn’t comfortable doing it myself. But ever since the install the switch has been awesome. We use it to have our porch light on a schedule.

I found this easy to install, but was thankful I had a full-depth box.  It is deeper than a standard switch.  But, it installed well, found the network and integrated with Alexa very easily and quickly.  I will be buying more of these.

I mean, the product works as advertised, but zero installation instructions meant I had to scrounge the internet and still got the wiring wrong 3 times in a row and had to look up how to reset WiFi settings. Also software does not have sunrise/sunset options, which was pretty disappointing.

I love this switches, I have done my entire home with these. They are easy to install, easy to set up with alexa. And they work really well. I love using the Alexa app with this. you can talk to it, you can just push the screen on your phone or you can set up a schedule or routine.

Requieres a neutral wire. That's why the one star. Also has limitations to have other products, such 2 or 3 sockets in the same box, wall sockets and more variety of smart stuff. If you want to automarize one or two sockets is ok. For an entire house with 20+ devices wait for another solution.

I have installed 4 of these switch's in my condo. As long as you have access to a neutral wire, this works flawlessly. It's also super user friendly. If you have connected Wi-Fi you can hook this up.Update: I have had the switch's for over a year now in my condo, they are perfect, no troubles whatsoever. One trick I have learned with installing multiple smart home products now is to understand dual band routers 2.4ghz and 5 ghz. Make sure if the smart home device is only 2.4 ghz, you use that when installing.

I chose these switches because of the innovation TP-Link has made with smart homes and use of the switches without a hub is great.  The Kasa app is easy to configure with the switches.  I have installed them in every room in the home.

My electrician installed this successfully. My big problem is that I cannot connect it to Alexa. I have tried everything. So I have another on off switch.I do not recommend this unless you are super wi-fi savvy and do not have a problem with an unsecure wi-fi signal in your home.

This thing is pretty great from a stand point of use.  Installation however was a nightmare, the housing for the switch is made of a thicker plastic, which i had to cut into and modify to get the switch cover plate to fit flush to the wall.  Wifi Set up was fairly easy and works with google home.  fairly expensive, but the piece of mind for turning a porch light on and off is really nice.

I so love this thing. I have the little plug in ones that go into outlets, like all over the house, but I needed a switch one because I have a light thats hard wired. This thing is awesome. It works perfect, i love the led light on the switch so you can see it in the dark... yes, even though it can be voice controlled, (alexa can be a pain at times... if you have her in your life, you know the struggle), and it looks nice. I highly recommend this.

So, my first changing a light switch and getting a look at the wires behind the wall. From turning off power at the breaker, to bring able to use the voice command and setting a schedule took ten minutes. I can operate this manually, by voice and by timer.

This is my first smart switch.  Wanted to have my outdoor lights go on without having to turn flip a switch all the time.  Switch went in with no problem.  Programing it using the Kasa app and integrating in with Amazon Alex were a snap.  Will be switching out the rest of my light switch over time.

I have had this smart switch installed for 3 weeks now and it is great. It is used for the front porch light and for the amount of travel we have done this summer, it has nearly paid for itself. No more leaving the porch light on for days. Now, I can simply create a schedule and have it come on and off whenever I want. Plus, I no longer have to trudge downstairs to turn it off each night.
The product was delivered on time, packaging was in good condition, the product was in good condition and appeared to be as described, and after use met expectations for fit, form, and function.

Easy to install, comes with wire nuts and the Kasa app walks you through the installation. The only thing I had an issue with was there wasn't enough room in the switch box for the device to fit. I didn't realize the foam pad could be used to space the switch out an extra 1/4 of an inch. I took it out and added the pad and it fits just right now. Easy to configure, no smart hub required, runs on my WiFi and works great with Alexa, I love the TP Link products. I think a few bulbs might be needed next.

I bought this as a part of a home automation project I am doing with in-wall switches, plugs, and plug-in plugs. It works extremely well, and the Kasa application that goes along with this device works perfectly, You can set routines, group them, and the response time is nearly immediate. This works well with Alexa too, and it was very easy to pair them to my home WiFi. I'm very happy with the purchase, and will continue to purchase TP-Link devices for my home.

Easy to install, great app, adds fantastic smart home functionality. I have four of these scattered around my house and am trying to convince myself to fork out the cash for some of the three-way switches as well. Works great via their app or with Google Home/Amazon Echo/IFTTT. I also have these working great with the Logitech POP to essentially turn single switches into three-way switches (the POP went on the opposite wall and toggles the switches). Can't recommend enough!

Easy setup and great app to control it. Setting up the switch was very easy and the app works flawlessly which was a huge plus! Highly recommend this to anyone looking for an easy way to set a schedule for a light or just wants to control it from their smartphone

We bought this to use with our Amazon Echo. It was easy to install and easy to use. We've since added a TP-Link Smart LED Bulb to our stairs to eliminate the need to fumble with a switch at night. The app is intuitive. I love having the option to control via voice when I'm in my home or via the app when I'm away, and both methods of operation have worked flawlessly thus far.I'm already considering buying another switch or two.

works perfectly, I am a girl and I was able to do it myself. EASY! (if you have electrical connections that are similar to the instructions)overall. the plugs work awesome! they work right on their schedule, Alexa works nicely with it too.. and I couldn't be any happier with the app!

Greatest aid for my precious toes & shins! I installed this on the bedroom so I can leave the lights on as I head to bed & per them off once safely under the covers.I also installed one for the security light at my door. I work 2nd shift, I set the timer so it's always on when I get home & off with the rising sun (unlike me). Saves a great deal on my energy bill.

I finally got a chance to install the thing, it's junk. the other one is working fine in the same place so it's the switch... probably too late to return and tp-link customer support is less than helpful. I will throw it on the growing pile of expensive technology that failed.UPDATE: TP-Link is sending, slowly but sending, a replacement. Only took a few weeks to convince them it was dead and another week to get it.

Following wiring instructions per Manual and Youtube, tried to turn the lights on but they just flickered once and would not stay on. I checked several times to make sure the connection including Neutral wire are connected. The switch didn't work in manual either. Repeated factory reset 3 times without any success. But my plugs are working fine. I wish I could use the switch using the same App. I'll wait until someone has the solution to  this problem.

The only issue I have had was with the install. It's just a bit bulky, so I had to really organize the wiring in the electrical box to fit it. The app is decent. Has built in things to schedule on/off and you can do voice controls with 3rd party apps. The connectivity with other stuff is the best part, lets you control it with what you want, not just the software they give you

Works great.  I use to turn on/off outside lights.  Easy to install, but a bit bulky so it can take some effort finding room amongst the wires in the outlet.  Works with Google Home and Alexa.  I have it installed on Google Wifi and had no issues connecting to WiFi.

This is the only thing I have got to work after 3 days of trying. Three other types of devices still won't connect yet, but it has only been 3 10 hour days trying. Amazon Echo Support Group in almost impossible to get to and could probably assist.
Easy to connect, 802.11g. Any phone can connect this without issues. (less than a minute)Works great with Echo. Echo device discovery is quirky, so bear with it.

We have these switches throughout our home. They’re awesome! I can view which lights are left on and turn them off with my phone or Alexa. You do not need a hub to use these!!!Worth the money! Easy and super convenient!
I bought 2 of these switches and I really liked them and Now it will not let me buy a third one. If you want more than 2 of them Amazon will force you to buy them from an outside vendor! Be Aware

The switch keeps disconnecting from the WiFi network and is “unreachable” from the Kasa app. It is also unusable manually to turn the lights on, because after about 20 seconds it automatically turns them off. I have deleted the switch from the app and reinstalled it many times, studied the settings, troubleshooting and FAQ’s to no avail. Useless waste of money. I feel cheated.

We have four of these switches throughout our home and we absolutely love them.  They were easy to install and set up!  Thank you for this great product.  We originally purchased GE smart switches, but could never get them to link up with network.  These were a snap and have worked flawlessly since we installed them.

Awesome!!  Can now remotely turn on/off lights either through the App or Alexa or Alexa App.  Can also set up different programs per day if desired.  I have our entry lights set to turn on at dusk every day, and then have a different off time for each day just so it doesn't look like a single daily pattern.  No longer have to come home to a dark house if we leave during the day and return late.

The light Switch is easy to install and I have a number of them located throughout my home. They work well with Alexa and the Kasa android app. They do require a neutral wire so you need to be aware of how the wiring in your home was installed. The are a number of installation videos on the TPLink web site and other locations on the web. These switches are ideal for those who are not fully ambulatory. You must have an internet connection for the switches to work.

This product works well and does just what it should. We have several TP Link smart items in our home (bulbs, switches, outlets) and they all function very well. This wasn't always the case but they have ironed out the bugs in the firmware and these are reliable now. Very few dropped wifi connections, works perfectly with Alexa. Would definitely buy again.
Love these. I out them all over my house. I am looking to add them to my shed since I keep leaving the light on (I have dogs and walking the backyard in the dark is like trying to avoid landmines)

Love this, only wish it was more affordable.  If it was, is put them everywhere.  We put this on my front porch light so I can schedule it on a timer, and use my phone app and echo to turn it on and off as we arrive or depart. Works great!Update:. I'm now using ifttt and stringify to automatically turn this on when I arrive home after dark based on my geolocation.  Pretty cool!

The product is great. Once installed, it worked as it should and there were no problems adding it to the wireless network and controlling it with Alexa. I really love the fact that I don't need a hub to operate this device.The installation instructions were a different story. There were none! I went to get the manual from TP-Link's site and they were not very clear as to how to proceed with my home's wiring. I ended using a competitor's manual in order to get it installed.

I have houses in 2 different time zones and have to adjust times my lights go on and off. This has worked out very well. The inability to have the devices timed in the separate time zone is an inconvenience that at times becomes frustrating.

I love all other TP link products but not this one. There was no way to wire it if you have a neutral. I wouldn’t suggest this item if you’re in a home built in 1954. I believe that TP link should fix this then they would be batting 1000 in my book. I just can’t recommend this one product to people who have older homes.
I had bought a couple other wifi switches and they weren't natively supported in smartthigns. I switched to these and couldn't be happier. I have now purchased 12 of these and really like them.

Easy to install and setup. Problem is, it's dropping the wifi connection all the time.  When I first installed it it worked great for about one month. Now, about once per week it drops the wifi connection. A simple reset fixes the problem in about one minute. Still, it happens about once per week for the last 3 months.

Liked Kasa app instructions.  Straight forward wiring.  Wires easily identified on the back of switch. "Neutral" wire connected to white bundle in box.  Wire nuts made easy to connect.  Using with my ECHO Dot.  Watch YouTube if uncertain.
Love TP-Link products. Always have great reliability, and this switch is no exception!Easy setup and no trouble connecting to network or Alexa.

I love being able to use the away feature on my vacation home.  The random on off gives the appearance of being home much better than a static time.The app is super easy to use but I do wish it included multiple locations.  I have other products in a different house in a different timezone so the times are always off.

Well from the kasa smart page it says dimmer! Clicking on this takes you to this item so I just bought 3 of them! should have read closer before I did this but on their page it clearly says DIMMER! (See attached picture!) So it doesnt do what it says and is deceptive so a 1 star it is! Already hooked it up so I don't want to bother redoing them ATM. Otherwise everything was easy to setup and works fine as just a switch!!

This is a really tight fit some junction boxes.  My box had the tabs on the top that were held in place with short screws but they came into the box by 1/8th of an inch or so.  The housing on the HS200 was too tall and did not fit in the box so I wound up cutting away some of the plastic to make it fit.  A hack I would rather not do.

This switch works great with the Kasa app and with Google Home. I don’t have Alexs. Why does Amazon refuse to show or mention Google products. How childish is that? The Google Home products are great, and I would never say that Alexa products are any less great. Grow up Mr. Bezos.
Crap. Stops working in just a few months, more $ they steal from you and the product goes in the garbage.  I’m so sick of these disposable crap scam products.

Once installed these are great.  However you are required to have a neutral wire at your switch location.  This may be typical now in new home builds but is not in most homes built 10 years or longer ago.  You have to run a neutral from some where to the switch which can be anywhere from difficult to impossible to do without removing drywall.

I ordered 3 Kasa item: this bulb, a switch, & outlet. They are easy to set up and work reliably.  PROBLEM : only can be controlled by one account.  So fine if you live alone but how can my wife turn them on or off if I’m not here ?  She can’t because NO SHARING. So the programming is clueless !!! I also have a Ring device.  Programming allows device sharing.  But Kasa too stupid to factor that in.

Purchased these as part of the first steps in home automation.Setup was quick and easy, although you do have to setup an account to get them connected to your local WiFi.  After that it was a breeze to connect it to my home automation server *and* amazon Alexa.  Now I an control on/off from my apps on the phone, or through our echo devices.

The switch works as advertised. Installing it was a challenge as the switch housing is larger than a standard switch. I was finally able to get the wires in the electrical box out of the way to get it flush. This is my first smart switch, so I have not compared to others. The cost did go up $15 since my purchase, so I am not sure I would say it is worth the cost now. It does work well with Alexa.

I installed these in my wife's studio (and studio porch) and on a set of LED string lights for the garden and elsewhere.  Once I did the first two - I realized their use for so many other places!  (I'm still buying more - like the garage light I always forget to turn off).  If you can wire a light switch - you can wire this.  The App is simple and integrating with Alexa is as simple.  Yes - I am a COMPLETE FAN !

installation was simple, thought this was easy.  Then it would not connect to my wifi network.  On with their support for over two hours and am now escalated to a senior engineer.  Do not waste your time

After installation, all three of my switches worked perfectly, both with Alexa and with the Kasa phone app - for a few months. Since then, I have had to press the reset switch every second of third day to get them to work again. Have this problem with all three switches. Am looking for an alternative.

Great product and works fantastic with the app.  It would have gotten 5 stars if they could just figure out how to make it a bit smaller on the depth.  I installed two of these and both times I had difficulty getting it to fit into the original electrical box that was already in the wall (no my home isn't old).

Bot to run a rear deck light, out of the box, wired in about 30, needed to confirm the neutral wire.  The switch was on the first floor in the middle of the house, Apple router about 40 ' away in another room, took three trys to connect, then working. To start have 2 othet smart plugs for light, fun creating the scenes. Like the random away settting. Will map out the next purchase of devices. Would prefer a connection to homekit, yet maybe later.

The only reason I didn't give this five stars, is the lack of HomeKit support. Installation was a breeze and it works flawlessly. Seriously dead simple to install. The inability to control it with Siri and HomeKit is a bummer, but not a deal breaker.

I really like these switches.  They are very easy to set up.  They work with Alexa and the Kasa app.  I can't remember once having to reconnect these to the WiFi.  I have the plugs and the bulbs and have lost connection on the bulbs more than the others.  If I had my wish, these would come in two and three switch options.  The two switch option would be great for rooms with lights and fans.  The cost should be to add an additional switch.  You wouldn't have to add additional WiFi circuitry.  I'd give it 5 stars but there is no circuit drawing with these.  I'm an engineer and figured it out but there should be better wiring instructions for the DIY'er.

Heads up!! I was thinking that I would be able to  control other lights than the one directly connected to this switch (run a routine when the switch is pressed, e.g. with IFTTT) but it's not possible.Also, it just straight up didn't fit in my switch box so keep that in mind if your switch boxes are small!!

I've installed 2 of these and they're easy to wire up and then set up in the Kasa app. From there, it links smoothly to my Google home. I can set schedules and turn them on/off with a simple command.The only issue I've had is that it doesn't sit well with my screwless multi-gang box covers.

This switch took about 2 minutes to get on line and connected.  It's so easy and the interface is simple and complete.  Connection to Alexa is a snap too if you want to do that.  Functionality includes a schedule, timers, everything.I used this to a whole house fan connection instead of the analog timer that I have had on it.  What a perfect modernization of a classic piece of equipment (the fan).

I have integrated the Kasa switch with a contactor to change out the pool intermatic timer. Now I can set the pool pump schedule with the Kasa app and tell Alexa to turn on/off the pool pump. A cheap solution compare to the expensive Pentair smart pool pump!
Works great one of the easiest brands to pair with AlexaRecommend getting a box extension or cover that would hide it’s sticking out a little bit for traditional electrical box it’s a little big

This is my first smart switch, I have other smart plugs and bulbs throughout my house.  Installed this for convenience to turn my well pump on and off and set schedules for my sprinklers and it was a breeze to install and set up.  Highly recommended.
TP-Link has been a good brand for me, and the Kasa Smart Light Switch and App work great, not much else to say besides I will probable order more from TP-Link

if you've ever switched a light switch. This is just as easy. It does require a "constant hot" which makes sense, so it stays connected. I used the app and followed their instructions, and felt it was very clear. Hooked up to my system flawlessly. I already had a few plugs... so really a quick setup. Will be buying these again.
reliable and headache free once installed and work great. I still need one for a old switch in my home that has no neutral wire so i hope that comes out soon

I have installed these in nearly every switch in my house and Really like these.  Not only is the voice control awesome through Alexa but the glowing dot is nice at night.  Definitely buy a power meter for the install and test to make sure power is off.  I originally purchased this so when my wife comes ho,e all the light come on and the house is safer which she really likes, but now I am just using it for my own convenience and I think automation is pretty cool.  Install was easy can be pretty tight in the outlet box but i was fine and have installed nine now with no issues and they all work flawlessly.

I bought this switch to handle the bedroom lights without getting out of bed. Works perfectly!Installation was a breeze: open the box, download the app, follow the instructions, set up the wi-fi link and enable the Echo skill. Voila! Alexa turns off our lights without us having to brave the cold.
This is a good wall switch. It works great once is connected. That was the tricky part. Took 3 tries to get Alexa to recognize it.Once connected though, flawless.

I started with one and now have 6. They work extremely well and easy to install if you have newer construction. It can be tricky if the switch space is small. The piece that goes into the wall is much larger than conventional switches. Setting up timers and controlling remotely is a breeze.

A great product from TP-Link. I installed on the master bedroom. Installation was easy following the instructions on the Kasa app and everything is working great. Top quality as usual with easy setup in the app. I particularly like that all of my TP-Link switches and plugs just plain work perfectly out of the box. I'm really impressed with how easy is to create setup and control the light with alexa.

Had it for 6 months so far. It's awful! Customer service is awful too! When I call they tell me to redo the setup..... obviously I tried that before I called. It still doesnt work. We have a house full of smart devices and this is the only one that repeatedly gives us problems. It's in my daughters room and she told me tonight she just wants to get a regular light switch.I wish I could get my money back or a new one sent.
This was very easy to install.  Hooked up to the wifi easily. I went on the app and set a schedule for front lights to come on and go off! Love this switch!

I'm a realist.  I was anticipating issues with the wiring installation as well as with the WiFi installation and connection with Alexa.  I do home improvement projects all the time and it's just what happens.  But this time it didn't.  It just worked like it was supposed to.  I am very pleased and a little shocked.  I liked the step-by-step installation instructions in the app.  They were accurate and easy to follow.  The WiFi setup and connection to Alexa were straightforward and seamless.  My only regret was not buying this during Cyber Monday when it was ten dollars cheaper.

Great for houses that don't have wiring so it can be used with kasa receptacle wireless plug in switches. Works great and can be connected to a smart phone.  Turn on lights before you get home for safety.

I bought 4 of these to add to home automation. I have two running outdoor lights dusk to dawn. they work great. I have another hooked up to my bedroom cieling fan. i can tell alexa goodnight and goodmorning and she turns it on and off with alexa app and routine set up. they are the best!

I've now converted about 11 of my home switches to Kasa Switches and I'm sold. They have worked perfectly. I even picked up a couple of Kasa Smart plugs for lamps. I wish they also came in colors other than white, but that seems common with smart switches.
As soon as I received I installed, it only takes a few minites to install, easy install this the the 3rd switch and all three works perfectly, just makes sure to use commond send with wiring.
This product is absolutely amazing. Super easy to install and set up. Instructions are easy to follow and setting up on Alexa as well as the phone app is super simple.

This is an excellent WiFi light switch.  The app is easy to use.  It works perfectly with Alexa.  It was very easy to install.  No problems with it and ttmit's going on 2 years now.  I've bought morefor other rooms and would buy more if the need arises.

It took me about 15 minutes to wire this switch in and about half that amount of time to get on my wifi network to integrate with Alexa.  Everything works great and as advertised.  The picture makes the white of the switch stand out more than it actually does with the naked eye so I don't think it looks that pronounced of a difference in person.  Now I'm looking around the house for another location in which to install this switch!
Used these to control about 10 led can light style lights. Easy hookup and sm seamless integration with Google home. I would buy again. No issues connecting to wifi and it has always worked.

Let's start with the lesser issue.  The design sucks.  It's designed to look like a toggle switch, but it's really only a push-button switch.  The only way the switch itself indicates that it is ON is that a dim LED goes OFF.  Did the designers think the switch would only be used with lamps?The bigger issue is the reliability.  I installed this switch in my home in Colorado so I could control it when I am in Mexico.  When I originally installed and tested it, it worked fine.  When I came down to Mexico and tested it, it worked fine.  Now I am still in Mexico and need to turn it on.  "Device Unreachable".  WTF!  I can still access my networked thermostat in Colorado, but not this switch.  I asked my son to drive over to my house and check.  He rebooted my router, to no avail.  He then physically turned on the switch.  The switch is off-line and I can't seem to do anything about it while I am away.  A complete waste of money.

First of all, I hate doing electrical work.  Because of that I have avoided purchasing any smart switches that I would have to wire myself.  This one was such a good deal and only one switch, I figured why not give it a try.  Installed it in about 5 minutes.  Took another minute or so to pair to Alexa.  It works exactly as expected.

I liked the concept and it would have paired well with my other TP-Link products.  Unfortunately I have an older house without neutral wires in the light switches.  If you have an older house, be sure to inspect your switch wiring first to assure the single neutral wires are in the box, along with your two black (hot) wires.  Ideally you should find a green grounding wire in there as well.
Doesn't fit flush enough in the outlet box, therefore, you will most likely need a larger switch cover or modify it in some way to make it sit flush
Not sure how many times we got sitting down and had to get back up to shut the light off (glare on the TV). Now we don't have to.  We actually love all of our Kasa products.

I needed a switch for our exterior home lighting that I could program a schedule for.  This switch is perfect for that.  The app and the connectivity are better than expected.  I'm 100% pleased with this purchase.
This switch works well, just not with fluorescent fixtures.  I called TP-Link and they said it would work but it doesn't.  Tried replacing switch with a second one and it didn't work either.

Got this switch to control my front porch light and could not be happier. A breeze to install, fast to set up and works with all the major assistants. The kasa app is also nice to use, easy to navigate and not a lot of clutter. The WiFi connection has never failed.

The smart switch only lasted a few weeks then failed.  I liked the overall features on the web site but the switch kept loosing wifi access.  Then the physical on-off switch failed.  I removed it and put the old switch back in.
I own a number of TP-Link HS100s and needed a way to control a ceiling fan. This unit got the job done with a minimal effort with great results.

The switch was easy to install and connect. It worked for two weeks then all of a sudden stopped. Doesn’t work in the app or at the switch. The chat support kept running in circles and wouldn’t replace what appears to be a faulty switch. There is power to the wires in the box and after installing a standard switch the light turns on and off. Sent photos of the original install and then standard switch working, but the didn’t believe the switch was bad.

Doesn't work well shuts off randomly. I have updated it switched it to another area and it still does it. Got in contact with costumer support but they stopped responding. Can't return because it's passed its return date I'll be getting rid of it and replacing with a cheaper one I had on that worked better

This was easy to install and pair to my  Alexa. Works consistently. I have two of these - I use one for a ceiling fan and the other one for an outdoor porch light. I have the porchlight turn on and off automatically with sunrise sunset and it works well.
Easy install as long as you have neutral wire.Took me 10 minutes at the most to install.Easy Kasa App from start to finish to connect to moble phone.
I want to love these but I had a few issues.Pros:

The included instructions are: "1 download app, 2 install, 3 power-up" If you're not comfortable with wiring, you may want some help.  Fortunately, the in-app instructions are more detailed.  Integrates seamlessly with Alexa.  This is our third Kasa device - I expect we'll get more.

Installed them with help of an electrician... Connected to the app which we need to download in 2 min. Can't be faster. Amazed with the response time between the phone and the switches. No lag time when tried on wifi or in cellular signal from phone. Added simply to my Google home on top of the ease. Only question which I am waiting to see is that as they work only under 2.4ghz wifi signals .. if one switches to Google WiFi whether it will take it or not.
We’re using these for our garage and front porch lights. Setting them up couldn’t be easier - even setting the automatic timer so the lights come on at dusk and off at dawn was a breeze.

This works well with Alexa.  It was a breeze to install.  Set up requires installing the Kasa app and allowing to share info with Alexa.  Then scan for new devices on Alexa and it will appear on the device list.  I have it installed on a kitchen lights and after a little re-wiring it controls two light fixtures.This is a good thing to have and if you are thinking you might be able to use it, you are probably right.

Reasonably priced, easy installation and intuitive wifi connection process. It is very easy to get this switch to work and it works wonderfully.  I connect the switches to Alexa and it is fantastic.  And the ability to set timer to turn the lights on and off via the mobile apps is great as an security measure when we are traveling.

My opinion on this product is exactly the same as I have posted on their smart plugs. It works great. The Kasa app is easy to configure and has a lot of options.  You can control from outside your network if you want or set it to internal control only.  The only reason I docked it a point is that there is no native Windows software for it.  I have successfully run it in BlueStacks but it was a pain to get working.

Installed 2 of these and have had nothing but problems. They have trouble staying connected to Alexa and google home. Once you do a google search you will find this is very common. After a few times of going through the fix I have now just given up and will return both.

This is an excellent smart switch and works very well when paired with an Alexa device. Installation was very easy if follow the directions in the video. I am not an electrician and was able to install this myself successfully. You have to make sure you have a neutral wire prior to trying this, but overall an excellent product. Will be buying a lot more of these to replace my existing light switches.

I installed 7 of these in my house over the past couple of days and giggled with glee as I made an Alex group with all of them and turned all the lights off with one voice command. I love it! I want to get more for the bathrooms and hallways but my wife thinks I am being excessive. They are so easy to install and use.
I bought 37 TP-Link switches to replace every single switch in my house on Nov 2017. I have had absolutely no issues at all so far. Love being able to control every single light of my house.
App provides simple install instruction. Setup was beyond easy. Replaced all the switches in the house. We have smart plugs for lamps. Highly recommend this product. 99.99% uptime cloud service.

So I bought this after reading that you can use it on 3 way switches or more. After I got the wiring figured out, (wiring guide is in the app, not the box) and capped off the correct black wire, it works amazingly well. I have an install video I will post in a couple of weeks on YouTube. The only caveat is that without a hub, you loose some functionality like timers and such. That's why I give it 4 stars.
Pro:- Easy to install. There are four wires. Two blacks, one white, and ground.

This so far is the best and most user friendly smart switch I've found. If your network goes down it still works manually. The only way I think this switch could be better is if it had a dimmable option. The app for it is also the best app for smart switches, outlets, and lightbulbs. I've changed every light switch in my home to this smart switch. TPlink really has it together with thier line of products.

TPLinks are for the most part great. However, 1 out of 3 units in my experience have some issues with staying connected and reconnecting. I regularly have to reconnect one of my wall switches and 1 of my outlets. Same ones every time.

Installed this on my de-icing heat tape wall switch because I don't trust those outdoor thermostat plugs. Rather easy to install and set up. Even while vacationing in another state, I was able to turn on my switch during a snow storm and kept those ice dams away.Only slight downside is that with the wires, it is a tight fit in the wall box.
Have installed three so far and works great! Will definitely be adding some of there other products. I’m integrating with Google Home and they work great.
I bought these to allow me to control my ceiling fans in a couple of rooms. I don't want/need to control speeds so it works perfectly for that purpose.
Works by touching the switch, by Alexa control, or by app (including app scheduling - which is important to me).Even far from my router, they have no signal issues, and always work.

Very easy to install, works great with the app but more importantly works great with Alexa.  I use this as just a switch for a ceiling fan.  Note:  this will not control the speed of the fan, just the on/off functionality.  Absolutely zero issues setting it up.

If you are only using it as a wifi switch this product if fine. It did not work for the application I needed.  Overall easy to install and connect to app.Cons: No built in timer in the app, so you cannot have it turn off after a set amount of time - like turn off after 5 min.

Product not usable unless your switch box has a neutral wire in it.( HOT WIRE 1STTHRU SW TO LIGHT/ NOT THRU LIGHT TO SW) Product page/advertising is not clear on this issue.I bought as a gift in Jan gave it middle of Feb. now not usable or returnable after discovering issue. DO NOT BUY UNLESS YOU ARE SURE OF YOUR WIRING SCHEME,>
I have been installing these for a while for my family members.  They are very easy to install, as long as you have a neutral wire and enough space in your box.

2 (if not 1) stars for this light switch. I haven't been able to get it to work on a single pole switch that I use for my porch lights. I can connect to the KASA app and program the light, but the light will not turn on through the switch. Customer support has been good, not great, switch is wired correctly, but I cannot get it to work. Frustrating...anyway, I also own several T-Link smart lights and plugs. Both the lights and plugs are awesome...easy set up...easy integration with Alexa...and I love setting up scenes....one word though...there are two variations of the bulb. The more expensive  bulb can be set up in Circadian rhythm...the light changes intensity and temperature throughout the day. Great for an office application. The less expensive bulb has to be set up manually for intensity and does not have the ability to change temperature. Both are great and easy to use; however, the more expensive light has much more capability and is worth the $10 extra dollars.

I installed this switch on outdoor lights connected to a 20 amp circuit for better or worse, although the circuit does not see too much load. The installation was simple, if your have previously installed other electrical switches or outlets. I had a terrible time getting the device to see my wireless network however. Yes I was running 2.4 wireless 10 feet from the device, but it simply would not see it. Finally, I discovered the reason. My wireless network was not secure. I live in a remote area, my nearest neighbor is quite far away, as a result my home network is not secure to keep things simple. Well, this switch will not connect to a non-secure network. I logged into my wireless AP and setup a secure network and the switch connected right away. Took me hours to figure this out!!! Bad documentation!!! Otherwise, switch works well now including with Amazon Alexa.

I'm a huge fan of these switches. I have one installed in almost every room now that we frequently use. Easy to install. Easy to connect. Alexa syncs up with them easily. I've now installed the single switch and their three way switch. The three way was a little more intensive to install, but still overall it was simple and the best part is they just work! Having Alexa control our lighting via voice is so easy and simple with all the various lights placed into groups.
Its working properly, this is a replacement from another brand since they didn't support Google WiFi anymore so it became obsolete for me.

Chose this brand primarily because I'd rather stick with one brand for all IOT devices and use one app. Installation is simple with basic home DIY skills and tools. Setup is straight forward with the Kasa app, everything just works. The app is very polished and runs smoothly.

These can only be used on simple circuits in your home. I found out the hard way that this can't be used on circuits with more than one 3-way switch. ie if you want to control lights upstairs that have a switch both upstairs and downstairs that control the same lights. I'm sure if you pay an electrician he can rewire but I couldn't figure out a way to remove/disable second switch to make this work. Installed one in kitchen and that works great!

I installed mine in a standard 4 gang box. It fits, but it's tight. Take your time, remove a switch on either side. You may have to relocate wiring bundles in the box so they don't terminate behind the Kasa switch.Connection and setup is easy. This switch cannot be installed without connecting to a neutral (usually white) wire.
You can use this switch with out a neutral wire but you will not be able to use the wifi/smart home integration with out it. It will just be like any other regular switch.
Great price for to automate the switches.  Bought this to control my accent light switches without spending a ton of money.

This would have been great but unfortunately for me my house was wired without neutral wires. Normally that would not be cause to knock off 2 stars but the product listing does not say anywhere that you need neutral wires. There are other options available if you don't have neutral wires (don't hook the neutral wire up to your ground, it will power the switch and everything will work but you will be creating a deadly serious risk)
Great product! I have installed several around the house now and they are great. Works as described and are easy to install.

This switch can only control the light it's wired into and does NOT work to control with other TP-Link plugs or devices.  This is very disappointing as other brands of smart switches can control other plugs...  I confirmed with TP-Link support that this is a product limitation.

Wonderful gadget as we make our home smarter. It controls our lights on the sides of our garage door. It helps illuminate our drive way. It has it's own schedule on the Kasa App and it works wonders. Wifi connectivity,  no problem!

Package arrived. I opened it and inspected the contents. Found the direction sheet. Did everything in the order given. Directions are clear, to the point, 100% accurate, and given in grammaticaly correct English. I installed TWO switches, side-by-side, had them up and running, and integrated with Echo/Alexa in about a half hour.I will be purchasing and installing more of these as time passes. Eventually I will have my whole house automated.

Giving it 4 stars because the loud clicking noise when turning the lights on and off. Strange since there is mechanical moving parts. Its durability is called into question. The furtherest switch is 20 feet from the router but the signal strength is moderate at best. While it has stayed connected since installation, it would be a concern for locations further away from the router.

I bought two of these and I'm using them standalone.  Wiring was a snap and setup to the wifi  was just as easy. I am using a 25 letter/number password for my wifi and I had no problem at all.  I was able to keep my WPA/WPA2 security too.  I have read that with some brands neither of these are possible.The Sunset, Sunrise feature is great too.  It's also nice to be able to turn the lights on with my phone.

Bought one for my detached shop, where I too frequently leave the lights on.  I'd already installed range extender for the wifi, due to the 400' distance from the house.  This hooked up to my iPad & iPhone easily and it seems to always work regardless of how spotty or inconsistent the wifi is.  Unlike my wifi thermostat which seems to need rebooting every time it's encountered a weak signal.  Very impressed & in process of adding two more.

I am very pleased and impressed at how the switches and outlet plugs work. They consistently stay connected to our WiFi. When a power outage happens, they in a very short time connect with the WiFi. Everything from the ability to make and adjust schedules are simple and flawless. They also work perfectly with the Google Home App.

I have 4 of these in my house. They are great switches and fairly simple to install. I took off two stars because they lack ifttt functionality that the cheaper versions have. The Kasa skill doesn't have a trigger on ifttt (an "if") they only have actions (a "that"). This would be incredibly easy for the manufacturer to add and would make this a 5 star review.

I can't really rate the performance of this since I did not actually receive the correct item.  Obviously someone before me purchased it and returned it with a regular light switch and a foam rubber faceplate lookalike.  Does anyone look inside returned items to verify that they are the actual item being returned?  And then to sell it as new to the next customer?  What a pain!  And shame on the person who swindled the system in the first place. It's people like you that drive up prices for everyone else.  I will gladly upgrade my review once I receive the actual item.

a novice can install these items. Super easy to do (if you have any knowledge of how to install a light fixture). Connected easily to our wifi and now we can control the lights via kasa app. The app itself is also very easy to manage and control. Love this item.
I have 3 of these now.  They all have been 100% reliable.  They easily integrate with Alexa and have additional features using the app such as sunrise/sunset scheduling and random mode.

After purchasing and testing multiple brands, this is far the best one out there. It was easy to install, has is packaged well and works just as you would expect it. The app is very user friendly. Oh and it comes with the cover too, so no extra expense. Just wish the depth of the switch-front would match the standard switches, it needed a little engineering to fit when used with multiple (3 in a row) light switch.

This is a great product.  I had an electrician install the first one because I wasn't sure of the wiring but since then I have installed two more myself and they work like a charm.  They work great with Alexa.  All you have to do is download the Kasa app to set up the switch and connect it to your wifi.  Then you enable the Kasa skill in Alexa and have it discover the switch and boom...you're up and running.Keep in mind that it does require a neutral wire so if you're not sure about this you should have an electrician check it like I did.  They are fairly easy to install but they are deeper than a standard switch so sometimes the wiring inside the box will make it difficult to fit into a standard depth switch box.

The first time I rigged it up I had it controlling 3 bedrooms and one bathroom.... from just this one switch. After setting it up right, I couldn't be happier. I have it connected to my Echo. I have it set to turn my light on at the same time I have my alarm set for. Makes getting up that much easier. Saved me a lot compared to buying all the smart bulbs I would've needed.

Works perfect with my Amazon Echo and my 3 Dots.  Never had a single failure to respond.  MUCH better since I don't have to through another hub system.  It just works, its simple.  Just what everyone wants.  I un-wired two manual switches turning off/on 8 external house floodlights, replaced them with LED floodlights and wired them all into this one unit.  Worked perfect.  This unit is rated to handle 600 watts.
I use this with our google home assistant. I’ve installed 4 switches total so far and we love them! Especially the option to schedule security lights to turn on at sunset and off at sunrise.

....a very frustrating experience; I was exited about Kasa Wifi Switch, but after long hours of trying getting them to work, I hired an electrician who couldn’t get them to work either. Then, the return period passed, and I now have two unusable Kasa Switches.

That is what I wanted, total control of the lights, it was easy to install and program. once of the concerns was fitting it in the wall, by the overall size is pretty compact so It worked so well I expanded to bulbs and the outdoor weather-resistant dual socket.

Great Product, Easy Installation & Seamless Integration w/Alexa!Took just a few minutes to replace my old rocker type switch and with just three short steps I had it up and running with my other smart switches. Now I can turn my outdoor lighting off/on with phone, Alexa or set it to come on/off via timer setting. Ordering two more for other applications.

I own two of these now. TP-Link has become my go-to brand for smart home, Alexa-compatible hardware. So easy to setup in the Kasa app, then add to Alexa using the Alexa app. I’ve been very happy with their products. They just work.I also own their smart plugs for lamps and to make sure the tv stays off during specific chunks of each day.

These don't work with a 3 way switch which is what I purchased them for but using it on a single switch work just fine. We hooked this up using Alexa and it turns on our kitchen lights by just saying Alexa turn on kitchen lights

I work night shift and swing shift and sometimes have to work double shifts (ie. weird sleep schedule).  I got this to backup my audible alarm and it works very well.  Its extremely easy to set a on/off schedule event for the light and so far it's been very reliable.  I don't like that it has a dim LED on all the time that cannot be disabled but other than that it's great.

I looked for a while for a lower cost automated light control that you can integrate with Alexa and use as a physical light switch. This is an amazing product for both of these criteria. The install was very easy, but the switch does take up a lot of room in the electrical box so if you have a lot of extra wire it may be a tight fit. Overall, the connectivity to Alexa works well, but there are times that it does not work.

Very easy to install from start to finish it took me about 20 minutes, longest time it took was to connect, I had to try twice. I works great with Alexa. On the back of the TP link switch the are four wires two blacks, a white and a green. Hook the blacks to the black wires of the old switch, the order does not matter, the green to the bare wire or ground, and the white one to the neutral white wire, and that is it.

I am obsessed.  The only problem is that these switches only work on single pole lights, so if you have a switch, say, at the top and bottom of the steps, I don't think you can use them, which makes me sad, because most of my lights are controlled from multiple switches.  PLEASE invent multi pole switches and dimmers!!!!  I would replace every switch in my home!!!!

Great product.  I installed four and love them so much I ordered five more.  The pictured switches replaced two toggle switches that controlled my ceiling fan and lights.  I had no trouble finding a decora plate at our local hardware store that worked perfectly with these switches.

Bought this to replace our fan switch in our room.  We separated the fan and light into their own switches.  This worked well for the light.  The switch housing is bulky and can be tough to work with, but once I self installed it has worked flawlessly.  I highly recommend this brand and their Kasa app.  We also use it with Alexa and have had no issues.  Only wish it had HomeKit support
I like the open type of control, no expensive hub to purchase. I have installed a ton of these in various configurations, Switch and outlet types. Use on exterior lights.

Where I work we use TP-link products. The products are easy to use, easy to install and are more visually appealing. The smart switch works great with Alexa and Google. If I was to change two things is to have it more like a button than a button that looks like a switch.I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Also please have better instructions though It was easy I think it would be more helpful all around.

KASA Smart switch did not work. Support given HS 200 registration number and advised unit was defective. I had to pay to return switch to California, wait for online account to be updated switch received and then wait for replacement. Overall time to replace took over 4 weeks. Access to four smart plugs was somehow compromised during the original HS 200 install and installed to try and resolve issue. Contacting support was complicated and the staff member I spoke with could not communicate well and working on my on finally resolved issue. I product meets my needs.

Switch was delivered quickly; nicely packaged. I had to go online to get instructions to install but really the installation was pretty easy. The only negative is the points that you screw the switch to the box is much thicker than the other switches and made the trim plate stick out from the wall. This switch is in a 3 gang box. Maybe if it was a stand alone switch it would have let the trim plate lay more flat against the wall. Overall, a nice switch.Oh, and the app makes it nice to turn on the light as you pull up in the car.

I've purchased several of these so far and it's just a great simple product that works seamlessly with Alexa. I started with just one for my mom so she doesn't have to get out of bed when she's too tired to turn off the light which then ended with me installing it in multiple bedrooms, hallways, dining room, & living room. I'll probably end up buying a couple more when I see them for a decent discount but I'm very very satisfied with this product.
Was very hard to install. Did not give clear instructions. Did not work after installation.  I have 4 light switches will to give away free. That is how much I think they are worth
This replaced another wall timer switch with no wifi ability.  Much easier now that we have remote ability to control if needed and no battery inside to worry about.

I don't recall having any more trouble setting this up than any of my other smart home devices. Once I got a schedule setup (dusk to dawn) it seems to be holding steady. Not bad looking and a reasonable size to fit a std box. Jury is still out for longevity, but I've had it a few months and I'm still happy.
No directions in the box. They are in the app, concise & easy to follow.If I can install it anyone can.

KASA requires 2.4GHz wifi.  My router supported both 2.4GHz and 5Ghz wifi.  The phone google pixel 2XL was on 5GHz network and did not provide a setting to switch from 5GHz to 2.4GHz.  So this product was unusable for me without going through a whole bunch of other hoops (giving different names to my 2.4 and 5 GHz networks and connecting to 2.4GHz network).  I was not willing to do that and returning it.

Somewhat time consuming to install and get working (turning on and off) from the Kasa app.  Could not get it working with Alexa, but I will keep trying.  Also, reset switch is so tiny it is easily overlooked, with raised white letters on a white background.  Other markings at the top of the switch are black letters on a white background -- much better, but not needed for installation or trouble shooting.

My house is wired like Christmas tree lights from the 80’s, and I installed the switch in a 3-gang box. Needless to say, it took a bit of multimeter work before wiring it in.The switch itself is pretty easy to install and set up, and the app works pretty well. Overall, I’d buy a second if I wanted another smart switch.
My son recommended this smart switch based on his experience. It was very straightforward and the instructions were perfect. The only thing to check is the depth of the box.

Simple install. Prior too this, I have had no electrical experience but do know my way around technology. Even with that, this install was simple. Everything you need is provided (minus a screw driver). If the wife allows it, im installing 5 more.

Once you get your switch scheduled to turn on and off your pretty much set but that’s the problem I have a switch that I can’t schedule because most of the time I’m waiting for it to connect up to my WiFi and just when I think I’ve got it it won’t save it and I lose connection. Very frustrating.

I love these switches. It’s a little tough to install if you don’t know what your doing but if you do it’s easy. They integrate well with Alexa and google. These also have a really good app that is nice. I really like these.

Product works extremely well to allow you to easily put lights on timers. Only issue I have with it is it doesnt allow standard switch covers to sit flush against the wall, so if you have a two or three switch panel, the smart switch wont allow the cover to sit flush against wall. Very annoying.

We live in a crazy old house so I was afraid that this wouldn't work for us.  But.... It did.  I will definitely be ordering more of these products!The instructions were great.  The app actually walks you through the installation of the unit with very clear step by step instructions.  Connection to Alexa was also a breeze.  And, being able to set "sunset" as a time means that I won't have to deal with the fact that sunset can run between 4 and 9 here in Boston.
very convenient and handy, i have outfitted my house with these and set it up on a schedule. also works great with Alexa.

I have bought different brands of switches and plugs in the past. Never again! Kasa by tp-Link is by far the most dependable WiFi connection and ease of use I have found on the market. The setup is simple, connecting to Alexa is simple, and range to router has yet to be an issue. I cant wait to fit every switch in my house with a Kasa!

These light switches based on the other reviews were the best option for IOT light switches.  However after installing them, and getting them connected to the wifi, all they could do was make my lights flash.  I called customer service multiple times, they had no idea what to do, then I had a professional electrician come out, he couldn't figure them out either.  These were a total waste of time and money.  Still using the 1.99 switch I bought from home depot.

I use this to control outside lights at an office building with 2 units. In the winter it's nice to have the lights go off and on automatically at the end of the work day. It was going great then something happened and when I reset it it no longer had a local sunset time option which is what I really wanted but ran out of patience trying to find it again and just set the start and stop times.

This product must be wired so basic wiring knowledge is needed.  Setting up an account with their app, Kasa, takes only 1-2 mins and presto, turn on lights or whatever you're wiring it to...Instantly! Liked it so much, we bought their electrical outlets and now our outside party lights come on w/ a touch of the app!

I was disappointed to find you needed two live load/line connections for this switch; one neutral, 2 loads, one ground . My house has the neutral and the ground but only one load in several switch boxes I checked. I checked with their voice support line and their e-mail support lines and both told me this switch would not work in my situation. We have an older home but we had some major renovations done several years ago and the certified electricians said it was in accordance with electrical codes!So before you buy this switch ensure you have two load lines where you want to use it!

This is an excellent product.  Wish I would have purchased / installed this a long time ago.  Installation was pretty easy with the main difficulty being the wall plate cover.  My installation was in a two switch box which forced me to use the existing wall plate cover (not the one that comes with the switch).  This required a bit of adjustment involving shaving some of the plastic off of the existing wall plate cover in order to make it flush with the wall.  Not a big deal, just a little extra work.  Setting up the switch with my WIFI network, and configuring the KASA app was simple and quick.  I especially love the ability to turn on/off the switch based on localized sunrise / sunset times.

I have three of these now and will definitely be purchasing more. I wanted to say that I WAS able to wire one to a three way switch. You need to google how to do it because I have no idea how to explain it. Googling three-way switch wiring also helps. Looking forward to having these switches in every room to use with my echo!
I luckily had the necessary wires as required, I wasn't sure if my panel had a neutral once it was removed.It was easy to install, easy to configure.

My brother conecteted the light switch which replaced an existing switch so I can't speak for that but it looked to go as expected. Downloading and setting up the Kasa app was easy too. Also linking it to the Google Home was easy. Getting Google Home's voice recognition to work with it was an issue. After going over the setup many times and failing to get the assistant to do as I said I finally call Google's assist helpline. The issue ended up being I was using a Yahoo email account and not a Gmail (Google) account which is not told to you in Google's setup instructions. After deleting the Yahoo and making it a Gmail account in both the Google Home and Kasa apps the voice recognition works fine. So make sure you have a Gmail account setup. One last thing: make sure you turn on the remote function in the Kasa app settings so you can work the switch from your smart phone when you are off your internet signal.

I really like these things except they take up so much room and block the 2nd outlet on a standard outlet, and if you plug it into a 6-plug wall power block, it ends up blocking 4 outlets including the one it is plugged into (effectively giving you 2 usable outlets).

This switch is complete garbage. Once you go through all the setup it works for an hour or 2 then disconnects from everything and you have to do the setup process in the app all over again. Done it 5 times now so it's not a fluke. Do not buy this
followed instructions on the app it was super easy. does require electrical work. if you're a handy person should be no problem. comes with everything you need other than the hand tools.

I do not get anything about all this stuff, but my husband is happy about it and for it is enough.... only thing what he mentioned is light is not the same and bright like other ones next to each other
I use it to turn the front porch light on at night and off in the morning.  I works perfectly  Thank you very much..

Works as advertised. I have this hooked up to my front porch lights and have set a schedule for it to automatically turn on and off. It's also nice to be able to turn the lights on and off with my phone. The response when turning on or off with my phone is immediate, no lag. Great switch

While the app has some good features, the app does not offer the ability to turn off after xx minutes.  Example:  if the light switch is on for 30 minutes, turn off. This feature would almost function like a monition detector.  For my three shops where I have several of these switches installed, that would be a great feature.Other than that, it is a nice switch and works well.

This product has worked great for the past year. However, today I received a notification all smart life products will no longer be supported with IFTTT!!! You can't be serious Smart life?!? I invested hundreds of dollars because I can automate my home with multiple devices using IFTTT. I sincerly hope the company reconsiders and continues supporting IFTTT. Otherwise I will have to purchase all new replacements. DO NOT BUY IF YOU REQUIRE IFTTT FOR HOME AUTOMATION!!!!

Its easy to install as long as you know how to install normal light switches.  The setup is easy through the Kasa app.  The only issue I have is if I haven't turned the light on or off for a few hours and then try to by voice command it will say that it's not responding,  like its in a sleep mode or something and has to wake back up.

Way too much fun! "How a switch be fun?", you might ask. Having the power to turn the lights in my house on/off from my iPhone is awesome! Installation was simple since the Kasa app took me step-by-step through the removal of my old, manual light switch and showed me how to hook up the wires for my new Wifi switch.
Purchased to control our porch lights.  The Dusk to Dawn timer works great and we like having the capability to override the schedule.  The mobile app works well too.

This light switch is great! Works as advertised and the app is free. Easy to install, took less than 10 minutes. I wish they sold one with two switches and one wall plate, although other comments say it can be done. Overall, I think it’s a great buy.

I’ve tried a few different smart switches. This one is by far the best!!!!  It actually works every time, works especially well with Alexa.Updated- I've been running about 25 Kasa HS200 switches for about 6 months now, with zero issues.  These switches are rock solid compared to several others I initially tried.

So far so good - only been installed for a week, lol, but installation was easy, app is fairly intuitive, and been working fine. Make sure that your home includes the required neutral wire - older construction may not. Installation took less than 5 minutes and after installing the app setup took a minute or two. Will be adding more of these soon.

Easy install and setup.  Kasa has one of the better apps. This is a 4 wire install.  Had to rework some of the wiring in the box to make it work, but well worth it.I have a few brands of switches, these are my preferred option.
Works amazing!  Made a group along with it, so when I walk in my studio, the lights go on and the music starts.

...initially could only turn lights on and off when connected to my home wifi, but not from abroad, which is why I needed it... kept saying I needed to confirm my email, and to click on the "send new confirmation email" button, which I tried on many occasions throughout the day, but would not arrive to my email inbox, nor any of my other folders... then after about a day, for no apparent reason, it suddenly started accepting commands from my cell phone data connection, when I was not using my home wifi... not sure what changed... maybe took time for something to become linked on their servers...

Works as described.  I have two of these and they work perfectly.  I do not have alexa so i cannot comment on the connectivity with alexa.  I simply use the kasa app on my smartphone to control the device.
Perfect device to use with Alexa. I love the scheduling also. I use one for my ceiling fan light and one for the ceiling fan. Set up was very easy. It’s very reliable.
Faceplate latches broke. How do I get a replacement?  I'd actually prefer that it works with regular screw in plates like some of my other smart switches do.
Really easy to wire up, and connect to Alexa.  Used it for my front porch lights.  App comes with a timer, and no smart hub needed.  This is an absolute must have!  So glad I got one.
I bought 5 of these to install during remodeling. They were easy to install and work perfectly! Very happy with them.

They work really well. Look good on the wall and very easy to install. That's pretty much all you need from a smart light switch. This product does all that really well.I've used the old cover to install two switches side by side and they fit perfectly.

great wifi switch.  Used it with a python script that I found on github to automatically trigger thru-wall fans when the room with my wood stove gets to a certain temperature to move the warm air out into my house.

Bought 2 of these to try out with the Echo Dot. Love them and will be putting them in the whole house...except the garbage disposal, don't trust them quite that much....or the other people in the house.Having your hands full and being able to tell Alexa to turn the lights on is awesome and a huge help with 2 small kids walking into a dark house. I especially love that I don't need a hub.
Wifi network connection took me many tries to achieve.I have many smart plugs of different brands and this TP-Link was particularly hard to connect.
No regrets on dumping overpriced, semi-reliable Wemo for TP-Link/Kasa. Kasa is much more reliable, not to mention affordable.

The switch came with pig tails to connect to the source and load wires which for me made the installation easier than connecting the source and load directly to the switch.  I used the later connection method for the smart switch I replaced with the Kasa switch; it was cumbersome.  The smart switch required a hub and I was having issues with the switch and/or hub.  The Kasa doesn't require a hub and has been working flawlessly.

Was able to get switch installed with solid connections to hot, neutral, and ground. Connecting to the Wi-Fi was easy.Unfortunately the switch does not work at all - can hear the relay inside the switch clicking both when controlling remotely and when manually using the switch but it doesn’t seem to be making a connection.

I have an oddly located switch in my house for a backyard light, instead of relocating the switch to a more convenient location I figured I'd try a smart switch. Installation was very easy, created a TP-Link account and had the switch paired with Alexa in no time. This was way cheaper than calling an electrician out to relocate the wiring.
I bought 2 and installed them side by side they work great without a delay. I use alexa with them and love the ease, I can sit in my chair and turn on the lights.
Complete junk. Lights flickered and would never connect. I have other brand products that’s are always connected with no issues.
This was a breeze to install and setup. Love that I can now automate my exterior light by scheduling it for sunrise/ sunset.

I've had this for about awhile now and it works like a champ in the garage.  This thing is much more convenient than I thought it would be and it's totally worth it to me.  It sticks out a bit but does exactly what it was made to do.  No issues.

I bought the plugs after buying and installing a TP-Link switch.  If anything these installed more easily, and (like the switch) worked just as advertised. They (like the switch) have been flawless in operation. When prompted, Alexa discovered them without problem and they do just what I want them to do.  Directions are clear and I had no issues installing them.  So far, they are working perfectly.  But what kind of expectations should one have of a switched outlet?  Mine were that they turn on and off when requested.  So they are perfect.

This switch was easy to install and set up.  I love being able to set my outdoor lights to come on automatically at sunset.  I also have the switch hooked up to my Echo devices so Alexa can turn the lights on and off with a voice command.  The only issue I noted is that you must have a neutral wire in order to hook this up.
What a great device. Installs like any other light switch. Wifi setup is straightforward and Alexa integration works flawlessly. I'll define adding more of these in my house.
Installation was easy.Integration with Alexa and Google home was easy

This TP-Link wifi switch is the best in my opinion.  I have purchased about 10 of these switches so far and they have worked perfectly for a long time.Easy setup and wire, connects well with google (all I have) ... nothing bad to say at all!
