Works fine. Easy to install, you must have a neutral wire in addition to the basic two wires the switch uses.  I have it in a 2-gang box installed beside a standard decora switch.  I had no problem with the opening size in the standard decora 2-gang switch plate from the local big box hardware/lumber store that was 87 cents -- it fits perfect and does not touch the reset button on the smart switch.  The wings on the switch are kind of thick plastic and hold the plate a bit off the wall, the standard switches are thin metal and press almost flat against the drywall.
The page is for the light switch but the reviews are for the plug in module.The add page is as screwed up as the product ( light switch).

Took a bit of time to install hardware as the video is not quite what I have. Luckily there was power in the box.The back side has a big section and barely fit but it did fit and worked  the first time.

I had purchased the TP-Link Outlet and loved it, worked great!  Wanting to stay with the same Kasa app, I searched for "TP-Link Dimmer switch" and this was a top result with an Amazon "Best Seller" tag on it.Perfect!  --> Purchased it  --> Installed it --> said "Alexa, dim bedroom lights"  --> response from Alexa: "bedroom lights doesn't support that"

Great product so far, had them installed around my house at about a year ago. No problem with installation, works as expected. Works great with Alexa. I’m planning on buying additional for the rest of my house

The white ring is on when you turns off the light, so it’s been a huge pain for us in bedroom. The white ring is too bright for us light sensitive people! Plus I don’t like that you have to press the bottom panel for both on and off. It’s just not as intuitive.

I've owned 2 light switches and 1 plugs for about 10 months and keep buying new ones. They looks nice and works perfectly out of the box (unlike the wemo one I returned that decide to do a firmware update during my initial setup and brick the device). Now my 5yr old's favorite thing to do is "Ok, Google, turn on the TV" :)
Love this. Works great. My husband installed this in about 30 minutes.  Easy instructions.  Connects to Alexa.

This switch works perfectly and it installed perfectly in a three gang box without any issues.  Had the switch installed and up in running in about 20 minutes.  My plan now is to convert the whole house over to these great smart switches.  The only issue here is I wish they made these switches in a beige color since this white switch really stands out next to my other beige switches....but that won't stop me from buying more!!!

Great product! I am an electrician and bought it for controlling my pool pump. I ended up hooking it to a low voltage transformer to a double poll contactor which I hooked up to my pool pump. I linked it with Alexa and now I tell Alexa to turn on my pool pump. Pretty cool for a fraction of the cost of a wifi pool control. Keep in mind that the max amps on theses things is about 2 or 3 amps so it will do lights or maybe a ceiling fan or a low voltage transformer. Also must keep in mind that it can not be exposed to the elements. For indoor use only. Most switches are inside anyway but for outdoor switches, you may have to figure out how to get it inside. Overall love the product! Great price and great product!
Just amazing.  The Kasa tutorial that comes with the setup directions is fantastic.  Easiest setup to Wi-Fi I've ever had.  Thanks

Works well once installed. I installed in a 2 switch box which was a tight fit. Definitely make sure the neutral is in the box and connect the white wire to the switch white wire or it will not work. I also used a different switch plate (other than the single one that comes with the switch) that had the large hole for the smart switch and a regular hole for the regular switch. I had to fiddle with it to get both to fit properly. One gotcha is if you don't get the switch plate on properly it can accidentally hit the reset button on the bottom of the switch and keep it pressed in. This threw me off for a while until I figured it out and got the switch plate on correctly. Now that it is in all is well - programmed it to go on at Sunset and off later in the evening with Android, and can control it from Alexa or Android phone. Good product.

I have some Linear switches, and they were making clicking sounds, and the lights they were controlling were flickering.  I bought this as a replacement, and it worked fine.  I'll be swapping out my switches with these.  Be aware, however, there is no Samsung SmartThings integration with this switch.
I got this for some switched outlets in a room. I installed it, and it works great, with and without Alexa. Good product.
Very easy to install, simple instructions to follow. A great and easy way to control my lights in the house.

These will be great when I figure out where to put them, but they are not 3-pole switches and will not work on circuits with two switches. This was not clear from the amazon listing, but is very clear on TP-Link/ Kasa support page...so do your research if you are new to smart devices and not an electrician. There is a third version for dimmers.
In my situation I bought a new faceplate. It works very quickly. Setup was a breeze. I have three of these now.
Works well. Easy integration!!Only flip side is smart actions are limited to 3. This can overcome when u integrate wit Alexa n create routines.
Bought three, the first was defective. The second didn't see the wifi network. The wifi is the correct 2.4 GHZ. WeMo switch is a better product.
I love my Kasa Smart light switch because it was easy to integrate with my Alexa.  In addition it is a lot nicer looking than thin cheap light switchs.

Cool switch, I use it for my outside LED flood lights to turn them on/off at sunset/sunrise to keep the dregs away.  The app is very intuitive and easy to use.  Discovery took less than a minute and I was up and running, plan to buy more!
Kasa products just work and this light isn't an exception. I love how all of their products work seamlessly in their intuitive app.

Very nice indeed.  It was easy to install, synced to phone app immediately, and works perfectly.  The instructions don't really give you the information needed to sync with Alexa though.  I had to do a google search just to find that the settings in the Kasa app had to be changed to remote on before Alexa could see it.  I will definitely be purchasing more of these and of the plugs for the house.

I have had this installed for just about a month now and it worked great the 1st week. Then like a lot of people here it has been nothing but a hassle since. As we speak I tried connecting it again to any one of my 3 Wi-Fi routers and still nothing. Also just to clarify I have an electrical engineering degree from RPI and build computers so I know what I am doing. I give it 2 stars because it was very easy to install and initially set up. But I certainly would never buy another TP-Link smart anything. It does work as a normal switch which is all it is truly good for. Hope this helps someone before they waste $40 on a useless "smart" item for their home.

Before you purchase make sure neutral (white) line is available in the box (it should be but).  Easy to wire and setup. Works great.  Even on sale a little pricey.  If they were $20/ I'd probably have a houseful of these things but at $30 it's not worth it to me.

Tried to install these ourselves, but the wiring in our house was different than expected. Ended up hiring an electrician and he made it look so easy. Totally a DIY job if you have a newer house. So happy with these switches. We installed on our front lights so we can program them to come on every night, but can still control easily at the switch. Definitely would recommend these and would buy again.
I am very satisfied with the easy installation and set-up. I use with Echo Dot. Works flawlessly so far.
Kasa only supports 2.4 GHz wifi.  My system was automatically bumped up to to 4.0 GHz at the beginning of this year. No devices supported thru Alexa work any more.
I love this switch! Well designed and engineered. Connection to WiFi was flawless and in app intergration with Amazon Alexa. I would give this product 6 stars if I could. Highly recommended.

Works with Alexa. Installed myself no problems. Switch works lights manually. Connected to Alexa and now I can say "Alexa, turn on the lights" and boom they turn on. Sweet. The app also works to turn lights on or off.

I have NEVER worked on a light switch before. These were so easy to install and get the app up and running and super easy to set up to be controlled from your smart phone. I find myself just sitting here turning my lights on and off. Currently waiting for my 3 way switches to complete the lights I wanted to be able to control. Thumbs up..👍👍
Easy installation. No problems connecting to the wi-fi. Easy to program after downloading the free app. So far, so good.

I have multiple of those switches around my house.  They are placed well within a WiFi signal but they keep on getting disconnected from the phone app.  Lately one of them even randomly turns on.  I wish I would not have bought them.
Very easy to install, this was my first time replacing any switch & was able to replace my old switch with this in 20 mins.It works really well, love the app.

Worked great at first but started having issues and I have not been able to reconnect to network since.  The switch is also not compatible with Wink or many other hubs so you must download its app which is not very user friendly.  I do have a TP-Link router which I like but have not been able to use it to connect.  Again, app not user friendly.
Awesome gift for my parents, they were able to set it up by themselves and they are boomers! should be a testimate to how easy the setup is.
Installation was straightforward & fast.  The Kasa app loaded easily.  Pairing the app with the switch was no-brainer simple as was the pairing with Alexa.  It works perfectly & I am really pleased.

I needed a new single pole remote control switch to replace an older switch. I got this in under 24 hours, had it installed in 15 minutes, no problem fitting in existing 3 gang box. Downloaded app to my Android and IOs phones and it works fine. Can't beat the price and the simplicity.

NEUTRAL WIRE REQUIRED.  I never thought of it, and I think it should be front and center.  I was fortunate in that I had the ability to run one with only cutting one large hole in a closet ceiling.  Beyond that, so far, seems to function as advertised and also fits fine in a 2-gang box thought it's a 1-gang product.  Echo didn't respond to "Sex Palace", so I had to name the device "Bedroom". :-)
If your connecting a single switch with only 3 wires, it's no problem, if it's a feeder box, this can create space issues..

I had another brand that worked great for 3 years.  But after getting a new upgraded wireless router they stopped working.  Tried a factory reset, talked to customer support many times, they even sent me a new one. Still no luck, poor we**.  After reading the reviews on this product and the reviews on the app I gave it try.  Hooked up to my Wi-Fi with no issues, set a rule to turn my outside lights on at sunset and off at 11:30 pm, it works as it should.  The reason for 4 stars, there is no indicator light showing that the light switch is on.

They hook right up with little issue. My only problem is the size. They are much bigger than normal switches and with all the added wirenuts, it was a little difficult to get both in there without breaking something.
Blew up my entire apartment and external fuse. There was smoke and my apartment did not have power. Do not buy. This cheap stuff will blow up and is a fire hazaed
Really should be about 3.5.Install was easy enough.
Super easy to install and the apps response time is so fast! As soon as I turn the lights on with my app they pop on not even 2 seconds after.

Own a number of these and they work great. TP-Link also offers outstanding service. Very responsive and helpful. I do not have any issues with them going offline or not working properly. The "sunset" and "sunrise" scheduling options are perfect for outdoor lighting.
This item works great. I use it with Alexa. It was easy to install and easy to setup on the Kasa and Alexa application. I would recommend this product to convert ones home to a smart home.

Last time I purchased, it didn't work at all, so I had to return it. This time, it did work for a day, but began losing wifi connections. I have to reset Kasa app whenever it starts malfunction. This product gave me so much headache and won't recommend to anyone.  It failed the second time in a row.

Love the kasa range of products. I have a total of 6 tp-link wifi devices and this is my 2nd hs-200 switch. They connect without a problem and they work with both Alexa and Google-home. (I have both devices). Also, not needing a hub is awesome. I will keep expanding my home automation with more of the tp-link kasa devices.

If you’re able to change your own light switch it’s pretty straight forward. Granted I’m not the best. It wasn’t a difficult install. Most of my problems came from the wire box having lots of wires already inside. It works excellently. The switch is very responsive.

UPDATE 03/21/2017: Knocking off a star...They don't self-cycle after an outage... Doing some home improvement projects and I have to periodically kill the power to do electrical work.  After powering the house back up, the switches don't automatically reconnect to the wireless network.  Fortunately, there's a scan button (kind of hidden--it's in the metal trim below the switch, on the right).  Quick press and it'll start the switch scanning the wifi network... 30 seconds later, the switch should be back online (that is, if your wifi network is back online, too).  A minor nuisance, but the reason I'm knocking off a full star is the nuisance combined with the fact that there's no rhyme or reason to it... Sometimes all of the switches will need to be reset, sometimes only a few (one or two DID self-cycle).  If you lose power, you may be wandering around your house resetting switches, which kinda kills the whole remote/Alexa experience.
I’ve various Kasa switches & plugs but most older versions (ver 1.0) had failing WiFi issues. This is ver 1.8 with updated internal hardware, past issues seems to be resolved.

Bought product to connect to Amazon, Alexa. It was easy to install and connect to Alexa. The total time to replace switch and connect, was less than 15 minutes. The switch comes with two black wires, just connect those together to connect to single black wire in previous switch.  The others whote and ground are pretty self-explanatory. You have to download the Kasa App first to connect to WiFi and then use the instruction on Alexa to have it learn the device.I am looking for other switches to replace in the house, it was so easy.

Followed the directions and setup was an ease... for those that only have three wires, 2-black, and 1-copper, just wire the copper and white wire together, they’re just natural; as for the black - 2-power wires, or doesn’t matter which one you connect to which, black to black.

I was a little skeptical about this type of product but am very happy I purchased it.  I was so pleased the I bought another for a rental property.  Easy to install.  Easy to use intuitive app to control the switch.  I whole heartedly recommend this product.

I've replaced all the switches in my house and the was no harder than any other non smart switch. Only difference is I had to attach the white wire so it gets power. Works with Google perfectly. Synced up faster than some other kasa products I have
Kasa is by far the best tool for home automation Easy to install easy to program and you can run the whole light show from your home You need these in your home for safety, security and ambience

Very easy to install this switch using "Ideal in-Sure connectors". I have an iPhone, so I created a shortcut (Shortcut is a native iOS app). I installed this switch in the garage. It's super easy  to control it with Siri by saying "Garage on" or "Garage off". I use Siri on my apple Watch to turn on/off the light in the garage.

I love these switches. I have them set up for my outside lights on a schedule. Connecting was super easy. Downloaded the app and then connected the switches to WiFi. App is easy to use to set up a schedule. Works perfect
I have these hooked up to some outside lights. They work great and the app is easy to use for scheduling.
So far so good, added extra shutoff times 1 minute apart to ensure it switches off incase of a glitch.  It needs a neutral wire for power.

Works well. App is clear. Switch gives no indication (except dimly lit circle of light) whether its on or off.  But it can only be used if you are on your home network. Will not work over remote wifi connection.

I love this switch works flawlessly with Alexa, I have two switches one in the kitchen so when you walk in with your arms full you can easily turn on the light.  I have not had any issues and it is easy to set up.

Ordered a light switch and 2 smart plug outlets. Arrived in one day. Easy installation, all work well. Easy connect with Alexa, all work well. Fast response. Setup schedules and away. So far so good. Great products.

I have 4 of these installed they work great.  They work with alexa and Google home. Just wish it was a little smaller and or the device had screws instead of wires to make installation easier when putting wires back in
I would have given this a 5, but the customer support is non existent.We had a bit of problem with the app, and try to resolve it through customer

I was worried at first because it’s not as easy as screwing in a smart bulb, but I’m glad it worked out. I like this setup better than a smart bulb since you still have the option of using this like a normal switch.

Soy de Argentina. Las compre y luego de comprarlas me di cuenta que la caja decia 110v-120v. Leyendo bien por internet, comprobé que son multivoltaje. Las tengo conectadas y funcionan de maravilla. Soy de Buenos Aires - Argentina.

warning before you buy this item make sure you wires in your switch box have a white(common or neutral) a live (black or red) and of course a ground (usually bare) If you do not have a common or neutral you can not use this switch. I bought 3 and only one can be used at my house. You might have a white wire in your switch box but make sure it is indeed a neutral or common. There is no safe work around if you have no neutral.
Best switches around.  The back takes up some space so make sure you can fit it all in.  Still loving it though.
The instructions are easy to follow. Works great with my Google Home. Just make sure your house has a white\neutral wire or the switch will not work.
I bought this so I could program my outside lights.  It has worked beautifully.  I do to have alexa so I can't speak to the integration.

Item was easy to install and set up. All aspects of the this product works perfectly, I'm able to control the lights of my summer home from over 15,000 miles away. I'm so happy with this item I've installed 6 and plan on installing more.
Have had 0 problems and they seem to work great in all . The only downside I see is that it doesn't have a dimming feature. But I think that is offered in the higher dollar version.

I have this installed to my exterior and kitchen lights and it's integrated with my Echo Dots.  I have a tendency to leave my kitchen light on to add more lighting to my livingroom.  Then I end up falling asleep on the couch and am too lazy to walk to the switch to turn off the kitchen light.  Now, I just tell Alexa to turn off the kitchen light, and it does it without me lifting a finger.  I have the exterior lights set to turn on a dusk and off at dawn automatically...it knows when that occurs so I don't need to adjust the times.  I can also tell Alexa to turn my exterior lights off if I wanted it off at any particular time.  The switch also works manually like any other switch to override a pre-programed command.When I originally installed these switches, I installed the app and while I was setting it up, I was having a hard time programming it.  The switches were not staying on my home network long enough for me to program it.  I was getting frustrated...then set the programming aside.  With my smart home conversion, I also purchased a new Logitech remote hub/system.  While I was setting the hub, it wasn't recognizing my home network.  Then DING!!!  My freaken wireless router was eight years old!!!  DUH!!!!  So I purchased a new beasty router, set it up...and BAM!!!  I was able to easily program my TP-Link switches and my Logitech hub without hesitation...and now, I rarely experience buffering while streaming online movies...yeah!!!
I replaced the existing switches with this switch and now i have full control, i can turn it on or off from anywhere. Scheduled times and all works great, the app is awesome.
Works flawlessly and don't have to pay any service fee like with Wink. major win!
it does not support apple home.don't screw it too tight, otherwise it will not work.

This just works perfectly.  I had a neutral wire in the box which I guess is the key to success.  With that, installation was easy, and the configuration link to Alexa was easy, plus it looks great on the wall. I have had this switch live for about a month, works perfectly both from touching the button physically and via Alexa.
My husband loves this. He sets his phone to turn it on and off respectively at sundown and sun up. Good price. needs a grounding wire
I have these in every room of my house they are great and the app is so easy to use
Very easy installation works perfectly. I use my Google home to control it and have never had a problem with it. It's also very simple to touch manually and turn it on is a walk into the

This smart switch REQUIRES you to have a password on your wifi. They claim it is for your safety, but that's really up to you, not them. It's huge inconvenience if you have a network without a password. They claim it's a feature, I believe it is a bug in their app that they didn't want to fix, so they play the "safety" card to cover for it.Other than that is works as advertised.

Bought a second TP-Link Smart Switch because the first was so easy to setup however, the second switch setups ok and everything (software) shows working, light still will not turn on.  I am wondering if it because i put it on my main living room lights which has 2 light switches.  One on each side of the room.  Also noticed my led (just one) light stayed on once I turned power back on.

Works great from Alexa or any Dots throughout the house and no extra hub to buy. Pretty easy install and app guided thru steps to link up the switch to wi-fi. You can setup schedule for lights to go off/on. A little pricey for me but no regrets so far.  Hopefully price will drop soon.

All TP-Link products and KASA... Perfect. A++++ I've used TP-link, GE, Leviton products so far, absolutely TP-Link is the best of the best. Design soooo good, the software works so well (KASA GUI is also very good), quality awesome, even box and instructions are so awesome too. I was amused by their 2 live wiring things, you don't need to worry about which one is for black or red. A+++++++!!!

We purchased this to use with our Alexa. Setup was (somewhat) easy - those out there with more experience installing switches, etc. will have an easier time.Once it was installed, connecting it to Wi-Fi was easy...just be sure to follow the instructions!
Easy to connect. Easy to setup. Works with Alexa.I haven't had any issues.
Easy to install, as long as you have correct wiring in your home. Easy to follow set up. Second Kasa product I have purchased. Would recommend.

This is my second smart light switch that I have installed. I was able to find clear instructions for wiring the switch up and it is up and working. It was so nice to have this switch voice activated (with Alexa) over the holidays.

I love  this !  I thought though I was going to have a problem with installing it because my house is so old it has the old cloth wiring.  No problem had it up an running with in a half and hour. didn't have to add wiring etc.  Works great withAlexa as well as the 2 pak tp-link smart plugs.

Up until now, we'd only purchased lightbulbs and outlets for our Alexa. Neither was usable for our kitchen lights, so we got the switch. Wiring issues were solved by the Kasa app, and it was easy to complete quickly. We're now on our 9th TP-Link device—all without a hub—and couldn't be happier. Well thought out devices with a well thought app!

I already own several WeMo switches, but when this TP-Link went on sale for one day at Amazon, I decided to use it to expand my system. Installation was identical to the Belkin F7C030FC (WeMo equivalent of the TP-Link). This switch requires a common line in addition to the two wires that connect directly to the switch. The ground is optional, but should be used if present.I had the switch installed in 10 minutes and downloaded the TP-Link Kasa app in order to pair the switch with my WiFi. Again, it works exactly the same as the WeMo devices and found my wireless with no problems.
Worked great, I also used it with led bulbs, on my garage, now I don't have to worry about turning them on and off just set a program up for it.
I am kind of person who loves the smart stuff, This one was easy to install and to operate, and very good quality

Works great! Love the schedule function. Only concern I have is that it's a bit large in the electrical box. My house was built in the 50s and has some small metal electrical boxes. It fit but required some effort.

I've tested a handful of brands with Alexa and Google and I prefer the HS200 light switch.  At some point you will lose power, internet, or change your wifi, just press a button and you are back working.
Makes my front porch light operate on automatic and makes my life easier. Took me a few minutes to figure out the wiring as instructions are not necessarily straight forward.
Easy to install. If you don’t have ground. You can join neutral and ground and it will work. Really happy. Will buy a couple more.

I have tried to install this outlet at two different switches. I am not sure If I have a bad outlet or if I am not wiring it correctly. I have the Live/Load line going to the red and black wires. The green going to ground and the white going to neutral. The outlet comes on and allows me to program it via the app but the lights don't come on. What am I doing wrong?

Wiring installation is easy and just like installing a normal switch.  The app walks you through connecting to your WiFi.  It makes it great for turning a rooms lights on or off by a schedule or by voice.

I have been using two of these now for two weeks with both the Kasa app and Alexa and have not had any problems getting either to respond to my commands.  Unlike the z-wave switches linked to my home security system these have no annoying hum.  I have minimal electrical experience but installed and synced each one in under a half hour.
I bought this because I can't reach the light switch from bed. The scheduling feature is an added bonus! The light turns on when the alarm clock goes off, no more late to work!

Easy to install and stable! I have 5 light switches and 4 mini plugs. I can simulate being home or come home to the appropriate lights being on. These are features I never new I wanted, and now I love the convenience. I have them paired with Echo Dots and can control them with my iPhone/thumb or voice control through 3rd party apps (Reverb)

HOLY CRAP I LOVE THESE THINGS! Super simple setup, super easy to use! I control them from my phone occasionally, but mostly with alexa. Alexa integration can not be easier. Install is pretty easy too, since the line/load connections are interchangeable. I am glad i went with these instead of the more expensive WeMo. I have 3 so far, and I'm asking for more from santa claus.
My light switch is in an odd location, difficult to get to. Now Alexa turns it off and on for me. So nice!!!
The one I got didn't work, so I returned it. But others I have helped install work great with no issues. They are cool light switches

I have 3 of these so far and i love them. It's great that I dont have to spend $50+ on a hun for the house, and TP link creates other products so I dont have to use several apps. Never had an issue with these. Love them!

Worked fine but I had to hold back a star for missing wiring instructions. They could have very easily pointed out how you have to wire these up but instead deferred to using an electrician. Took me a minute to figure out that I had to hook up the neutral to get it to work. Otherwise works well.

Install and setup time took approximately 20 mins, the unit itself pretty bulky so if you have lots of wires in the box? Prepare to for a snug fit. Overall it  functions as expected and the best part is using my Alexa voice control. I plan on eventually install more throughout the house.

Easy to install, works like a charm.  I can now turn my outside lights on or off when I leave work, or as I get close to home, which in the winter is a crucial feature; it's the difference between pulling in to the driveway in the pitch black vs. seeing that my kid has left his trike in the driveway and not hitting it.

This item works great, i would give it 5 stars but it came with no instructions and it took me several internet searches to locate the right proceedure to get it to work with Alexa.  I am sharing this magical link here in hopes to save someone else the headache![...]

This is a good smart light switch. Super easy to install, only took a few minutes with a screwdriver. Setup was a little finicky but not difficult. Easily integrates with my Google Home setup. Would recommend

I have never done any electrical work in my life before but with the help of the video tutorial on their website, it only took me 20 mins to figure out the whole thing and integrated it with Alexa! The remote control works perfect. You can turn on/off the switch anywhere around the world. It also has a nice modern looking compared to the outdated design of my previous switch. The integration with Alexa is super useful. Now I can use voice commands to turn this on/off with sticky hands!

Very disappointing.  I ordered this switch on Prime Day along with several TP Link smart bulbs.  All were installed in our vacation home but not until about 40 days after they arrived. The bulbs worked great but the switch was clearly defective.  It powered up and connected to my home network just fine but when the switch was pressed it simply did not work.  It was too late to return it via Amazon so I contacted TP Link via live chat for assistance.  They refused to acknowledge that the switch was defective and insisted that I must have wired it incorrectly.  I love the smart bulbs but cannot recommend the switch at all.

First of all Great product and easy to install. Instructions are on point as long as your electrical wiring has a neutral wire as the booklet states.  The WiFi switch is easy to operate and does not have any issues.  The mobile app is easy to setup as well and have tested it away from home and works very well.  Just bought 2 more yesterday!!Update: Now intrested in purchasing the 3 way kit that comes with 2 switches.

These are convenient but can be inconsistent at the most inconvenient times. I have them throughout the house. Easy install and setup but I will find at least one or two of these switches not connected to my network daily.
Something about 3 wiring I could not get it to work in my 5th wheel  thinking I just need to spend some more time on it...
I have several of the tp-link kasa smart switches and dimmers.  They've all done exactly what they are supposed to do with no hassle.  Can't ask for more.

I have replaced every switch in my house with either this or the dimmer version. Always work great and even show up on my leg tv home hub with no additional set up. App has nice user interface and works great with Alexa. Would be perfect if they were officially supported by HomeKit.

Simple to install and setup.  Was up and running in no time, love the convenience of being able to remote switch or by Alexa.  Switch toggle action is a bit cheap feeling, but don’t intend on manually toggling much.  Haven’t noticed any issues yet, will update this review if I run into any down the road.

Easy to install and so very convenient to be able to turn on the lights before I get home. I hate coming home to a dark house, and this solved that problem. The Kasa app was a breeze to set up, and integrating the switch with Alexa was a snap.

Excellent product if you want to schedule your porch and other external lights that are on a switch to turn off and on at a particular time. I have the porch lights on a schedule and never have to worry every day to turn them off and on and when we are on vacation.One does not need Alexa to manage them. Just download the Kasa App and set up the schedule. Setup was easy. Need basic electrical knowledge.
Works great, and no connection issues. The only challenging thing with these is the depth of the switch. Most of my switches are dual gang boxes and  early impossible to get 2 of these in one box.

Easy to install, just know that you will have to connect the neutral wire.  In my case the neutral is bonded to the ground so I was able to use the ground on a couple of switches when there was no neutral in the box.  This may not be totally OK, but it works.  You will have to download the TP-Link Kasa App, then you will be able to control it with the Echo.
Recently installed and found installation to be simple. Alexa integration was also simpl and works well.

Great really like this. I am disabled and this keeps me from having to get up frequently to turn off the light. I really would like one in all the rooms. You control it from your iPhone, which is great.

I have a total of 3 of these switches that were purchased over the past year.  The one that failed was purchased in July of 2018. The unit worked fine under Alexa commands, but was not working properly when used manually. I had to buy this last one as a replacement for the failed unit and to match one located next to it.
Do not buy unless you’re wiring in your house is newer. Must be hooked up to 4 wires in the wall. I didn’t see that in details before I purchased.
Works great took about 10 mins to remove old switch and install and set up this one
Works pretty well with Alexa..APP is very easy and you could remote control your switches...very good product and highly recommended...

My home was built in the 50's, so the wiring has no neutral wire, which is a must have to make these switches work. I had to hire an electrician to run the wire in my attic, but now being able to remotely turn off the light
Item came not working. Wifi can be setup. App shows you can turn on and off but light doesn't work. Had to order replacement and replacement works. Quality control of product is not good.

Works great with the echo dot and alexa. I love how the switch looks like a rocker switch but acts as a button instead. Its a brilliant design!I am an electrician so the instal was easy. I wont fit in a very shallow box so beware if you are trying to fit this in a old house with shallow boxes it may not work. other than that the kasa program works great! the little subtle light in the switch is brilliant for bedrooms. A dimmer would be nice to add but i love the product as an electrician and as a consumer.

Overall, the app works well and quick. However, during the day time, I cannot tell whether the light switch is on or off because the LED indicator is too dimmed/white. One suggestion is changing the indicator light to green so the day light doesn’t camouflage it. I want to know if I accidentally turn on the outdoor light without looking outside. Also,  it would have been nicer if the switch is flush.  The current switch appears to be permanently on since the switch position doesn't change.
VERY EASY TO INSTALL AND PROGRAM ON MY IPHONE. WORKS SO  GOOD I ORDERED ONE FOR MY DAUGHTER'S FRONT DOOR. RECOMMEND

So far I really like the TP-Link Smart Wi-Fi light switch.  I had to spend a little time wiring it into a multi-switch, but as soon as I had it in, it was ready to go.  Easy to program, and now it is scheduled.  Remote access is easy as well as the Alexa integration.  Liked it so much I purchased a couple of the TP-Link light bulbs and have had the same experience.

The HS-103 plugs connected to my Echo Spot and Kasa app flawlessly. Not this switch! I followed the instruction exactly and tried over six times, and did a hard reset on the switch after each try. The switch would be recognized and had a strong signal. but could not be remotely controlled. I could, however, turn it on or off at the switch. Tech support (in the Philippines) talked me through the exact process I used by following the iPhone instructions. That didn't work. I was told the problem was referred to Engineering. I received an email the next day instructing me to try again. I did and it worked.
Love this for our lights in our family room.  It is on a timer, but we can also turn them on and off from our phones.  Highly recommend this!

The switch did not work in my 40 year old house because of the wiring system.  The way it is advertised it seems like it will work anywhere.  Now I have a switch  I can't use and neither can my neighbors as they have the same type of house.
Seems to get stuck in the on position. My outdoor lights dont always get shutoff as scheduled. They seem to always come on at sundown but don’t ever shut off.
I have a couple of these now. I’ve installed them on multi-light fixtures. They were great and look great. I love the way they function.
Allows me to be lazy on a whole new level. It did take a few minutes to install but that's to be expected... but I love this thing! I want to get one for every room in my house!

I bought two of these and installed them to control our porch light and the light in our garage. Installation was pretty straight-forward and simple due to the guide type of instructions supplied through the TP-Link Kasa app. The hardest part of the install was really making all the cables fit back into the standard size switch box in my 10 year old house.Connecting it to my home's WiFi went very well, and I haven't had any connectivity problems so far.

When it works, it works great. Every couple of weeks, I have to reset the wifi and reinstall it with the app. Really annoying. I have other TP-Link devices that work fine, but I will not get another TP-Link switch again.
Worked well initially.However, the remote on function changed to local only without my help thereby invalidating my reason for purchasing.

Amazing product. Works well, looks great, easy install. I would recommend to anyone doing home automation. I have literally installed these in every switch location in my house. I am using it with Alexa/Amazon services and have no issues. Very fast setup and very responsive.
This is my 4th one and it is reliable.  The setup is easy and the app makes it easy to see if there any software updates and perform the software update.
Very nice design and easy installation. The app is used is also very good and it's works well with Alexa.
i like the tech, the app and the price.I intend to get most of my lights switched over to these.

Very high quality product, very easy to install and set up with some basic electrical skills.  Works will the Kasa App or an Echo Plus SmartHub.  I now have 3 of them, in conjunction with their smart bulbs and plugs.  Wish they were not so expensive, but they are very good and visually appealing.
This has worked great and I love I can use Alexa and/or this switch to turn lights on or off.  I have the simple on/off switch and I couldn't be happier.
I have a smart home in combination with Alexa. Love the fact that no hub is needed.Easy to install and connect to wifi.
Easy to set up and Wi-Fi signal is strong and stays connected. Only downside is if you have Leviton decor switches they won’t match and you may need to change the face plate.

This is easy enough to install make sure neutral wire is available.  Once installed, setup is a breeze, TPLINK Kasa line is friendly and reliable.  No HUB required works with Google Home and Google assistance every time.

I've been using this light switch for about a month now. I am very happy with it. I have it operating my front porch  light. I like that you don't need a hub to use it. The Kasa app isn't the greatest, but it is adequate enough to operate this switch. If you aren't into the whole smart home thing, but want a switch or two, this will work for you.

These light switches are fantastic. They work very well with Google assistant/home. The set up is very simple. I would recommend to use a electirical check stick when installing to check for hot wires. Setup on Google home was a breeze. The Kasa app has nice features to set schedules while you're away.

I guess second time is the charm?  The first switch I ordered did not work as the lights only flashed.  After much tinkering I knew the switch had to be faulty so I ordered a replacement through Amazon.  Installed the second switch and to my surprise it worked great.  I hope the switch lasts longer than 2 years so I don’t have to deal with TP-Link support, which is useless and almost non existent.

We love it ! Very easy install and set up, I had it installed and working in about 20 minutes. Works with Echo and Google Mini ( we have both). May have cheated a bit on the set up, already had Kasa installed for a smart plug previously installed, only needed to add the smart switch. Good little device!
Like all my other TP-Link Kasa products. Fantastic. Easy to install, easy to use, functions flawlessly with Alexa.

Love my TP-Link Switches. I would buy one for every light in my house if i could. They were so easy to setup and installation was pretty simple. The backs are quite thick so it is tricky to get them in the electrical boxes. However, it it well worth it. I have mine hooked up to Alexa as well and that helps. Just wish it had a dimmer.

I bought several of these to work with Amazon echo. Installation was as expected for a single pole switch, although the switches are a bit bulky - much like a dimmer switch. Set up was very easy on the TP Link app (Kasa) and the Echo detected them as soon as they were on line. Overall, I'm very satisfied with the product.
Does not set good as other brands within the wall. But does work good and would buy again.
My wife is  disabled and in a wheelchair. Theses switches are awesome
Very easy to intall. And very easy to program. So far im impressed
Nice & convenient switch.  Not too difficult to connect w/ Alexa for voice operation & phone app good too.

I dont give 5 stars very often but I have 8 of these installed im my home and I love them. They were all purchased at different times as they have gone on sale.  Some of my switches are over a year old and I have not noticed any difference in quality from switch to switch.  I have had zero issues with and they have never disconnected from my network.  I am not an electrician and found these easy to install.  I used the Kasa app as well as Alexa and both function perfectly.

The product is pretty good. Relatively easy to install. CUSTOMER SERVICE however from TP LINKS IS HORRIBLE. long wait times, they are clueless and actually told me their product is ok for 220 when it's rated for 110. I think it's a good switch if not defective but don't expect any support from this company. They are terrible.

Pretty much LOVE IT and have no issues whatsoever with it. Have 8 in my house now and want more. Way better than the GE ones out there. Slimmer design and can EASILY fit 2 in my wall (Bedroom Fan and Light). The GE ones were way too wide to fit in my electric box. These went in so smoothly. Love how the wires are already attached to the back and there's no fuss with what black one goes where. Kept having problems with GE switches and mixing up the 2 black wires.

Installed two of these switches in my house to control fan and lights. One worked for about a week and when I went to turn the lights on it power surged and shorted out my $300 ceiling fan. Now I have to buy a new one. Not happy with this product at all.
just installed the product in my room.able to follow the instruction easily and setup.

We are very happy with this product.  We have three of them.  They are all installed on two way switches.  I do not believe you can install them on a three-way.  They work as advertised and love that I can turn lights on and off from my phone.

I use switch on a regular basis as any other home switch but from my phone. rarely have to touch switch. it is very responsive.  One downside not with with switch but with some of the product with TP-link is that that they don't have more devices to use with Kasa app. For example the camera they have work with another app. So what am trying to say is that i would like to see more devices to be use with Kasa app which is a great app and have all devices consolidated in one app. am sure other customer will feel the same way. Also to have more device for the home such wireless leak sensor or others devices that would make home ware of whats going on at home.
Wish it physically behaved like a regular switch instead of just looked like one. Also wished it just connected directly to Alexa instead of through its own app.  Like the glow light when it is off.

My wife was skeptical about a switch that could be controlled from Alexa, but after installing one of these on the living room fan switch, she insisted that we add them to every room.  The only downside is that they do not work with three-way switches.

One by one I have been upgrading each of my switches to smart switches and it’s rhe smartest thing I’ve chosen to do. My goal is to upgrade them so that when I sell my home, I can list “smarthome and fully automated”.
I have purchased 3 of these HS200s.  2 of 3 would not connect to the KASA app.  The third worked like a charm.  Bad batch?

After I figured it all out, everything worked perfectly.  Better written instructions would have been helpful, especially how to use all of the components.  Some things didn't go well until I found out why they didn't go well.  Now however, I love this product.
I used it for about a month but it no longer is responding to commands from dot or kasa.In that month I had to cycle power many times before it just quit. Would not buy again.
It connected easily to my WiFi. It communicates either through the app or through my google home.

Works as it should with fast and easy install and setup even setting it up to Alexa was easy! Works great! Saying Alexa turn off my bedroom light is much easier than constantly checking is my kids left it on. Having Alexa turn the light on for the kids to use my bathroom is fantastic since the won't go in a room unless you turn the light on first.
Lost connection with app after initial programming. Light switch still works but it is just a manual switch now.

Great timer switch; works as advertised with App and Alexa.  Installation was easy.  The only issue encountered was that the mounting ears (plastic) might have been a little too thick forcing the switch plate to stand away from the wall - not flush against.  Contributing to this issue also was that the electrical box was not entirely flush (or slightly recessed) with the wall. Other than that, hope it lasts for a long time!  Would recommend to buy.  Would have given it 4 1/2 stars if the  rating system allowed it!
I'm a return customer. Love these items and very user friendly. Reasonable price for great product.

Super easy to install and setup. I use for my porch lights and have a schedule run to turn them on and off based on sunrise/sunset schedule. I like it better than the Leviton switch I replaced which cost more than twice as much.I'll buy more for other locations.
Absolutely love this product. Works seamlessly with Alexa and love that I can create scenes to control the whole house at once

I had the required neutral wire so install was easy. It took about 20 minutes to install with my 5 year old doing all the screws for me. The install and set up is rather straight forward if you have a little experience with a tp-link prodicts, but you wont get much help from the included printed materials, there is almost nothing in the way of instructions.
Installed almost a year ago, and all 6 of them have worked flawlessly.  Easy install and straight forward integration with Alexa.

This worked out really well, and setup and updates were far easier than working with the Belkin "'WeMo" products. Works the 3-way switches, regular switches, and wall plugs. And the app makes it all super easy. PLUS, it works with Google Home flawlessly.

Switch was easy to set up and worked great for the first few months.  Now it loses wifi signal constantly and requires being setup  again which lasts several hours to a day.  While it off the wifi, it randomly turns off after being manual turned on.  Now it won't join a wifi network at all.
Easy to install, easy configuration, looks good, I setup the timer once and forget it
I wish I could upgrade my entire house with these. Great option when not needing or wanting to upgrade to wireless bulbs and only needed the wireless switch capability.
Light switch works great as does dimming. Integration with Alexa and Google Assistant work flawlessly as well. KASA app is very user friendly and connecting switch to WiFi was easy.
This switch is great, but it's lacking a big feature: IFTTT integration.In my opinion, it's a must-have for most modern smart home devices.
It works well when it works. Really tricky to get the light to stay on in the “stay on mode”. Other than that it is a good switch.

I am completely happy and satisfied with the smart switch. I first bought one to test it out and after a few weeks of use, I bought a second one to control my ceiling fan. I am not a handyman whatsoever but the installation was quick and easy. The app guides you step by step which is very useful. I would highly recommend this smart light switch by TP-Link for anyone wanting to turn their home into a smart one.

We're using for jacuzzi tub switch. Instalation was easy and the app was very easy. We'll  be adding more from this line. We were already pleased with the TP Link products; we've had a modem and wireless router for over a year. This statement is to say we were familiar with and pleased by their products - you don't have to use their modem or router with this switch.

The install and set is super easy. Download the Kasa and pair. You are ready to go. Btw, I use it with my Echo so I also downloaded the Alexia app. The sync process is mindlessly easy compared to other setups (trust me I have used other devices).The ONE drawback is it does not support 3-way switches =(. PLEASE PLEASE got R&D on that right away TP-link =).
Works wonderfully with Alexa!  Just as easy as any other smart switch to install.  We love the hands free aspect with our main light switch being far into the room.
easy to set up and operate , no issues with staying connected to wifi , works great with Alexa as long as you can remember what you named the switch

I replaced the light switch in the detached garage to control the outside garage lights and it works great. It was easy to install and using the app, the lights scheduled to come on at dark and cut-off at dawn. Highly recommend.
easy to install, little confusing on wiring till I checked and found doesn't make a diference  on hot wire lead
Would not work with my electrical system. I tried, there helpline was no help.
It was super easy to install just by reading the instructions. Look at your current wiring before purchasing. We had the neutral wires so I had no problem.

Got one of these at Christmas and it didn't work as it was on 2 switches. Order another one to put two and capped off the other switch. Had them installed by an electrician. Neither will turn on the lights manually. The kitchen table light flickers and the kitchen ceiling light flashes for one second when you push the button but doesn't stay on. So now I've had an electrician out twice and my kitchen is in the dark. Called TP-Link support they who said they could do nothing and call amazon. What a waste of time and money,
Bought to have exterior lights be on when we got home during winter months. Easy to install, 1 month of use with zero complaints.

If you're looking for a smart switch this is the one. Don't purchase any other one trust me. I've tried doing so. This is the only one that I found as far as ease of installation. As well as ease of setup and config to a WiFi network. I promise trust and believe you won't regret it...

Fun, works with Amazon Echo without the base.  HOWEVER, you need a base from TP-Link if you want to do any of the timed activities. I thought for sure Amazon Echo could just handle this... right?  It's a computer that can store information and retrieve it.  That means it could set a timer and turn on a light.
Easy to install except the bulk might be too much for a small box with lots of wires. So far has worked like a charm.

I’m a newbie to “smart devices” but this one is a no brainer. After using older timed devices, I learned about smart switches. Installation is a snap.  With this device I’m able to control lights around my home with an app!  Best decision ever.

I had to put on my thinking cap to wire it in, but now it works.  I's responsive, works great with Amazon Dot/Alexa and has made turning lights on kind of fun.  Unlike a smart bulb, there is a physical button I can press to turn it on.  I don't have to pull my phone out every time.  With Alexa the response time is within a second.  I was blown away.
I have a lot of Kasa switches throughout my house and they work to perfection and easy to set up. Wouldn't change for any other product.Thanks

Love my TP-Link smart wifi light switches. I bought 2 and they were easy to install & are super easy to use. I previously purchased the TP electrical plugs and light bulbs. All these items work with Alexa. Plus the Kasa app lets you schedule lights to come on/off at set times or you can manually turn them on & off via app. I would definitely purchase any of the TP-Link smart items again. Super easy to use & very convenient! (FYI I am not an electrician & not typically a diy-er & I had no problem installing these)
The quality is good. But on a normal home with a classic switch, it is not easy to get it installed. I have to find the Neutral line, and it is not easy. Hope to have a better installation manual.

This was easy to install and works great with the Kasa app and with Alexa. I have used these to control switches that were remotely located and it saved a lot of money on any rewiring by making the switches work remotely.
We kept forgetting to turn on the porch light when we left the house during the day. Now we just use the kasa app or Google home to turn on the porch light.

OK less than three months the switch stopped working I've got 2 others that are installed and still working. also one of their light bulbs went bad. The other four lightbulbs are still working. . I do not recommend this brand anymore.
Very easy to I stall, quick wifi connect all app driven with instructions. Thank you very much. My second Kasa product.
Liked the easy install and simple setup. Installed 6 of them
Just works.I had a bit of frustration when entering my hidden network name. It seems to be case sensitive ? Either that or I mistyped it twice.

Have installed many light switches to control lights and fans.  Also set up some themes to simplify my life.Many people including myself have requested smart fan switch with speed control but have not any response from Kasa in over a year.

Love this thing. Easy to install and easy to program and works anywhere. Schedule it for any time and the best thing about it is if your away on vacation and you want to change up the lighting program you can do it from your phone. I've install two so fare and will add more as time goes by. Oh and they look real nice, very clean look.
I have two Kasa plug-in lights that I love - but the set-up for this was quite complicated and the wires didn't match up with the wiring for my apartment complex - so I had to return.

The switch is great, it's far more reliable than my WeMos, the only CON and I put it in capitals is the LED indicator light, if you install this in your bedroom you don't really need to turn on the lights, the indicator is so powerful and bleeds that much light that you can see everything at night, no kidding. I hope that next time TP-Link make it more subtle or give the option to turn it off. I had to put back my unreliable WeMo light switch because the LED light is unbearable if you need a dark room to fall sleep.

Actual had this installed by an electrician when he was doing work on the breaker box.  Looked super simple to install. Had it integrated with Google Home in less than 5 min.  Works great.  I am using TP Link Kasa now for all of my smart switches.  I bought 3 more.

Our first venture into remote access/control (OK, so we're old folks). We haven't gone into the Alexis thing yet, but having the ability to control the inside lights remotely saves us the problem of setting timers (which usually don't work) every time we leave on an overnight trip. We will venture into other devices.

This is an amazing light switch!!  Works perfectly both physically (i.e. touching the switch) and with the app.  Switch stays cool, and automatically re-connects to the wifi without issues after a power failure.  Away-mode works flawlessly.  Wiring was moderately challenging, but definitely a do-it-yourself project if you know the basics of electrical switch wiring (youtube is very helpful too).  I also highly recommend the 3-way switch kit (HS210).

Product doesn't work if your "light" has power going to it, then another cable from there to the switch to complete the circuit.  In this case, there is no white "neutral" wire.  And this won't work without a neutral wire (even if you wire it to the ground).

What a terrific product. I have it attached to our outside courtesy lights - five of them - and we no longer come home to a dark house. I can switch the lights on from my smartphone when we exit the highway. Our only option before was to turn the lights on when we left home, sometimes in mid-day, leave them burning for hours wasting energy. Not only that, it was a clear signal to passers-by that we were not at home. I intend to purchase another switch, and some of the individual lamp plugs and light bulbs to further automate our home.

Have been using this switch for about 3 months now and it works just as expected. It controls our front porch lights, and it was easy to use the app to program a schedule.. Hit one snag during install, but a quick online search brought up a video that answered our question. Works great with Alexa too. Love the convenience of being able to control the lights even when I’m not home, and unlike our old smart switch, it doesn’t require a hub.
Next day delivery....Wow...  Easy to install on the one pole electrical connection.
We have a variety of 8 Kasa products and all worked without any issues.
Easy to install with the Kasa app. works well with my internet. Have several around house for months. I recently setup them up with routines with my Echo Dot.
Simple installation, easy set up and seems well made.

very easy to install set up a snap would buy more of this item now lets see how long it can last good work to the people of kasawere we live is dark street some time kids turn off light when wife works late now she can turn on lights before getting out of her car

Kasa smart switches works as described.  The only issues I've had is getting them to fit in the socket because the back of the smart switch is a little bulky.  Other than that, I'm happy with the product

I have just installed my switches HS-200 love it so cool, but it is without dimmer on my ceiling overhead light, which isn't offered, yeah the that is a bummer, so guys program this into your programming. It is a great switch, controls without issues, just no dimmer ability.
Easy installation, and it works great with app. I setup the switch in garage to turn on garage area lights at night for a few hours. Working great since I installed it. No issues.

Works great. Took only a few minutes to install and you should understand house wiring first. Best part only than Alexa bring able to easily control is the wsy it reconnects after wifi or power lost. Using older wemo and then have to be reset by phone.
It integrated very easily with the Google "Home" as well.  Pain free on multiple installations.
I didn't have a neutral wire in the wall plate but it seemed well built.

I really like these. Started using them in my kids room to help turn lights off. But being able to tell Alexa to turn lights and fans off is a fun feature that never gets old. Setup was easy and the look great
This was an easy install, 10 min, easy software install, 5 mins, and easy Alexa integration, 5 min.Seems like some of the poor reviews are related to poor wifi signals in the home.

Switch works as described although I thought one of the options was to have the switch work dawn to dusk in addition to acting on a time basis.  Maybe I misread the online information.?  I still like it.  It uses the internet through your router to know the time.  It should reset after power outages although I haven't tested that yet.
después de la última actualización de la aplicación dejó de funcionar
These switches work great! MUCH easier to program than WEMO and less expensive, too. I'll take these any-day over Wemo devices. I have both, wish all my devices were KASA T-P LINK!

Terrific!!  Fifteen minute job to replace existing switch with this puppy, then got the wi-fi connection with no hassles or problems. It paired up instantly with my two Echo dots and I'm in business. Great product and I'm sure I'll be buyin' a couple more...
Simple Install.. Works Great.. Two of 11 Seems to Reboot Often & Loose Signal will Contact TP Link for a Resolve.

I used to use wemo switches, but since Christmas I have switched to kasa and these things are pretty awesome. The app to configure with wifi and alexa/google blow wemo out of the water. Can’t wait to get the entire house with these!

Great idea, easy to setup, good user interface app, but unfortunately can’t do its most important job: stay connected to the WiFi network. If it would work every time I pulled up the app then of course, 5 stars all day. Instead, typically two out of the four switches I have will be “grayed” out and “unreachable.” Using a higher end nighthawk router and have reset multiple times.

I like it, it works great with Google Home and seems more power efficient than others. One thing though, please give me an option to turn off the locator led, my wife can't stand that light at night. In the meantime I had to place a piece of tape on it, I'll give you back that 5th star when you let me turn that off :-)
When the switches work it’s great unfortunately you need to reset every switch in your house every month or so. If you have plenty of time and patience this is for you otherwise steer clear.

I have bought other KASA wifi plug products and decided to add the switch for my front porch lights. I set them to come on at sunset. Everything I have purchased works great. The switch was easy to install.

For the most part the switches work as advertised and I love the convenience of controlling them with Alexa or through the app. My biggest complaint is the need to reset them because of losing the WiFi connection which seems to happen with some but not all of them. It always seems to be the same ones and others in close proximity never have the problem so I don’t think it’s my WiFi. I also had a problem with one that was needing reset and when it came back online it had a message about needing a firmware update which it performed after which it completely stopped working even manual operation.

Very quick response to the app.  The only strange thing is the light on the switch is on when the light powered by the switch is off and off when the light is on. You would think it would be the opposite... lol. Other than that it works great.

I have an outside security spotlight that this is being used to operate.  We can turn it on with the KASA app on smartphone or Alexa.  My family uses it when they get home after dark.  If you are able to wire in a regular light switch, you can wire in this.  Directions are self explanatory.  All the wire nuts you may need are included in the box.
Very deep. Hard to fit in shallow boxes or with multiple switches. Takes a bunch of time if you do.
Works great everytime.  We use the Kasa app and Google Assistant via our phones and Google (Home)Nest Hub.
Quick. Easy. Up & running & set up with appropriate schedules within less than 15 minutes per switch. 😀
This switch works great easy installation and setup no issues interacting with my Alexa device.

These switches are a great addition to any house.  I love the ease of setup, the look and the app.  These things have a quality look and feel.  The app is great for remote control plus allowing a very powerful scheduling component.You much have a neutral wire available.
I like Kasa Switches because they have been dependable.
Would turn on fan slow. Tried switching the black wires resulting in same response. Will return for a refund.
Super easy to install I had to buy 2 more

The good - it's easy to use and setup, it doesn't require a hub, it is compatible with Alexa and GoogleThe bad -  you can not dim, the LED indicator light can not be dimmed or turned off and might bug you if it is in your bedroom especially at eye level,  it is not compatible with IfTTT

Works as advertised and we are waiting to see how long it lasts before installing more switches throughout the house. It would be nice if the written instructions were more thorough, but the instructions on the app make the installation straightforward.  I will update my review as time passes.
We use Kasa plug products all day long for all kind did stuff - especially during the holidays. Love them
Funcion al 100% con app y alexa

I like this switch. I bought one a few months ago and the same one a few days ago. They both work well and are easy to install.They lose 1 star because I am OCD and the round lights are not the same. See picture.
Worked fairly reliably (needed to be reset occasionally) but then burned out after 2 years.  Too much money to pay for an item that only lasts that long.

Pretty happy with the 2 I got. The only negative, because the mount is so thick, there's a gap between the switch wall cover and the wall now.. wish it would go closer to the wall.. but aside from that, works well - has timers, works with app as well as Alexa and Google...

Have nearly my whole house wired up with these light switches and couldn't be happier. They were easy to install, but the they are bulky and it can be pretty tight getting the switch and all the wires in the junction box, especially if there are multiple switches in the box.

Great switch. Super easy install. The only hiccup I had was the switch filled up my entire electrical box so the wire nuts would not fit in the box with the switch. So instead of the twist on wire connectors I had to use some crimp connectors.  But other than that everything went great and it works great. I've been using mine so I can use Alexa to turn my pool light on and off.
I love these switches, they are very responsive and come with everything that you need to install them. They work great with Alexa even with routines. I love the away and scheduling features.

Switch works great but I experienced difficulty integrating it with my Echo. Amazon customer service patiently walked me through the process and after about a half hour was successful.Item works fine.
Bought 2 , one for front porch and back door . Works perfectly! Easy installation and they have a video that’s easy to follow along with in addition to or instead of using instructions
Love this item.  It is great for turning things on and off upstairs as well as porch lights

I've heard mixed reviews about both the plugs and the light switches from TP-Link but after months of having them set up, it's been uneventful aside from my complete satisfaction with them. If you often forget to turn off the lights, arrive home at night or just have switches in poorly placed locations, these are great to have! Integrates with Amazon Echo, no problem.
I love not having to remember to turn our lights on outside at night. We added another for our Christmas light switch. They work great with Alexa and the app. Easy to install too!

Useless product in volume...  the software only allows a total of 3 smart actions per account.  You can set a timer on a bathroom, set a scene, turn on a porch, turn off a porch, turn off a closet... all with tasks, but YOU CAN ONLY PICK 3! This is useless!
Phone app connects these to your wifi in seconds, no muss no fuss. Alexa integration just as easy.

Because the switch has the reset button on it it doesn’t conform to the rest of the outlets. I tried at friends house to see if it was just my configuration and same problem. Product might be ok for single switch but doesn’t work in a gang switch setting.
Easy to set up, easy to use. Alexa integration was easy, and the switch is working well. It's such a great product, that I bought and now use a second one.

Update 7/17/2019: Do NOT buy TP Link /Kasa branded switches or modules. They no longer function with Google Home nor Alexa. Stopped working months ago and there is no sign that Kasa / TP Link intends on doing anything about it. I have begun the very expensive process of replacing every TP Link switch in the house.
high quality, well worth the money. No problems at all

Simple to install. It does require a neutral wire  (White in most US indoor circuits).  I installed them about 2 months ago.  No issues so far. These are Version 2 of the hardware (no idea what the improvements are).

This product is fantastic!  Not only does it work perfectly, the instruction for installation are right in the app and walk you through it step by step.  Setup and linking with Alexa was a breeze.  Have a TP-Link plug as well and they are super easy to use, with or without Alexa.  Will likely be buying more as we automate the house.  Now gotta see what else they have in their collection.

I have 10 of these so far. They are easy to install and they easily connect with Alexa. I love this product, but I still feel they are a bit too pricey. Watch for deals. They tend to be cheaper at Christmas time. Also, sometimes you can get a deal through Costco.

Easy to install and set up. Basically a direct switch replacement. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that a regular switch has a metal mounting plate with a standard thickness and this switch has a plastic mounting plate that is twice as thick. If you are placing it in a single switch configuration it won't be an issue. If you are putting it in a 3 gang switch box (like I was) the original switch cover doesn't line up as easily having different thickness mounting plates.

I have a houseful of these.  8 switches, 2 bulbs, 4 plugs, and amazon echo devices.  They work without any hassle.  I only wish they were about $10 or more cheaper.  If you're looking to get into smart home, the TP-Link smart switches are the way to go.  I also wish they made a dimmer switch.

I purchased this with an open mind.  I Keep on forgetting to turn off the front door light when I leave for work.  I purchased this and installed it.  I set the schedule when to turn on and off.  It has been working great.  Works great on my network.  Great buy, now I am planning where else I can install these switches.

It was easy to install and works perfectly every time. I will buy it again. This is in my kitchen due to the light switch being on the other side of the room. Now all I do for light is tell Alexa to turn on the kitchen light. No longer walking through a dark house.

Easy to install and hook up to Google home. Works well and I’ve had no issues. Have had them installed for about a month.

As for my opinion, toggle switches are a thing of the past and should be. thanks for a great product.
This switch is very simple to install if you’re comfortable working with electrical wiring. After install, setup is a breeze. I have had this installed for a month and it is working as expected.

So cool to tell Alexa to turn my exterior garage light on (the switch is not in the house). I do wish it was a little less deep as it was tough getting it mounted in a dual switch box. (but I managed)TP-Link is the best with these types of items as well as their wifi routers are top notch as well!

Incredibly easy to install and set up and it actually works the way it says.After way too much frustration with the WeMo light switch and the lack of knowledge  Belkin's Tech support WeMo switch I purchased this one and will never look back.

Easy to install.  Easy to link to Amazon Echo.  No issues six months in.  Can be difficult to fit in switch boxes if you have multiple switches.  I ordered for my sons room.  He lost his leg years ago to an infection and now he can turn his light and fan on and off with his Echo Dot.  Highly recommend.

The only simplest setup switch available, donut bother about 4 wires and confusing explanations in documents. Connect only load and input (2 black wires) and it work fine. Earthing not so necessary as it don't have metal body which you may touch. It work fine for me.

Extremely easy to install and link to Alexa - Simple swap in, swap out from the old toggle switch. I was able to easily install my TP-Link Switch (check out the how-to installation video on YouTube). The only problem was cramming all the wires behind the switch because the casing is thicker (deeper) than the original rocker switch. Be sure you've enabled "Remote Control" for the switch in the TP-Link Kasa app otherwise Alexa won't be able to discover it.﻿ I was able to schedule it to automatically turn-on and turn-off the front porch light everyday.

I have 2 of these in my room to control a cieling fan and lights. Worked flawlessly for about 8 months, now it acts as a strobe light for some reason and constantly flashes when turned on. Fan switch still works great. Will probably buy another one, but just warning people this happened to me

Bought a used product, product unblemished, instructions clear, packaging neat. Install was very simple and easy. Only thing to look out for is to really stuff the wires back in the hole neat, because of the extra bulk of the switch. Connected to the app and Google home on first try. Solid connection after a couple days. Would buy again.
I will buy TP-link products. They are very nice. They are very easy to install. They work very nice withe the app. I have some set on timers and in groups.
Easy and fast installation.. Connects to Wi-Fi almost instantly and works with Google home app
Was a pain to get installed , did not want to connect. Finally after and hour got it connected just hope I never have to do that again :)
