Instead, you have to go to another web site for IFTTT and create an account (in addition to the account you have to create during the Kasa app setup) and find an Applet on the web site, link it your your account, and configure it there -- except it dosent work that way either.I set up auto-on at sunset -- and nothing happened.  Very, very angry.  On the WeMo switch, I was able to install and configure everything on the WeMo App in one go.  No fuss.  I will be returning this and gonig back to WeMo.
HS200 Wi-FI switch-“This is a review of a free product received from TP-LINK as part of the review program.”

I purchased Leviton DW15S-1BZ, Wemo Wi-Fi Light Switch, and TP-Link Smart Wi-Fi Light Switch for comparison.The TP-Link Smart Wi-Fi Light Switch was bulky.  Much larger than a regular light switch and larger than the Wemo.  About the same size as the Leviton.  The TP-Link had wires coming out of the unit that must be attached with wire nuts.  This large switch now requires more space in a small electrical light switch box.  The Leviton had lugs, just like a regular light switch which saves space. The indicator light on the switch could have been helpful if it showed the opposite of what it does.  The indicator illuminates when the switch is not in use.  TP-Link claims this is a night time locator.  But for me, the switch is running outdoor lights and I want the indicator to be ON when the lights are ON.  This function cannot be changed on the TP-Link but the Leviton switch allows you to configure the indicator to your liking. You may activate the indicator light to function as a night time locator as the TP-Link or as an indicator to show the switch is active.  The TP-Link may be turned on or off by tapping the bottom of the rectangular switch.  The Leviton functions just like a non-smart switch, tap the top to turn on, tap the bottom to turn off.  I prefer the Leviton operation.  And last, the TP-Link software is functional, but turning on and off lights requires going through more menu buttons than I care for.  I prefer the Leviton software design and function.  Both switches functioned perfectly under Alexa’s control after set up.

Firstly - TP-Link is one of my favorite home networking hardware suppliers right now. I'm a little sad to be giving the HS200 only four stars.Here's why - I just want to control the switch with Alexa (or wink if I have to). I don't want to create yet another account and keep yet another app installed on my phone. I also don't want to depend on any provider, including TP-Link, to maintain a web server. If that web server dies for any reason then I'm stuck with a switch I can only control locally through a particular app. For example, what if TP-Link got acquired by Cisco or Microsoft and they decided to charge for accounts or shut down the service or something. I expect to live in this house for decades and I expect infrastructure (like light switches) to last for a very long time. The TP-Link server is an unwanted point of failure.

What I like:  1. Price...these switches are at a price point about 60-70% of what the Leviton switches cost.  2. The Kasa App - pretty easy to find and setup new device.  3. Alexa integration. - automatically imported my devices into Alexa once they were setup.What I don't like: 1. The plastic look/feel of the switch.  Dealing with electricity, this isn't something that completely had my mind at ease. Compare it to the Leviton - the Leviton switch feels more substantial and sturdy.  2. The connectivity.  I used this in a switch-box that has three switches. and the space behind the switch has limited space for excess cable/wire.  The wires coming out of plastic requiring wire nuts just doesn't strike me as robust as terminals to which the 12/3 house wiring is inserted directly on the switch.

If you're looking to make a single switch in your house or business operable over the Internet, this is exactly the device you need. With minimal electrical fuss and installation, you can solve that one simple problem and it's extremely robust in the four weeks I've been testing. It survives router resets, Internet outages and all the usual manner of real-life glitches that can happen with these sorts of gadgets.There are a few gotchas to consider though. The depth of unit will not work for all installations, double-pole (i.e. two switch lights) won't work, and if you have metal plate covers, these wreak havoc with the wifi connection. Additionally, for building out a whole wired house with many of these types of switches, this is not a good solution. I use the switch with the IFTTT app so when I open my garage door the main light also comes on - despite being a fairly ropey use case, it actually works perfectly.

Works great. It was easy to install.  You do have to download the fee "Kasa" app but it's cheaper than a Hub. With the app you name the switch and connect it to your network, and enable the Kasa skill in Alexa. Then you can verbally tell Alexa to "find devices" which she does in about 20 seconds. From there you can control the switch with Alexa, turn it on and off at the wall, or any combination thereof.  You can also control it remotely with the app. It even has a pale glowing light to it so you can find the switch in the dark.Within the app you can set a schedule, set a one-time timer telling it to turn either on or off after a time you select, and the cool one: set an away mode. You set a time period, repeating every [S M T W T F S] that you'll be away. During that time the switch will turn on and off at random times to make you appear home.

Poorly designed product. The Reset and Restart buttons are immediately adjacent to the switch so once a week they are getting accidentally pressed. When that happens the light needs to be setup through the app and Alexa again. Don’t install in a kids room; tiny fingers are always triggering the reset buttons.

Works seamlessly with Alexa.  Fairly easy to install.  Make sure you get the load lines in the correct spots (I had red/black lines and had to swap them around).  Turns on instantly via voice command, no lag.  Doesn’t have an annoying glow from the switch itself, I need complete darkness to sleep so this was important for me.

Works way better for room lights than a smart plug in the outlet.  You can tell Alexa to turn on and off the lights while also maintaining the convenience of manually using the toggle switch.  I used my own plate cover also, so that's possible.That being said, you do need a neutral wire.  If you don't have one then what you can do is rewire your switch to use the ground wire as a neutral instead of a ground.  Not necessarily code compliant, but it does work without having to run new wire thru the wall.  You can always ground it to something else if necessary.

First off, it was really tough for me to decide which switch to install this on because I have converted most of my switches with a mixture of Lutron Caseta and some Lutron sensor switches for the bathrooms and garage.After a long deliberation, I decided to install this in one of the switches that is connected to an outlet. It works perfectly, I have lampshades connected to the outlet and they turn on and off as designed.

I wired the switch to a GAF MasterFlow whole house fan, model 30BWHFS24M which draws 4.5 amps of power on Hi. It's been working fine for several months. You can't wire the switch to run on both Hi and Lo speeds, but I always ran it on Hi anyway. This is a nice solution for those of you out there with whole house fans. Like the switch instructions say, however, you need to provide the white wire to the switch.

Mine is within 25 ft of my router, I have things hooked to the same router some 200ft or more away. It never fails if I actually wish to use this switch it never communicates or it’s always offline for whatever reason. Power isn’t an issue, signal strength from the router isn’t an issue. Maybe mine is defective or maybe they’re all junk but I would definitely not make this purchase again.

Love these switches just not this one. I tried to save some money by buying certified refurbished from Amazon.  I cannot remotely control the device with Alexa I have done the factory reset many times and I’ve now had to email TP Link a bunch of information on the switch to get them to unlink a device to someone else’s account so I can remotely control it with Alexa.

Great switches! Works perfectly with Alexa. Rarely drop the connection. These are great for placing the switch far away from where you would want to use the switch. For example, the switch for my outside lights are upstairs on the Second Story. With these, I can tell Alexa to turn on or off the lights while I'm downstairs

We installed two of these yesterday - one to control our kitchen lights, and the other to control our family room lights (the two most used lights in our home). Since I am not comfortable making electrical outlet connections, the first step was to get a good electrician to install the switches. This was particularly important for our kitchen, where it was a "three way port" (two different switches controlling the lights). The electrician disabled one of the switches by disconnecting the red wire behind it. Once he installed the TP Link switches, the wifi setup through the Kasa app was a breeze (to connect/test the app with each of the two switches). If you do this successfully, you can turn on/off your lights from your Kasa app on your phone. NOTE: Make sure your "devices" (switches) on the Kasa app are "remote enabled" in the device settings. This should be the default, but double check. Also, you will have to create/remember a TP Link "cloud" account for your Kasa app (as prompted on that app),  because you will need that userid/password to connect the Alexa Home skill for TP Link to the discoverable devices (which is the final step to enable voice control of the light switch devices through Alexa).We named our TP link switch devices as "My Kitchen Light" and "My Family Room Light". When you want to ask Alexa to turn on/off each of the lights, you don't have to say the whole phrase. It's sufficient to have just the word "Kitchen" or "Family" in what you tell Alexa. For example, I can say:
You can get cheaper smart switch for like $10 each but the software will be buggy and no updates.Kasa is more expensive but has better software support and future updates.

The switch is great with nice simple design, lacks features like dimming  the only CON and I put it in capitals is the LED indicator light, if you install this in your bedroom you don't really need to turn on the lights, the indicator is so powerful and bleeds that much light that you can see everything at night,  Works with Amazon Alexa, voice control.  Works well w the  KASA app .For us one of these are enough we much preferred the Kasa plugs and lights over this unit .

I have gradually gotten more and more TP link devices over the last month, and they all work great with alexa! I have three switches and one outlet. If one or more devices that read offline on your alexa app, you need to make sure that the account the you linked with alexa "owns" that device. What I mean by owns is that when you first installed the device, you used that account to connect it to your wifi. If you do not own a device, but connect that account to Alexa, it will cause those devices to show up as offline in the alexa app. If you go to the Kasa app and log into your account and one or more of your devices says local, that means you DO NOT own it that device. If you own a device, there would be no local symbol next to it. If you run into this problem, you'll need to reset the device (the steps vary with the kind of device so just look it up), then set it up with the Kasa account you have linked with alexa. Hope this helps!
Pros -1. looks nicer (in appearance) than its competitor products

I like almost everything about this switch, but you cannot turn off the night light and it is very bright at night.  I wanted to put this in the bedroom, but we had to cover the bottom of the switch with duct tape due to the brightness of the nightlight in the switch.  I sent a message to support on their website and never received a response.  I even tried accessing the API directly, but you can only control the Wi-Fi indicator that way.  I'll have to move this to another room and buy a different brand for our bedroom.  If you don't mind the bright switch light, this switch is fine.  For the money, I expected better control and service.

I have a few of these switches throughout the house. After about a year having them, I really haven't had any issues that I initially expected wifi disconnections, reseting after power outages etc. They are really reliable, aside from the initial programming, I haven't done anything else. If you need a dimmer in your house, it makes way more sense than buying a traditional one. The on/off switches I've found are most useful for outdoor lights or something else you want on a timer.

This is exactly what it should be. A very simple Wi-fi switch. Other than doing exactly what it should do, my favorite part of this switch was the installation walkthrough in the app.Maybe I'm getting old, but I just don't have the patience for pages of tiny instructions written in 6 or more languages with tiny little diagrams. I'm about as technical as they come - but I don't want to read instructions. To install this switch, you open the app, tell it you haven't installed the switch yet, and you'll get step by step instructions.

Easy to install (recently built home had deep electrical boxes) works well with Alexa and TP app. Went on extended vacation had lights turn on and off using timer in app also was able to change on and off  times from remote location.. having lights go on and off good but frequently changing the times better.

I just installed the light switch. It took a bit longer than expected due to the size of the switch required moving the wires around for it to fit in a gang configuration. Also I have an old home so not all light switches have neutral wire. Despite the challenges the light switch is working perfectly and I am able to control my living room lights via Amazon echo.

used three of these for outdoor lighting (two for standard front house lighting and one for Holiday receptacles near the roof line) so we can run all the outdoor lighting on schedules. These work perfectly and I am tempted to replace a lot of my switched with these. they are a little bulky, so if your boxes are a little cramped to begin with, you might have to clean up some of the excess wiring hanging out behind your switches,
Awesome switch!!! Works exactly as I had hoped!I especially like the soft on and off.

This switch works great. The installation was fairly simple. The only problem I ran into was fitting the switch into the switch box due to excessive wiring in the switchbox. Setting it up was a breeze using the Kasa app. Intergration with Alex and Google Assistant is excellent with responses to voice commands being very quick. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the switch felt to click.

I purchased this and absolutely love it.  I have it installed to control the main light in my living room.  I wanted to be able to retain the functionality of a regular switch but still have Alexa compatibility for control from the couch.The install was quick and painless.  It even comes with new wire nuts to do the install.  So far I haven't had any connectivity issues with the light switch at all.  I am very pleased and already planning where I would like the next few of these to go in my home.

I’m disappointed. I’ve purchased multiple hs200 through amazon.ca and did not see the warning I need two hot wires (line).  I used my multimeter a it appears they are in parralel  or shorted indidebswitch.  I’ve installed two black wires shorted to line and one to load, bonded the green to ground. It takes some programming from the tabled running kasa before it fails instillation. After failure of install I’m able to press the the on off remote from program. I can hear relay click but no light.  It does it even work as a manual switch.

I purchased one, paid an electrician $80 to install. The unit died within 1 hour. Had to call the electrician againto install the old switch. He charged my $40....Got a replacement unit. I installed this one myself, as the electrician had pulled all the proper ground and neutral wires and had made the proper receptacle. Died with 1 hour.

I set this switch up with my tablet using Tp-link's Kasa App which has the install instructions. Note: they weren't included in the box. The switch works perfectly with the Amazon Echo Dot and Alexa App to control the bedroom's overhead fan. It's great for turning the fan on and off in the middle of the night. Paired together with other smart devices in the Alexa App you can control multiple devices with different commands. This is ideal when you have multiple living states such as morning, evening, and reading lights. It can also come on and off with sunset and sunrise.Cons

This is a review of a free product received from TP-LINK as part of the review program.The TP-Link HS200 Smart Wi-Fi Switch is a perfect addition to my home automation plan.  I was already using several TP-Link Wi-Fi smart plugs to control lamps with good results, but I was wishing I could control outside lights as well.  This product perfectly fills that void for me.  However, unlike other TP-Link plug-and-play products, this one requires that you are comfortable with simple electrical wiring to replace an existing 110v switch (or willing to hire an electrician). All you need to complete the installation is a screwdriver, a smartphone, and a wi-fi network. Everything else you need is included in the package.

This product is great and extremely affordable compared to other options. It is very easy to set up and once it is set up, you won't have to worry about it again. Even if your internet connection dies, you can still use it as a manual switch. It has a convenient light on the actually button when the switch is "off" that way you can see where it is at night (it's dim enough to not cause unnecessary light in a room). The best part is that it does NOT require a hub or any extra device to work, unlike some other brands.

I have 11 TP-Link devices now (6 switches & 5 plugs. Once the first switch was set up (over a year ago) with the Kasa App the remaining 10 (added one at a time over the next several months) were a snap to add and synced automatically with the Alexa App. Have never had a problem with any of them until now. One switch inexplicably dropped off my WiFi network and I had to do a factory reset. Simple and worked but now would not respond to Alexa voice commands. It worked manually and with both the Kasa and Alexa App just not with Alexa voice commands.I emailed TP-Links' tech support on Saturday evening requesting help. Not expecting a response to after the weekend I woke Sunday morning to find TP-Links' Tech Supports reply with 4 suggestions to resolve. First suggestion worked (simply change the device's name in the Kasa App which synced automatically with the Alexa App).

We purchased the Kasa Smart Switch specifically for a yard light we frequently forget to turn off on our deck. We have a Lab-Border Collie mix who loves to go outside frequently to make sure the back yard is “secure”. It seemed like half the time we would let Bella in, get settled back in somewhere, and then realize the deck light was still on. I was thrilled when I found the Kasa Smart Switch just for this specific situation. Now, if it’s forgotten on, not a problem! I pull out my phone or have a quick chat with Alexa and it’s taken care of. This product was a perfect addition to the Kasa Smart Bulbs and Smart Plugs we had already purchased and use regularly.We also just purchased an additional Kasa Smart Switch for our front yard light which has been extremely handy to control remotely.

Love this device. I bought it from Fry's electronics.  We are using this device to turn on and off  our water fountain so we do not have to manually do it. It is nice to set a schedule and just forget it.  I also connected it my Amazon echo and Google home which allows me to send voice commands to turn it off and on and get the status. Both Amazon echo and Google home work like a charm. I Installed the device in my garage and it has been running for about a month now. We live in Arizona so our garages can get pretty hot and the switch has not shown any signs of malfunctioning because of the heat.  The software setup was a nice touch as it walked you through wiring setup and then attaching the switch to your network. The only thing that is annoying is that the switch can not find hidden networks. I had to unhide my network attach the device and then hide the network again.  I would like to find more reason around the house to buy more of these switches.  I would recommend this product for sure.

Love this light switch!!. I had it installed for the front porch light.  It works great!!  I love that if we go somewhere and are gone until it's dark, I can turn the light on with my phone! The set up could not have been easier since I already had Kasa installed on my phone. I would love to have these in every room of my house!! This is a review of a free product received from TP-Link as part of the review program.Update......After one week, the amber wifi light would come on in the middle of the night, indicating firmware updating during which the switch wouldn't work.  This switch was next to our living room light switch. After two weeks, when we would turn on the L.R. light, the porch light and spotlights would flicker, even when off. The third week, the amber wifi light came on and stayed on and the porch light and floodlights no longer worked.  We had our electrician remove it and replace our standard switch.

So in order to install this, you need a neutral wire at the switch.  I don't have that where I wanted to put this, or probably anywhere in my house since it was built in the early 70s.  I didn't see that requirement when I ordered it, and waited a few months before trying to install so now I can't return, it's a completely useless device to me. I called the TP-Link about returning it, and found customer service enthusiastic but ultimately frustratingly unhelpful.  My research showed that natural wires only became common after the 1980s, so buyer beware I guess.

I love this product. It makes life alittle easy or should I say lazy. With this feature you can turn your light off and on by your phone. You can turn on the light when away from home. You can also hit the square switch to turn the light on manually.  I love it and you will too.
I've been using these for about a year now and they are great!I use them with Alexa and bought them specifically because they were Alexa compatible.

This light switch had to be installed by our local electrician and my more computer savvy husband had to figure out how to get it to work with our Echo.  Once those two hurdles were jumped, we were in business.  Now, we can lie in bed and have our Echo turn the bedroom lights off and on.  It's quite handy!  We use the Wink hub to control our smart gizmos and this switch doesn't need a hub, but it also doesn't seem to interfere with the rest of our gizmos that do use the hub.  I love smart devices and I will be very glad when they all become plug and play.

Have purchased 5 of these so far. Super easy set up, love them! Love being able to turn on or off any light in the house and being able to do it from the couch or in another state. Worked perfectly for the Christmas lights outside...possibilities are endless.

This is a review of a free product received from TP-LINK as part of the review program.I think this is a wonderful addition to the smart 'things' product line of TP-Link. I received this about 3 weeks ago and after taking about 10 minutes to install it, the switch has performed just as well as a traditional switch with the added benefit of having additional functionality like turning it on remotely and setting a schedule. I was impressed with the aesthetics of the switch and the accompanying wall plate that comes with it. The wifi connectivity is great as well considering I have mine installed a good 3 rooms (and 1 level) away from my main router and haven't had any signal drops yet.

I received this switch as part of TP-Links review program for a fair review and that is exactly what I plan on doing.This switch came well packaged, and the only unboxing "issue" I had was a few pieces of foam that I thought may be part of installation, but they aren't. It is just very well packaged in order to keep things from touching and scuffing during shipping.

The install, wifi, app, and smart home integration is all great. Where this device fails to delivers is when you manually press the button, it's basically like flipping a coin to find out if your light will come on or not. Tap it once, light will come on, then instantly go out... it's super frustrating, do not buy.

Very happy with this switch. Integrates well with Google Assistant and is easy to install. The customization is intuitive. I replaced almost all the house switches with Kasa smart switches. Great buy.

If you are trying to install this switch in with other standard wall switches under a single faceplate, you will have problems as for some reason, the hole placement is nonstandard and those on this switch won't line up with the others.  Otherwise it works fine except that you must install Kasa app before you can add the switch to google home.
I’d recently bought two Kasa Smart Switches. After installation, I noticed that the faceplates for both switches were not flat, leaving wide gaps on top and bottom between the plates and my walls.

The switches are incredibly stable and reliable. Unlike other products I have used, they never have issues with my connection to Alexa and or the network. I would love to have every switch in the house replaced with a Kasa switch!

Kudos to TP-link and Kasa line, a great product that help you save money and automate your lights, this is my #10 switch, slowly replacing all the old school switches at my house, and the price, it's just too honest. 5 stars

This is a review of a free product received from TP-LINK as part of the review program.  This is a great switch for basic functionality.  It wire's in to existing locations like any other "dumb" switch.  Set-up was easy using TP-LINK's Kasa app.  The app allows for you to set up schedules to turn the switch on/off.  It also allows you to manually switch it on/off remotely.  If you have an Amazon Echo, you can add this to the Echo allowing you to flip the switch using voice commands as well.  Throughout my usage, there were zero problems even after a power outage.All of this being said, however, the decision to buy this really comes down to what you are looking for.  If you have are looking for basic, "smart" switch functionality, this is a great option.  It does what it was designed to do perfectly.  Integration with Amazon's Echo line-up (Echo, Dot, Tap) is an added bonus.  However, if you are running a more advanced home automation solution (such as SmartThings, Wink, VeraPlus, etc.), you might want to look elsewhere as there is no integration currently.  Nor is there any integration with IFTTT.  Hopefully, this additional integration will come shortly, as having separate apps to control all of these one-off home-automation products is a real hassle.  The true power of home automation is in the integration of all devices.

I have had great experiences with multiple TP-Link products, but particularly like the light switch I installed for our back yard light.  We were always leaving the light on, so adding the Kasa smart switch has taken care of that problem.  Now we can turn off the light with by voice using one of our Google Home devices or simply use the Kasa or Google Home apps to do it.Setup is super easy and the switch never fails to work properly.  I highly recommend the TP-Link family of smart products.

Wiring and installation was simple and straight forward.  The walk-through on the app was good but lacking for the wiring if you don't have previous experience in home electrical.  The app was easy to follow for connecting to home wifi and device.  After a few weeks I have to press the restart button because the a few second lag developed from me saying "Alex turn on light" till the light comes on.

Bought this on Prime Day to use for my front porch lights. Installation was easy enough for me to do myself. So I f you know basic wiring you can handle the install without an electricians help. Be aware that it is a tight fit in the outlet box. My husband was impressed with the clean and modern (screwless) switchplate that came with it.

Once in a while a product really does what it claims it will do.  That's always a pleasant surprise for me.This really was a quick and easy install, both physically (the video they have here goes into detail for people who aren't electrically inclined) and app-wise.

Among many reviews, it does not work at 220V.I was worried about the LED light not working, but it was installed and working well.Regarding 220V, I get confirm from TP-Link via E-mail.It is working also well via Google Home and Kasa app.

I have had 2 of these switches installed for over 2 months now and they are working very well. I have not experienced any issues with network connection reliability and they automatically reconnected to my WiFi network after a power outage. Both switches are being controlled by Node-Red running on a Raspberry Pi 3.

Great Idea but there are some problems. Current overhead LED light is on a switch and works fine. Install the TP link switch and it flickers on and off. There is insufficient product information to determine the resistor to fix the problem . There is nothing on what to do if you have this problem. I retuned the product for refund. Hopefully they realize this and post the information to resolve this issue.

This is a great switch!  It's a compact design that fits easier into a tight electrical box.  The wires are pre-attached to the switch so I only needed the supplied wire nuts to connect the switch to the power.  The app has also worked well, with Alexa easily identifying the new device.  I plan on purchasing more switches.

The switch is excellent quality and works great and has great integration with Alexa. I took off a star because the casing around the switch is a thick plastic and not metal like my regular switches. This makes it very hard to fit it into an existing set of switches without the face plate protruding out. Its also tricky to make it line up with the rest of the switches.

No longer have to remember to turn on soffit lights around our house at night and turn them off at daybreak. I love this product and very easy to install. Install without being a super smart electrician.  One does not need to know which wire is load and which is neutral.  Simply a great switch.  Mine is connected to an Echo so I can voice command the light to go on and off.

I am making my home smarter by using these switches. I love asking Alexa to turn my ceiling fan and lights off and on! If I have to work late, I can turn on a light from my phone. So convenient. As long as TP-Link keeps the software working decently and the switches don't burn down my house, I will keep adding switches.

This is a review of a free product received from TP-LINK as part of the review programOverall, this product performs extremely well. At $39.99 your better off going for a single smart bulb (such as a hue bulb) if you just want to control a single bulb.  However, if you want to control a fixture with multiple bulbs, non standard bulbs (such as exterior lights), or non-light devices this is a fantastic choice.

I finally had an opportunity to attempt to install this device and realized I am screwed out of my purchase. As they say Buyer Beware!!!Here is what I found after chatting with the folks from tp-link:

I bought this switch for the bedroom so that my Fiancé and I wouldn't have to get out of bed to turn off the overhead lights. Once I figured out  that the directions for installation were on the Kasa App I was able to easily wire it into our switch box. Setting it up to work with our Amazon Alexa units was also very easy. Also watched a YouTube video that demonstrated the installation.

We have been using a TP link WiFi plug connected with Alexa for a few years and loving it so we decided to get their light switch when it went on sale during prime day.  For someone that has never worked on any light switches in the past, this is considered easy to install, pretty straight forward by following their step by step instructions in the app.  I didn’t have any issues setting it up in the app either.  It took me less than 15 mins to get the job done.

Super easy to install and works great with Alexa. My husband downloaded the Kasa app, and that works great, but I just either use the Alexa app or tell Alexa to turn the light on or off. It took my husband about 10 minutes to install the switch and about one minute to sync it with Alexa.

Surprised that none of my wall switches have a neutral wire. Without this, the smart wall switch is useless. I had to return. Recommend you check your wiring before ordering. Zero stars if you can't use it. Probably 4-5 stars if the neutral wire is there.

My bad.  I assumed that it would dim thru the app like the bulbs.  I know it did not have a dimming control on the switch, but thought like the TP-Link bulbs it would dim thru the app.  Nope.  So it's JUST A FANCY SWITCH.  It does work.  But I had a dimmer before ... now I don't.  Going to return this to store and buy a Leviton DW6HD-1BZ.

Mechanically, it installed easily (took about 4 minutes).Electrically, it took perhaps 4-5 "tries" before it finally connected to my wi-fi network, but I had experienced this with several TP-Link Smart (wall) Plugs so I knew to just keep on trying (the Kasa software kept telling me to connect the switch to my wi-fi using my iPhone's settings, but my iPhone setting were showing it connected).

We have several Kasa smart plugs and they work well, so we just bought two of their smart light switches to control some LED track lights. The switches are easy to install. Instructions are clear. They interact with Alexa perfectly. The switches look good and come with their own cover plate. Great product.

Bought one this week and had my handy man install it to run a ceiling fan. He could not get it to work with the fan, but we got it to work on two other lights. When I called Tech Support they told me that this switch did not work a fan but he vould not tell me why. I thought a switch was a switch????🙁🙁🙁

After buying it, it took me about 3 weeks to get off my butt to install it.  Once I started, it took me less than 30 minutes to install.  If I had done this during the day, it would have gone faster.  Instead I did it when the sun was going down, so I needed to get an external light source as well.  After installing the Kesa app and configuring the Alexa app it worked like a charm.  The only issue I had was that I needed to configure the Alexa using my wife's phone, since the Alex app is registered to my wife's account.

Great Product. Easy to install and setup.  App is straightforward and easy to use.  If you are trying to use it with Amazon Alexa, make sure you turn on remote control in order for Alexa to discover the device.  I knocked off one star because it is only for use with single pole switches that have a neutral wire available.  Meaning that this switch can only be used for a device that is only controlled by one switch (ie. bedroom or bathroom light) and does not work with devices that can be controlled by multiple switches (ie staircase lights where there is a switch at the top and bottom of the staircase, a hallway, etc.).  Unfortunately I didn't realize this until I went to install the three I had ordered. I was able to install one in my bedroom and it works and looks great!  Returned the other two with no problems.  I would definitely recommend this product and would order quite a few if it wasn't just for single pole switches.

Easy to install, setup wasn’t bad. But they constantly disconnect and scenes never run (when using Kasa app or SmartThings integration). Would say it’s one off but 6 at 3 different locations constantly doing the same thing. Save your money and get a standard z-wave plus switch.

its pretty easy to install and set up.  works well, didn't need a gateway or anything.  These new smart electronics are kind of bulky and hard to fit into a standard size outlet box so you may have to do some wire management.
This works great.  I initially tried smart bulbs, but wasn't as convenient as having a switch.  Easy to install.  Easy to setup.  Programmed to run during certain times.  No issues.

Works fantastic. Easy to install, easy to connect to wi-fi and Alexa. All instructions are right in the Kasa app from installing the switch to connecting to wi-fi and Alexa.There are 4 wires: 1 white, 1 green, 2 black. You only need the white and black wires. If you have a green (ground) wire, then it can be connected. Hardest part was trying to find the right breaker to turn off. :)

After figuring out how to to wire it (I am not an electrician.), it has worked perfectly from the first time I turned it on.  It is linked with Google Home, it just requires a simple voice command.  I consulted a friend who is an electrical engineer who explained very simply how to install it.
I researched light switches, much a cheaper than changing every bulb, and decided on the tp-link hs200. I am very impressed. Easy to install, works outstanding with Alexa, and reasonably priced!

Inexpensive and reliable. I would like more device types in the Kasa line. Also an inexpensive three way switch would be great. Please continue to make new devices and expand the compatibility and programmability of these devices.

This was so easy to setup and use I plan to buy more. The app walks you through install and setup. In addition to turning the light on via your phone the app also lets you set the switch on timers and a vacation mode.

I purchased a single one of these as a test to try it out. I'm using it on my exterior porch light to have it come on at sunset and go off at sunrise.Wiring was easy as I had a cluster of neutral wires in the back of the box. After that, it took less than ten minutes before I had it working. It's very easy to get this connected to your WiFi with the Kasa app. I've come home every day to an outside light on and it's been off when I've left every day. Works great, I'll be getting more and probably a couple of the HS100 as well.
I installed this KASA Smart light switch in my living room to switch the ceiling lights. The APP that comes free for both Android and IOS works great and also works seamlessly with ALEXA. Thanks!
Excellent and easy to install! A nice upgrade to the home.
It's a smart switch. It works as a smart switch. It works well and always as expected. Nothing special though. But it doesn't need to be special. It does its job.

Easy to install. Easy to integrate wi  the h Alexa via Kasa app. Now the problem is to control my spending. I want about 20 more of these.PS—I’m dreadfully fearful of doing electrical work and decided to give the install a try after watching a couple of YouTube videos.

Listen to the bad reviews.  I bought it and it worked for a few days. Then got a notice for a firmware update.  Well I installed it and now the switchmate it dead.  It does not even power with new batteries.  What a total waste.  I contacted switchmate and got no response.

I had some wemo switches in the past, but the feeling when pressed physically, was not as satisfying as it is with the tp link. I also need to say that the TP-Link application is better optimized, besides offering more options. The only two problems I have had is that the application does not offer a widget, besides there are times when the switch is disconnected, although later it is automatically connected. The best brand of switches I've tried.
These have been working perfect for me so far. The install took some time and the sync was little long. But, after the install is done, these have been working with out any issues.

Exactly as advertised. Works great for my exterior lights. I have one on a simple on/off schedule which works exactly as programmed. The second is just scheduled to make sure it gets turned off if left on accidentally. Has helped keep the electric usage down since we were very inconsistent with turning them on and off. Also helps by turning on before we get home after it's dark. Works well with Alexa, as long as you use the correct phrase. (Which should be obvious.)

Extreamly impressed great app, integration with Alexa is flawless the sun rise sun set schedule is beyond my expectations, make sure you have a hot a switch leg and a neutral at your light switch box or this will not work DO NOT tie the neutral to the ground it is agains code!!! install this great device correctly

The switch is well built and works well manually. But it continually goes to "unavailable" in Home Assistant. It seems to lose it's connection or wifi signal.  It has gone unavailable 13 times in the last 45 minutes.

I used this to replace a switch that controlled an outlet... now I can turn on the floor lamp plugged in there with my Echo. Compared to some of the other "smart" outlets/switches I've used, this one just works a lot better... no issues getting it all setup initially, and no random "the device is not responding" responses from Alexa. Super happy with this!
Hmmmm....should I walk 10 ft or holler at Google to turn off the lights...Kidding...works well,  easy to install. APP could be a bit more user friendly though.

Unable to dim using the new switch and the Kasa App. Unlike other Kasa products, you cannot dim this switch using the app. TP-Link is a pretty solid manufacturer, but they should not have overlooked this.

Pros: Easy to install and connect to router. Love the scheduling and ability to turn lights on and off away from home.Cons: For sunset and sunrise settings it would be nice to have an offset. The reason, when it is officially sunset there is still light because of the curvature of the earth. Same for sunrise, we design a LED lighting product and we can offset the time to turn on/off by 1/2 hour so as to save a little more $$.
Easy install into our 4 gang switch box. Hooked up to the wifi with no issues. We can now control the light from our google home. It's great!

First, the product works great. I actually would have given this five stars except for the following. The package I received as NEW was actually a returned item. The product was missing the wire nuts and had been previously linked to another customer's account.Just to let Amazon know, it's illegal to sell a previously owned product as new. I'm going to let this one slide but if this happens again I'll see that corrective action is taken.

Fit a regular paddle switch perfectly. Used it to turn on the living room chandelier with Alexa. Fiance installed in less than 20 min. You do remove the plate from the switch, use a flat head. Refurbished but looked and worked good as new.
I've used TP Link's plugs with success, so I thought I'd try the switch.  Mistake.My daughter gave me the switch for Father's day.  After installing it I tried to activate it with the Kasa app.

I like the programming aspect of it & the ability to control it completely on my smartphone.  What I didn’t like was the instruction.  I didn’t find tihem to be clear.  I am, however, planning on buying more in the future.

The TP-Link stuff just works (unlike Wemo), but the huge downside is that you can't connect to anything outside of the ecosystem, aside from Alexa and Google voice.  That doesn't make them smart though, I have one connected to an extractor fan, which I want to trigger when a certain temperature is reached (as monitored via Netatmo).  Currently there's no way to do this, aside from a relatively complex solution on smartThings that only a die-hard automator would want to do.  So in summary, good, reliable, well priced hardware, but severely let down by lack of integration with anything.
Did Bedroom Fan and light and Living room fan and light as well as the kitchen lights. Tied into Alexa and my wife is in second heaven.

This product should be builtin USA The product appears simple to install. Turn power off and fuse and install. However insure that you have exact Wireless Password. amazing. We have solar power, APCs and generators and the light comes on ..
I’ve have several TPLibk Outlets and Bulbs so this worked great in their ecosystem along with Alexa. It looks great and is a very intuitive manual operation.

Fitting perfect in my growing smart home! Switch was easy to install, and functions as expected. I really like the 'night light' that is eliminated when the light is off. Works perfectly with kasa and Alexa. I will be adding more to my home WHEN THE PRICES COME DOWN !

Could not have been any easier to install. As always I expected problems either with the wiring or pairing. What a surprise fast, easy, and worked without a problem. The switch was used to control an overhead fan with 3 lights. I now can control the fan and each light. light 1 light 2 and light 3.Second switch is attached to a Radon system for that type of gas caused by build up of closed homes. The best part is the timer can be set to go on and of while your on Vacation. All I can say is WOW double WOW

Very easy to install, adding it was a breeze being I have other Kasa products already. Kasa program is great as you can schedule when to turn on /off this switch and also it gives you static data on switch usage

I have bought 4 so far, these things are AMAZING.. Installation is not complicated, I've done them all, I must admit that I NEED TO STOP BUYING THEM , but I will regardless. Only 7 more to go and my house will be fully smart. Wouldn't buy another brand too. All TPLink. Their integration with alexa is somewhat symphonical ..

I bought three of these and set them all up at once. One of them will not allow me to control it through Kasa (the app for this product). It says “Local Control Only” and the switch to turn on remote access refuses to turn on. This is only for one outlet. It’s dumb. This is an expensive switch it should not be so unreliable. The other two work great.
Installation was quick and easy. The Tp-link app is very easy to set up as was adding it to my Google Home app. Works perfectly, I would buy again.

Easy setup and install. Definitely review your wiring prior to purchase to verify you have a neutral line and enough space in the receptacle box to fit the unit. It was useful to have other wire nut sizes on hand, as I used some red ones when multiple neutral, load, or ground were present.
This is awesome, I love the app, I'm buying another one and setting it up on the back of the house. I kept forgetting to turn it of so I bought it, and we love it.

It looks like a regular switch but doesn't actually flip. It is a push button and not very satisfying to manually operate. Works well with Amazon echo. Not sure what would have happened if I didn't have a common wire in the outlet but I did. The instructions make it seem important.

Love the easy setup where you do not need to change your phone wifi to program switch wifi. It does it all for you. AND it saves that wifif info for future switches. sunset or sundown to anytime choices. Very well made product.

There are a bunch of switches out there. They all seem to work ok but the companion apps that control them are awful. TP Link's Kasa app works great and is easy to use. That is what separates this switch from the rest.

This was very easy to set up, and the Kasa app takes you through the process step by step. Linked fairly easily to my GHM, although it took another day (maybe less than that, I tested out voice switching immediately after linking the switch (fail) and then a day later (pass)) for GHM to detect it. I like the scheduling features, particularly that you can choose to turn switch on/off at sunrise/sunset (no photosensor, it determines the appropriate time based on your location), and the "AWAY" feature, which simulates you being home by turning switch on and off at random times. My one downside is that the switch is not dimmable. That will be my next upgrade.

I absolutely love this light switch. It was very easy to install and even easier to set it up with Alexa. I also use z-wave and wink hub paired through IFTTT but this is 1000 times better and easier. I highly recommend it!
They were difficult to install with my wiring, so I had to hire an electrician, but they work beautifully. I am happy with all of my TPLink products!
Installation is a breeze and the app is extremely intuitive.I may be switching over from Wemo to TP-link for my future smart home set-ups
No working with my Alexa it never connected to my Alexa, always say that unresponsive.
This is expensive for the price listed.  The only reason I got this is so that I can use the same app as the other smart plugs that I have.
After downloading the instructions from online (because they're not included in the box), I was able to install it without any problems especially since my 12 year old grandson was helping me!

Great controlled switch. I replaced a leviton z-wave switch with this one and have been very pleased. Setup was easy using the kasa app and connecting with echo was just as easy. The handshake speed with a wifi switch compared to a z-wave switch is outstanding. I do wish they offered a z-wave version so it could be integrated into alarm control systems. Installation was very easy as long as you have a basic understanding of how to wire a light switch. If not, please call a professional so you do not get electrocuted. I really like the fact that everything you need is included, wire nuts and decora plate.

Faceplate is VERY hard to remove. Installation is pretty easy other than that. Note: if you have multiple nutral wires connect them all and save yourself some time. I connected one of them and the switch came on and connected to WiFi but wouldn’t turn on the light. Once I connected the rest of the neutrals it worked perfectly.

I have had 2 of these switches for over a year, but occasionally I have trouble connecting them to my wifi router. When they do connect to WiFi they work well with both the kasa app and Alexa. Even when they don't connect to WiFi the manual on/off still works. Have the same problem with the TP-link smart plugs. The smart bulbs work fine.

I purchased and installed this switch three weeks ago, along with two HS110 wall plugs. Connection to Wifi worked flawlessly. The switch installation was simple, even though I was replacing a 3-way switch setup that this switch does not support. There are videos on YouTube that explain how to deal with the 3-way switch issue. Kasa installed easily and setup of the switch and wall plugs was simple. We love the automation and plan to add more switches and dimmable TPLink LED bulbs..

This product is fantastic! It took some extra work to get it installed in my older home, but after the new electrical box was installed and I figured out all of the wiring it works perfectly! I paired this switch to work with my Amazon Echo Dot, and Alexa is able control without any issues! This switch is the 3rd TP-Link Smart Home product, and I am very happy with this purchase! I highly recommend this product if you want a smart switch without having to purchase a hub.

I ordered another Best Buy brand and it was terrible..... didn't connect or work and documentation was horrible. This Kasa Smart Switch woeks flawlessly with Google Home. It was easy to install and worked immediately. Great product!

They say no where except on the switch that this is rated for just 0.3 amps.  If you want to run anything through it like a fan or heater it will not work.  I have a heater in my bathroom and it is a couple amps so the switch just kicks off when i try to run it.  Oh well.

The switch itself is working pretty good but the the fitment to wall and plate are terrible. I was putting this in a 4 Gang box and after buying a few different style plates to get a good fitment it is a no go. The plastic mounting flange on the switch is to thick and makes the plate stick off of the wall and the switch doesnt even fit in the plate very well at all. I will be returning for another brand to get better fitment.
Easy to install, great item .Bought a Leviton smart switch. Customer service was rude short temper. This is great customer service was good.

Hardware installation was straight forward, with three points worth mentioning – 1.  Before considering HS200, please make sure you have access to the neutral wire, it is usually not connected to the regular switch, but present within the j-box.  2.  This is a one way switch.  And 3. In my case, the part of HS200 that goes inside the j-box was larger than my original switch, and it was somewhat challenging to pack all the wires behind the unit in the j-box.Once the hardware was installed, connecting it with the Kasa application was easy.  It connected to the 2.4GHz network, and was all configured within a few minutes.  Now I have full control: The switch is easily controlled via the application and it can be programmed to operate on schedule.  It can also be voice controlled using Amazon Echo, Dot or Tap.  The switch looks nice, and Reset and Restart buttons easily accessible in case there is a need to reboot or reconfigure the unit.

I like that it connects easily with Alexa and that I can control it remotely with my app from anywhere. Also like the illuminated circle on the switch when lights are off so that you can locate switch in darkness to turn on manually

Had the 3 way switches installed by an electrician and connected them to the home WiFi. They worked for a few days then the WiFi connection failed. I reset it and it was working fine when I left for the summer a week later. Now that I’m gone and need them the WiFi failed again and after hiring someone to go to the house to push the reset button they will not resync with the WiFi. All other WiFi devices in the house are working fine. These are @$@p.  I worked with the tech support but no help.
Doesn't work with Siri & Homekit.  UGH!
Mid twenties single woman installed within an hour.. love being able to control porch lights when away and set up timer. Easy to use app

It's just a push button that looks like a toggle.
Great device! Easy setup with Alexa. Not a problem with dimmable light switch like i thought it would be. I'm glad i bought this!

Works and looks great! The only thing I would like to see is some randomization in scheduling automatic on/off, rather than specifying exact time.
Does exactly what it is designed to do. I've had it for months and it has lost wifi connectivity only once - and that was simple to reset. I would buy this again.
Great product! Works great!! I also have smart plugs & 3 way switches in my new house
Device is so large it wouldn't fit in existing electrical box.  Installed the largest "Old work" box available and was still a tight fit.  Setup and operation was flawless.

It also has a very nice small illuminated area, that I think looks really cool.

the best smart switches EVER! i have tried other brands and have returned them because they just din't work as well as the Tp link Kasa switch. I now won't use any other brand!

Works well, although grabbing your phone, opening the app (somewhat slow), and toggling it often takes longer than just getting up and hitting the switch.  Works well with Alexa, once you get your Alexa device setup correctly.  Not thrilled with having to link accounts my Kasa account to Alexa - just feels like a bit of a privacy breach.

This switch needs a neutral wire (and ground) to work. My home which was wired in the 70's did not have neutral wire available. It is not a rocker switch, it's just a single push at the bottom to turn it both on and off.

So I purchased 6 of these wall-mounted light switches a couple months ago, but I t took me a while to install them.  My father works with electrical things daily in his line of work, so I thought it would be an easy install.  It wasn't.  Apparently you need a neutral wire present in your existing lightswitch, which is connected to an outlet, or something.  I am still uncertain about it, but it was expense for me to get only two of them installed.  Since my aged house lacked a Neutral wire, I had to call in a licensed electrician.  The time and labor costs well into the hundreds.  This was not including the already steep price of the product, but I had little choice since the Amazon return window already closed (thanks a lot Amazon; sarcastic snicker included).  It would be great if it had a voice activated dimmer (I don't see why that would be hard, given the big price tag).  What was good was the app, or "Kasa" app.  It was straightforward and I was able to connect it to my Amazon Alexa Echo App with ease.  So now with a neutral wire my dining room and outside lights work with voice control.  I just wish I knew this information before Amazon and TP-Link sold this to me.  Hmph, no perfect rating for you.

I used this light to finish the last of my kitchen lights.  Now we can turn lights on above the island, table, counter, cabinets and sink all at once or one at a time.  I've got 4 of these switches and 2 of the Kasa plugs working with Alexa in this one room.  The WiFi setup with the Kasa app works very well.  As with all of these special light switches, they require lots of patience to fit inside a double gang (or more) electrical box.  The devices all work very well with Alexa, but I am surprised that the "group" has to be rebuilt in the Alexa app and doesn't just copy what the Kasa app has.  At least Alexa does take the Kasa device name.  It's also a little annoying that additional cell phones in the house ave to setup their own Kasa and Alexa apps as well, but it's a minor 1-time inconvenience.  Note that you do need that independent, neutral, always-on, white wire probably jammed in the back of your electrical box...there will probably be like 2 or 3 of wires actually - which is what makes it such a chore to fit the new, deep switch in.  I hope home builders start using giant, over-sized electrical boxes for smart devices, timers, etc.I'm very impressed with how well these devices are working.  In the first we week we did have 1 switch that went offline, but it's been fine since one press of the fix-it button.  I love the little circle of light that comes on when the switch is off, though it takes some getting used to remembering which one to press if you have 2 or more next to each other.  My little brain wants me to press the switch that is lit up when I go to manually turn the light off, but I have to remind myself that "duh, it's lit up cuz the light is already off".

This was the 2nd of my 1st 2 smart devices and I use it for my kitchen light.  I especially appreciate it because I can turn the lights on before I'm in the door, and of course when I'm away I can cycle them at times I choose then and there.  One of the big advantages for me is I roll out of bed and either ask Google Assistant on my phone, or Alexa downstairs (Yeah, she hears me downstairs) to turn on the kitchen lights.  That way I can ease my way, "Into the light" and make it easy on my eyes.  I used to turn my back to the kitchen, turn on the lights and walk away to the other room to let my eyes adjust more gradually.  Just to be sure it's mentioned, it can be turned on manually and has a little light on the switch paddle to find it in the dark.  I have not found that light to be too bright at all.Addendum: It is a challenge to get this in the electical box.  There are many tricks, I chose to shim my regular switch that is next to it (with popsicle stick pieces) so that both were at an even depth in the faceplate.  The faceplate is now slightly off the wall on the edges, but OK looking.

I have been using smart plugs from TP-Link for quite some time, and I am very happy with them.  So I decided to buy a TP-Link light switch for a porch light.  It was very easy to install (especially after watching the video), it integrated very easily with the Kasa app, and I am able to continue managing all my devices in a single app.  And the option in the app to allow automatic on / off relative to sunset / sunrise *with offsets* is a great feature.  Now that I have confirmed the quality of the product and ease of installation, I am planning to purchase more TP-Link switches to control additional lights and ceiling fans around my house.  I wholeheartedly recommend this product.
Excelente
Love these smart devices. They work as intended, easy to setup and install, and always work!! Worth the money.
its awesome to be able to turn on and off lights from anwhere.
Excelente facil de instalar y manejar
Looses connection quite often, easy to reset
Good price. Easy installation. Works fine!
Easy to install and work great with Alexa and google home
Delayed response
good quality product

For the those of us that are lazy and want to turn on/off a fan, light, or both without having to get up.  Awesome when you are relaxing on the couch and want to turn off said light, fan, or both.  Great for turning on the lights in a room when you get home so your not walking into a dark room (or doing with the app).
I love this product!!! I like that I can turn the light on when i’m coming home at night.

It's a light switch so it's not for anybody to install but once it's installed fairly easy to program with the Kasa app.**** Important - this switch is NOT a rocker style switch. You simply tap the bottom half of the switch to turn it on or off***

This switch was installed to complete the kitchen remodel. It does require a neutral wire as part of the installation, so if you have a switch loop you will need to replace the existing wires to add the neutral.Other than that, it just works!

I love this product,  i can use it if am away and make it look like i am still in home. And i do not have to worry to make sure if i left the lights on or off because i can verify them using the cellphone.

Had to trim wires inside electrical box to make room since the smart switch is slightly thicker than a regular switch.  Looks good once installed. I kept my old face plates. Since its a 4 switch faceplate

Was fairly easy to install. I bought one to try four my front porch light and it works great. It's nice when you're on your way home late and can turn your light on from anywhere. I will purchase more in the future.
This will replace a single stand alone switch. Not a 3 way or a light with multiple switch locations.  Make sure you have purchased the correct switch replacement for your environment.

I love returning home with my front house lights on after dark if I forget to do so when leaving during daylight hours. My former timer was tampered by grandkids or others and not reliable as is this smart device.

… very limited in available options (no dual switch, …). and looking at their web page there seems to be just very little ambition to listen to the customer base.Keep on looking for other product lines, I unfortunately started with KASA and am stuck now because I don't want to have multiple different looking light switches in my house.

Easy enough to install with basic knowledge of wiring, it took me about 20 minutes. My home was built in stages so I have five exterior lights with five separate switches in four separate rooms over three floors. Needless to say I rarely used them. Now that I have installed these on each switch there is no more running around the house. I just changed to Xfinity Home for security and the tech added the lights right on to my new system thanks to these switches. I need a few more throughout the house and will only buy these.
Easy for DIY guys. Easy to connect to wifi and home automation. Light on switch when in off is not too bright to disturb you but bright enough to find switch in the dark.
Have several of these installed. Easy setup and use. Have not tried it with Alexa so I could not rate that feature.
I am switching from insteon to Kasa for my smart home so I bought this to test out.  Works pretty well, easy to pair with alexa and the app looks better than insteon.  I will buy more.
This has been working great with Alexa! I hooked it up to a ceiling fan and it’s doing what it’s supposed to! It was a pretty easy setup.

- Very easy to install even for a person like me who did it for the first time.- Wifi reception is a bit weak (it was installed literally 20 ft from the router and didn't get the signal). I entered the information manually and it worked.

I have some smart plugs by this same brand and I really like their "away" mode that turns on lights on a random schedule when I'm out of town. I wanted to be able to control my porch light in the same way so I could turn it on while I'm out of town or if I'll get home late. Installation was pretty easy. The app walked me through every step of the installation and I was able to following along. Once it was installed, setting up programs is very easy in the app and connecting it with Alexa is also quick and simple.

This is a great product. Installation instructions are available on the app, and took around five minutes. Syncing to Alexa was super easy. Setting up a routine is easy in the Alexa app. No complaints, works great. By the way, those who complained that this isn’t a rocker switch are idiots: first, it’s a WiFi / Smarthome switch, so presumably you aren’t going to be using it manually very often, and second, REALLY??? Get a grip! Bottom line: buy this, it works.

For those who may struggle with installation, download the app first, instructions are explained really well there and I got it done in about 15 minutes. I set up a schedule for the lights and it has worked flawlessly. Integration with Alexa and Google home was as easy as signing into the account and that has worked without exception as well. Very highly recommend!

I Love KASA products, great design, easy to install and operation is solid. I installed this into a 4 Gang box and had no fitment issues, instructions are simple and straight forward even for a novice. this switch is located pretty far from my router but I have no WiFi connection issues. It controls 5 up lights on the outside of my home and was the most economical solution to automate these lights,

works great, but if you have plans of installing a lot of these and you have wifi cameras , tablets, cell phones, smart tvs , make sure your wifi is up for the challenge. buy a coulple at a time. we had Verizon dsl and their junky modem and it was not good at all, now have cable modem works awesome. these switches perform rather well
Pros1. works as described

WONDERFUL. I waited to pull the trigger on this for a while. I have 2 TP link bulbs and 2 TP link outlets. This one is a little more complex but went about as smooth as possible. Once I actually tied all the neutral wires (instead of just 1) into the switch it worked with no problem. TP link has literally never let me down.
Nothing to complain about. Have on outside lights and programmed to come on at sunset and go off at sunrise. Works every time.
Works as expected. Fits a little on the large side so you may have to trim away a little sheetrock for a perfect fit! Papers to WiFi and phone easily.
Great one touch switch! Works great with Alexa and has glow in the dark feature and looks really sleek!
Alexa, turn off the bedroom light.Well worth the money just to say that every night. This thing works like a champ.
I really like these for the outdoor lights. Makes it easy to schedule and control remotely.
I have several of these in my house and they are fantastic. I schedule my lights and forget about them - no issues.
My wife and I installed it. We have no experience but we were able to install within 30 min. It saves us from going to the dining hutch to turn on the backyard.
I was able to install pretty easily. I installed it in about an hour. I’m considering buying a few more for my house.
Works real great. I was in Florida and controlled it with my cell phone. I set it to come on in evening and to go off early mornings while I was away.
Works as expected and easy to install. Can turn my hallway lights on from my phone so it always looks like someone is home. Can even set daily timers
They are easy to install and Alexia works with them.
Easy to install. Works as advertised.
Very easy to install. Works very well with Alexa. No more getting up to turn on or turn off lights. Just tell Alexa to turn on or turn off lights.
Works great but you must have a grounded system
Works as needed and great product

It was a quick install after I installed a TP Link 3 way switch. I had to put it in a 2 gang wall plate which made for a tight fit. It would be nice if Kasa made a 2 gang and 3 gang switch wall plate. Quick connection to Kasa app and to Alexa.
Easy setup. Love it.
Returned.  Would not do what it said it would

TP-Link’s Kasa smart line has not once disappointed me with one of their products. While I havent tried everything, and stick to their lighting products, every single one has been bulletproof and easy to use. As with all Kasa products I own, setup was a breeze and took no more then 30 seconds in the application. Given you have the required wires to install this product, just wire it up, open your app and hit the ‘+’ in the top right, from there the app will walk you through setup and in no more then 30 seconds youre done and it can be controlled in your app and on Alexa if you use it. If you have Alexa setup and the app on your phone, once the device is setup in your Kasa app, it will automatically appear in your Alexa app for control as well. The Switch looks great, and is a breeze to use. I putchased this along with a HS220 Kasa Dimmer, and both of them are fantastic. Setting up schedules or using Away Mode is simple, so much so that even my retired parents can use it effectively. The Kasa app also blows the Lutron app out of the water in terms of usability. It super user friendly and easy to understand, set schedules and timers. I would STRONGLY recommend both the Kasa Dimmer(HS220) and Switch(HS200) to anyone interested in putting a little smart lighting in their home. I am also a huge fan and owner of multiple of their Kasa Smart Plug Mini’s(HS105) and they work flawlessly as well. Do yourself a favor and buy this product.The only 2 places Kasa could improve is integrating with Apple HomeKit(which the HS105 Smart Plugs were supposed to until TP-Link went back on that statement which sucks, it was a big reason I got those in the first place, but theyve been such a good quality product ive gotten over it)...as well as actually using a true ‘Rocker’ on their smart switches and Dimmers rather then a fake ‘Rocker-looking’ button. Other then that these are perfect!
Just had it installed today, part of a new construction outdoor lighting, hooked up easy and works well. Top row of 5 accent lights are hooked up to one Kasa switch, will be automated.

No problems with it, it’s actually easier to set up that my old wemo switch and cheaper, I definitely be getting more when they on sale again. I already own 2.great connectivity even after we lost power for a while.
Works great from my phone weather I am at home or at work.

This switch was simple to install and setup, provided you have a little electrical knowledge. The included instructions were clear and simple to follow. Everything needed for installation was included. However, as I installed the switch in a 3-gang box, I used a different switch plate (but it will be dependant on your particular installation). BTW, the switch also works with Google Home.

I upgraded to KASA because my other switch would disconnect from WiFi. I’ve had this for a few months now and it has not dropped off the network once. It’s clean looking and nice to have the rocker switch look.In the dark photo you only see the glowing ring which is nice to find the switch on the dark garage. The glow on the right side of that is the reflection from the flash, no light bleeds out on the side in the dark.
I like turning the lights lights on and off with my dot.
Easy to install and works with alexa
Easy to put in
Muy bueno
Great smart switch would buy again and strongly recommend. I personally use with Google nest and no issues
Install was easy and straight forward. Connected quickly to my wifi and Alexa. Working great for me so far. Need to buy more!

Muy buena inversion para tu casa me gusto bastante ya que puedo programar y decidir a que horas prender el foco junto con la alarma, ademas si lo tienes conectado a una alexa esta perfecto para sacarle el maximo rendimiento a tu alexa , puedes prenderlo y apagarlo mientras estas fuera de casa, no consume mucho internet ni se siente pero debe  llegar por lo menos la señal moderadamente, en la instalación si tienes conocimientos de electricidad no te sera muy difícil es como conectar un contacto y a la vez un apagador, en el mismo software te va diciendo como hacerlo, solo una cosa, yo no lo conecte a tierra física y no he tenido problemas.  y en el precio yo lo conseguí en 378 , es un buen precio para algo que es de marca reconocida, ya que hay mas caros

Justo lo que necesitaba, tengo un anuncio de publicidad y necesitaba prenderlo y apagarlo a ciertas horas. Con esto ya lo tengo programado y me olvido de ello.Excelente calidad, dice que es fácil de instalar y si, siempre y cuando tengas la "fase" y el "neutro" donde lo piensa uno colocar, en mi caso no fue así, por lo que tuve que llamar a un eléctrico.
Works great and easy to use.

Lo utilizo con un Amazon Echo (Alexa) y funciona a la perfección, no tuve problema para que lo encontrara y funciona sin problema. Mi único problema fue al instalarlo, por lo que veo, en México no es muy común que se instale el cable "neutral" en los apagadores y este FORZOSAMENTE necesita un cable neutro. Un  electricista lo instaló en 15 minutos.El cable neutro va del apagador a la lámpara por lo que no es nada complicado instalar. Me cobraron 200 pesos.

Got these yesterday.  I installed two side by side into a 3 gang box with a normal switch.  Each switch controls its own bank of lights.  Was a very tight squeeze to fit it all but I got it to work.  Connecting the switches to wifi was the hard part.  First switch connected perfectly first try.  Second one I had to reset and restart a few time to get it connected.  In the end both are working perfectly.

El instructivo de instalacion es pésimo, no hay diagramas de instalación enseña 3 cables en una fotografía que apenas se ve y el apagador físicamente trae 4 tuve que recurrir a un electricista profesional y no pudo instalarlo, al prenderlo la luz se vuelve intermitente y es un problema uniendo cables hay un neutro (blanco), uno a tierra (Verde) y dos negros que se supone van a corriente.Como menciona se supone porque no hay instrucciones.

This is a wonderful, easy to install, and very slick looking product. It looks and feels like a very high-quality product. This switch would easily be at home in a multi-million dollar home.My only issue is that the switch is limited to one type of plain old one-way switch installation. It seems that my home is wired with mostly power-through and two-way switches. Both types are incompatible with this switch. Fortunately, I found (only) two regular one-way switches in my home.

Estuve tratando de decidir entre varios interruptores inteligentes, una de las razones además del precio del porque elegí este fue que la aplicación para smartphone es bastante intuitiva y fácil de usar, además de las funciones que provee bastantes útiles y sin problemas de conexión. Al principio no contaba con internet por lo que únicamente podía usarlo directamente conectado al celular, aún así responde muy bien y tiene gran alcance, al menos en una casa pequeña en cualquier rincón pude encender y apagar las luces a la que estaba conectado.Lo recomiendo mucho, lo único que me gustaría es que hubieran más modelos que tuvieran más apagadores en una sola placa para poder tener más opción de reemplazar los que hay actualmente en las casas.

Delivered on time and works great.  However - I bought 2 of these (one from another seller).  I installed the first one in a single-gang box.  The box already had a few wires in it, and the TP-Link smart switch is so big that I couldn't get it into the switch box, as it was crushing the wires behind it.  I had to pull all the wires out and cut them back as far as I dared, and force the TP-Link in.  It took several tries, including shorting out the circuit and having to re-establish the Wi-Fi link several times.  All in all, it took me about 2 hours.  TP-Link needs to reduce the depth of the unit, so that wires can fit in behind it.The second unit, I installed in a 3-gang box.  Good, I thought, more room to push the wires aside so the TP-Link will install easier - wrong !  The TP-Link barely fit, but it's manufactured such that when you try to put the cover plate back on, the TP-Link does not line up with the cutout the way the other switches do.  It's about 1/16" too low, but that's just enough to stop the cover plate from going on.  It's also thicker than normal switches, so the cover plate stuck out from the wall.

I call these my pizza lights. I bought these to replace my switches in the lobby area of my house, both the indoor lobby and outdoor porch light. The wiring in my house is... not great. As an electrician I can see that whoever last wired the switches did a terrible job and made installing these switches that much harder. They left almost nothing for the neutral.Before you begin installing these switches, I must recommend you DO NOT install two side by side. Only one in a gang box. Two side by side is a nightmare to wire properly, as there is not enough room in the box for all the wires without forcing the switches in with all your body weight, and hoping nothing pops out or disconnects later. I hated installing this. It should have only taken an hour max to install, from the moment the breaker is turned off, to the moment it's in the app and I'm telling Alexa to turn the lights on and off. Instead, it took 4 hours trying to figure out what the wiring was for the house. For me, these are the pros and cons:

Me gustó mucho el apagador y todas las funciones que ofrece. Mis bocinas echo no tuvieron problema para detectarlo (bajando el Skill correspondiente) y ahora puedo prender y apagar las luces desde cualquiera de mis bocinas echo o desde mi celular Android.Me tardé un poco en hacer la instalación del apagador, debido a que mi instalación eléctrica no cuenta con distinción entre fase y neutro, además de que la caja en la que iba a poner el apagador no contaba con un cable neutro, por lo que tuve que meter un cable extra por el tubo naranja de cables eléctricos, pero valió la pena todo el trabajo (lo hice como en medio día).

I’m not a electrician but this smart light switch is very easy to install and to connect to wifi.
