You just need to research the difference between “single poll” and “3way” in order to invest $ on the correct lights/switch setup is the price is different.That being said it took me 5 min to wire and cap the new smart switch into place. It was MAGIC and EXITING. The set up of Kasa app and Alexa was pretty easy....just read!!

Le produit fonctionne super bien. Toutefois, assurez vous que vos interrupteurs muraux soient ce qui est requis (2 fils noir, 1 fil blanc et un ground). Si vous habitez dans une vieille maison, il se peut que votre connexion soit à l'ancienne (1 fil noir, 1 fil blanc) et l'appareil ne fonctionnera pas. Ça été le cas chez moi sauf pour 1 interrupteur qui avait été posé plus récemment. Ça marche très bien juste pas où je voulais!

Do you know if you have a common wire in your switch box? Most DON'T and it will NOT work without it. Do you know what version of ANDROID you have on your phone, most don't and you can't change the version and KASA will NOT work on MANY. Do you know what TYPE of wifi you have, most don't and Kasa will NOT work on A LOT of wifi....FORGET this thing...it is a NIGHTMARE unless you are LUCKY enough to have ALL the stars line up for you, most are not!  Get a Lumiman smart bulb or a smart plug, they hook up FAIRLY easy. One good thing I forgot to mention...I went in my backyard and found out I could throw something down through the woods WAY further than I thought so there is that!

I been wanting to get a Smart Switch for very long time, but never got around because of Questionable Brand, Questionable Quality and Price. Then one day I finally pulled the trigger and got my first Smart Switch. The idea behind this came from annoyance of pre-existing Timer Switch that was getting annoying and no one really knew how to use since the Manual was long lost and it was as intuitive as a brick. So after finally getting annoyed and being bored out of my mind because of certain life quality changes that have occurred for most part of 2020 I decided to do something.My exterior wall lights were due for a refresh, as they were the original 20+ year old lights that where put in when the house was built. I wasn’t originally planning on replacing them, but after trying to service them which became a hassle because someone already stripped the screws, I decided to just get new exterior wall lights. So got in the car, waited 1 hour in line and bang I had brand new set of exterior modern looking LED wall lights that where $35 CAD for a pair over at Home Depot.
I don't have any major complaints about this product per se. The switch works fine. I just had higher expectations from a TP Link product.Here are my main criticisms though;

Both my husband and I are licensed electricians and we do not recommend this switch. It's cheaply made and does not fit properly in every electrical box. It's very large so if you happen to have an older house or there are more wires in the box (typical) you Will have a hard time with this. I would steer clear of it. There are better ones on the amazon market. Good luck.

Works great. The app came with easy to follow installation instructions. WiFi communication with the device is very responsive with virtually zero delay when you control it through the app. However controlling through Alexa do have a split second, but it works fine. I have a relatively low loading  on the light fixtures of less than 30W total, one being a 9W LED and it worked without any flickering or anything. I plan on installing 2 more of those 9W LED fixtures. One thing I prefer differently is the physical switch to be more mechanical click on/off instead of the digital style of on/off. The way this switch's button works is you click it and it goes on/off but the button itself stays in the same position forever. Like I've said, it works even with minimal loading without flickering AND this is cheaper than the many older style non-WiFi programmable switch that requires a minimum loading requirement in order to work (usually 40W).

Très facile à installer et configurer ,un petit bémol pour les boite simple vous avez besoin de beaucoup de dextéritépour mettre en place tout les fils et marettes dans le fond de la boite électrique vue l'épaisseur énorme de l'interrupteur

Every Kasa product we add, makes our lives a little bit better! We use it with Google Home, so haven’t tried the Alexa route.The Kasa app is great, and these are easy to setup. Installation can be a little tough as the box is much larger than your average box being inserted. However, once you have it installed, it works amazing. Ensure you have a wifi with 2.4Ghz signal. I use the TP-Link Deco M9, which covers us for everything needed. Setup is easy, and since I’ve linked Kasa with Google Home, all new devices automatically add to our google app, and google Nest recognizes it too. We have slowly added more and more Kasa products to our home, because they are so convenient and easy to use. I also use IFTTT with Kasa, to add some special commands for location settings when arriving home, creating scenes, conjunction with a camera, and with Google Nest.

I've purchased a number of these switches and plugs over the last 2 years. They used to work flawlessly with Alexa. I had a router failure so I reset all my devices to work on a new wifi. Since then i can not turn on remote control of them or have Alexa control them. I've done everything, reset Alexa, remove and reinstall all the devices on both the Alexa and Kasa apps, reset all the devices, renamed them, change the time zone and back again, disabled and enabled the app, uninstall the apps and reinstalled,  checked all the permission settings, even fixed the old router and tried again, no luck. Reached out to tech support at TP Link, no response. Nothing seems to work except local control. Even the remote control toggle is missing from most of the devices now in the Kasa app. Some devices won't update the firmware.  I keep getting a "failure:another cmd is running " when I try to toggle remote control. Time is synced, time zone is set correctly....do not recommend purchasing.

The TP-Link (HS-200 = single pole) light switch, like the plug (HS-105), works beautifully and simply with the Kasa control system on an iPhone (and likely any smartphone). I really like the control system because it is relatively easy to figure out how to set up timers, schedules and scenes.The HUGE disappointment for the HS200 was the size of the box on the backside of the switch. What were they thinking? Did they not realize that many older homes have electrical boxes of limited size. I am not talking about the depth of the box - there was lots of room for the wires behind the unit. But the up/down dimensions of the backside of the switch were so tight to the top and bottom of the electrical boxes in my older (1950's) house that I had to (1) mount the switch in the centre of a 3-gang box and (2) Jimmy, push, shove and pound the switch to get it in.

Problem:Huge problem after 3 months of use. Basically to turn on/off a switch you simply press the button. The problem I am having is every time I press the button it will just double "press" itself. So if it is off and i press the button, the switch will turn on and off again in quick fashion. It took me about 5 tries on average and used my slightest touch to get the switch to turn on/off proper. Basically the switch double click itself. It gets to a point I have to use mobile app to turn on and off switch.

These things are awesome.  Smart Home means you can control through voice, smartphone app, and of course the switch itself.  Configuration and programming options mean that this switch can be on any schedule you can think of and even a sunset/sunrise schedule.  Installation instructions are comprehensive and easy to follow.The downside is that the electrical box that the switch is being installed in must have a neutral wire running through it.  This supplies power to the smart switch independently of the wiring from the switch that turns the light on and off.  Many old homes have a mix of both, and in our case there are several boxes that we cannot install smart switches unless we were willing to pay someone to run the wiring which means lots of drywall cutting and repairing and painting!
I have converted all my light switches to this brand - dimmable ones too for certain lights. Just make sure you bulbs are dimmable.Easily integrated with Alexa, namely on my 4K Fire Stick.

This lightswitch is great!  Definitely will buy more as I need them.  Install was super easy and fast, although the device is a little bulky so depending how much room you have in the light switch box in the wall, you will need some excellent wire management skills or to push it in a little.  Other than that its awesome, looks really nice, hooked it up to the wife quickly after I got the app, then I added it to my Google Home and made it part of my Good Morning routine.  I can turn the lights off and on from the app, or from talking to my Google Home.  Works without any glitches.

Llevo un par de meses usándolo y ha resultado una maravilla. Lo uso en combinación con Google Assistant. Se ha llegado a desconectar un par de veces de la red, pero supongo es un asunto de variación de voltaje. A veces por sí solo se reconecta.La app Kasa de TP-Link es básica pero muy funcional. También funciona en conjunto con IFTTT.

Very easy to install. Make sure you have a smartphone or tablet with you during install to follow step-by-step installation that is provided along with animation. I also found a general purpose home improvement guide to be useful to confirm steps when it comes to wiring. Another very important tool to have handy is a live-line tester. I picked up one at a local home hardware store for $6. The device is installed reasonably far from my wifi router but never had any lost signal issues. I have had it working for about a month now and no issues.The Android App could use some more contextual help to explain things like 'away' mode and other modes. But you can figure out the functions through trial and success.
I have a few of these light switches which are awesome![+PROS+]

I bought one of these smart TP-Link light switches back in February when they were on sale, to compliment my two Amazon Echo devices. I have since bought another two. Each time, I waited until they were on sale ($29) before buying. Even though I like these switches, I would not pay the full prize to buy them. But at a little over half the normal price, they are totally worth it.Installing one of these switches is relatively easy, assuming that you know what to do and feel comfortable working with electrical wiring and making electrical connections. You do need the original switch that you are replacing to have a neutral (white) wire so bear that in mind if you are planning to replace a switch in an old house with old wiring that doesn’t have neutral. The switch is a little bigger than a regular switch but it in my case, all 3 switches fit in quite well after I installed them. I used the included snap-on decora faceplates with two of the switches and although it took some effort, they snapped on flash with the wall. In the kitchen, I replaced only one of the two light switches that sit side by side and it took some effort to screw back on the old dual switch decora faceplate. The smart switch stuck out a little more than the other switch and as a result the plate didn’t sit flash with the wall on one side, leaving a narrow gap between the plate and the wall. But I used some caulk and it doesn't look too bad ... I think. Actually, in my case the hardest part, was removing the faceplate from the smart switch. It comes attached to the switch out of the box and you have to snap it off it before you can install the switch. But with some effort I managed to get the faceplace off without breaking it or the switch.

The best 60$ I have ever spent!Installation was easy provided that you understand a little bit the eletric circuts. Although suggested to have plastic housing, mine was metal with case grounding it still works

Lo compré para controlar las luces de la cochera de mi casa ya que cuando llegó de trabajar está muy oscuro.  La intención era poder encender las luces desde fuera y si funciona perfectamente para esto, pero también se puede programar. Entonces lo programé para que se enciendan automáticamente al anochecer y se apaguen al amanecer, no he necesitado tocar el switch en 2 meses, está perfecto. Excelente servicio, 5 estrellas.

We have purchased multiple of these as they work great to ensure that our home is well lit when we come home. The ability to turn off and on through the app and Alexa allow us to turn the lights on even if we are arriving home outside of the schedule.The switches are easy to setup and the app installation guide would likely be very helpful for people unfamiliar with wiring in new switches. All required parts were included making the task simple.

Cela reviens cher si il faut équiper toute la maison mais c'est un très bon produit dont je suis très satisfait. Le plus difficile est l'installation physique si comme moi vous n'avez pas beaucoup de place de la boite électrique et beaucoup de cable bien rigide, mais une fois installé la connection avec le wifi et l'application ainsi que l'ajout dans mon google home app furent très simple. Très content. Noté que les switches simples font un petit bruit "clac" quand ils se mettent en marche/arrêt, alors que la version "dimmer" est complètement silencieuse. Les dimmers sont un peu plus cher mais je pense que ca vaut le coup, c'est vraiment très sympa !Enfin, deux différences majeurs selon moi avec d'autres marque moins cher : les produit TP-link sont certifiés UL (norme électrique) et compatible IFTTT.

I purchased 4 of these and installed them in various spots around my house. The app is very well designed and which offers a step by step process (with pictures) of removing the old switch and wiring the new one. It was very easy to setup and integrate with Amazon's alexa.The down side, these are a very very tight fit into the switch box. I installed one into a three switch box that required myself to use the existing light switch cover. Due to the design and profile of the smart switch, it left a slight gap between the face plate and drywall when using the existing face plates.

I’m not having the success I hoped with these.They were hard to install. They have lots of wires and are wired to a three way switch but the lights are all messed up since we installed them. Sometimes I have to walk from one switch to the other and manually click it, just to go back to the first one and turn it on from there. So they have actually reduced the convenience.  The switches themselves are hard to push on and off manually. I have other Kasa products installed and they work ok. The Kasa app always says they are turned on when they are not and Alexa can’t find the switches or plugs for voice automation. They show up in Alexa App but I can’t tell her to do anything with them.

You really do need to check your gang boxes very closely before buying these. My issue was not a neutral wire, but how tightly packed it was. These things are pretty massive. So if there's any obstruction, it's not gonna fit. You can almost forget trying to fit two of them in a single box because it's very tight with the wiring.I got one to fit after a lot of struggle. The switch works fine, there is a bit of a delay between press and light coming on. I'm not crazy about the rocker either, but it's better than other smart switches that just have a flat sensor. The rocker feels a bit cheap, makes a squeaky sound.

The switch works well once installed, so far it's been maintenance free after 3 months of usage.  Wiring wise installation is easy and straight forward, however the unit is really thick, with existing copper wires in the metal box(which are super stiff and tough to manipulate) initially it would appear as if there isn't enough space left to accommodate the thickness of this switch.  After installing 6 of them, my advice, just push it in, yes there is enough space, you just need to push harder.

I opted for this brand due to the price for 2 being a few dollars less than the 2 pack of another brand I'd previously bought.  Had to download another APP to program.  Have an iPad so went to Apple Store and found the right one.  Immediately got an error message that my iPad iOS system was too old.  Requires iOs 11.0 or later.  My iPad won't update software beyond 10.3 .  Fortunately,  I own a Samsung tablet so was able to set up the switches.Recommend to anyone looking to  order smart switches,  etc. and only have an Apple product,  to check that the necessary APP is compatible.

I connected a few different models of WiFi light switches at home, and this unit by far was the fastest and easiest unit to install. The Kasa App found the switch on the first attempt and connected it to the 2.4 GHz WiFi signal without any trouble.It is installed to operate the outdoor lights, so I don't need to remember to turn on the lights at night and turn them off in the morning. The app allows operating the switch from Dusk to Down so as the seasons' change and the sunrise and sunset times change accordingly; there is no need to modify the operating schedule. To find the Sunset and Sunrise options, scroll to the right and left of the 'Hour' schedule, it took some time to find this feature.

I have had these for over 18 months now and I more often than not have connexion problems with TPLINK devices. They show local only and are non responsive to alexa or Smartthings commands or even from their Kasa app. The customer service is just OK, so I have been told to update the devices, to factory reset, update and reconfigure to place them closer to the router ( none is further than 5 meters or 20 ft). So, my verdict, they are decent for the price, but unstable most of the time.  Nonetheless, except zigbee and zwave, they can be used with IFTTT, Smartthings, Alexa or Google Home. It is a good choice if you are on a budget and not worse than other products 3 times more expensive and equally unreliable. I do recommend this as long as you don't need them to be reliable.

Excelente producto! Definitivamente necesitas un cable neutro. Es decir traerte una conexión desde el foco y contar con el neutro para conectarlo en el cable blanco del to link ,la fase y el regreso deberás conectarlo en los dos negros y El cable verde puedes hacerle un orificio al fondo de la caja metálica y ponerle un tornillo para que conectes la tierra al tornillo que toca la caja.

So you guys make a great product. i bought one and i love it. It works with my Kasa App (obvy) and it works with google home... seamlessly.  So hey, naturally i can get behind this a purchase more. Why wouldnt anyone want to support this. So i go to purchase 7 more switches for my house...... But oh hey, you are not allow to buy more than 3..... Why cant i buy more than 3. I can totally understand why you cant order 50 of them, stock reasons for sure. But i am buying UNDER 10! why is this not allowed. I want to give you my money, but you wont take it. Why is this!!!!! SOOOO FRUSTRATING. it makes me want to boycott all of your networking equipment and your switches. LIKE UG!!!  i would love if someone would get back to me, but if it is anything like the dc dip and twirl that Amazon customer services and TPLINK customer services gave me, i will be sure that i will NOT be able to purchase more of these things! So  so so so not happy right now.

Bought this to replace a WiOn switch that was recalled.  We did hire an electrician to remove the old switch and install this one.  It fits perfectly into the wide hole of our double switch plate.  The switch is easy to use and the reset button is hidden enough yet easily accessed without removing the face plate.  The switch itself feels solid.We are using it with the Kasa App on several apple iOS devices.  The app and the switch quickly connected and the switch was super simple to configure.  It was connected to our network in less than 3 minutes.  The Kasa app is very straight forward and works really well.  I was able to program the switch to come on at sunset in our location and it worked right at sunset.  (bonus, never having to adjust the time the outside lights come on!). We can program them to go off at different times on different days too.  (later on Friday and Saturday night for example). Very pleased.  Also, the app can connect from multiple devices.  Both my wife and I are connected to the switch.  Overall, much simpler to install, program and operate than the prior model.

Can you use a screwdriver? Then this light switch is for you!Took me an hour to install, but it’ll probably be faster if this isn’t your first light switch installation. One note is that if you have a bunch of excess wire in the socket like me you'll need to either trim it or shove it back as this switch’s module sits deeper than a traditional “dumb” light switch.

Five stars almost all across the board for the simple fact that if you are not comfortable enough with electricity, you may have to hire someone to do the work for you. I am a technical minded person so I was able to set up with ease. The switch I replaced was a cheaper style and had an assigned up address outside my domain therefore easier to hack and that’s what happened. I had a Botnet intrusion. The TPLin establishes an I. P. Address within your domain providing better security.I like this product

Nice switch.  Hot in and power out wires are interchangeable, which saves a little time confirming which black wire is which.  I like the Kasa app, seems to be one of the better thought out light and outlet controllers designed for Android.I didn't use the faceplate that came with the switch because the switch is mounted in a gang box with two other light switches.  The switch fits with the Leviton Decora faceplate.  The only slight snag, and it is slight, is the holes in the plastic for the faceplate screws are not tapped.  I ran a #8-32 tap through, but I think that may have been a bit overkill.  I think you could just use the screws themselves to create the thread as it is just plastic.

Works well. For some reason only likes one of my routers, did not work with my main TP-link router which all my other wifi outlets and lights worked with even though both are only 2.4ghz. nice design, works perfectly with alexa. If your electrical box has more than one wire set inside the fit can be really tight or won't fit. but in most situations you will be fine. (mine had 3 sets of wires in the electrical box but I still manages to fit in just in)

Works great! It does exactly what I want and looks great doing it. I love the "away" feature and the glowing switch when off. The switch itself is a momentary switch which takes a little getting used to but I think I like it. The decora cover looks much better than the typical vanilla cover. Timer function works reliably. At the price I purchased ($35 CAD) I consider it a deal.Cons: Not much to gripe about. The Kasa app is pretty intuitive. However, I do find that the app's widget is not very reliable. You can set scenes and activate them via the widget. But after waking my phone from lock mode the widget often doesn't work or the scenes are missing. This means I have to open the app to control the lights. It's possibly an issue with my phone but my other home automation widgets aren't affected so I doubt it. If you're using voice control (Alexa, google home, etc) then it's probably not a big issue.

Funciona perfectamente pero para instalarlo se necesita alguien que sepa de electricidad ya que el equipo requiere de un cable neutro y los apagadores normales no cuentan con este cable y hay que instalar este cable desde el foco hasta el apagador pero ya que esta instalado funciona perfectamente yo lo recomiendo ampliamente

Bon produit mais dans les chambres sa fonctionne pas et ni dans le passage....Vue que mes switch ont juste 2 câble ( 1 blanc, 1 noir ) donc avant d'acheter sa... assurez vous davoir 4 fils ( 2 blanc 2 noire ) sinon sa fonctionne pas...

I purchased this switch to add more functionality to the families Alexa system and it was exactly as advertised with the switch being easy to install (as long as you know how to connect electrical wires safely) and easy to integrate with Alexa through the smart switch app and so forth. However, we were unable to install it permanently as the switch was purchased as a gift for a family member and we were unaware that the switch we wanted to replace had no neutral wire, so you definitely should double check and ensure that the wiring is right (even if it may be difficult to check without the recipient of the gift seeing what you are doing) so that the switch works correctly. Also due to the error mentioned earlier we were unable to test the  timer function. We plan to use the switch elsewhere in a place that has a neutral wire so not all is lost. Thank you so much for the awesome smart switch.

the light was no more difficult to install than a regular light switch. open the app after installation, and with a few taps it's all set up and ready to go.I did have to look up some information online (which wires connect where) and I feel that information should of been included in the packaging with the easy setup guide.

I bought this switch both to start automating the house and to replace a dimmer that controlled an outlet in a room that has no overhead light.  Why someone thought a dimmer was a good idea for that I have no clue.  I have had a few stand lamps plugged into that outlet and if the dimmer wasn't fully on, the light would flicker and there would be this horrid whining noise.  I don't have a lot of electrical experience, but I was able to do the wiring pretty easily after watching a few youtube videos and following the steps in the app, which I suggest downloading to your device first before you install it for just this reason.  However the box for the switch itself is quite large, so it took a fair amount of carefully arranging the wires and some force to get it in there.  Once installed however it works flawlessly, from the app, from the google assistant on my phone and from the Google Home Mini.  We had a major power outage recently and had no issues with its connectivity afterward. The switch even has a small circle on the bottom half that has a soft glow to it, making it easier to find in the dark, but not so bright that it's intrusive. And I no longer have to fuss with the stupid dimmer.  I intend to buy more of these, but like many things on Amazon, the price fluctuates quite a bit, so I will wait until it drops again.

I installed this smart switch in a 3 gang box, standard depth. This wall box was also being used as a junction box for a few other wires so it was crowded in there. The first thing I did was move the other switches out of the way and verify that this switch still fit in a completely empty spot in that box, which it barely did. However it consumes all of the vertical space and at the deepest part of the back (back face is angled) it touches the back of the box if the wires the coming out of it aren't positioned correctly. So after confirming that it will fit I set about rearranging the rest of the wires in that box and connecting the switch. With everything in there I managed to get the top of the switch flush with the wall and the bottom protruded about 3/32". However, even with that pretty good fitment (considering the size of this switch in a tight space) the face plate was protruding from the wall at both the top and moreso the bottom due to the thickness of the switch's mounting flange; in order to have any strength the plastic flange is considerably thicker than the metal flange on a normal switch or receptacle. Now I see why they include that super thick face plate in the kit.Once installed though the switch works well. It set up fine and pulled new FW which gives me confidence that TP-Link still be supporting the this device, moreso than products from some lesser known brands.

Es un dispositivo que te agrega lafuncionalidad de hacer “inteligente” un foco normal, eso sí, debe ser un apagador sencillo, el tamaño abarca toda la caja. Se requiere un poco de conocimiento eléctrico pero la calidad en muy buena, escogí está marca porque toda mi plataforma está construida con Hue de Philips y TpLink, contactos, focos, sensores y apagadores.

Beware of wifi connection unreliability. Switch drops wifi connection regularly making scheduling, timer, etc.options use impossible. Wifi drops with phone use making switch activation away from home unpredictable. Contacted product support but, after some explanation of the problem, agent is either unfamiliar with wifi issue or is in denial of the problem.  Firmware is up to date.

Este dispositivo parece que funcionaría muy bien, sin embargo no pude probarlo, es muy importante revisar la instalación eléctrica del establecimiento donde se instalará ya que requiere que la instalación provea cables de tierra, neutro y carga, si no los tiene, el dispositivo no podrá funcionar correctamente.

I have two of these now plus a Tp-Link mini plug. These work best in a single gang box. The first one I bought was for a double gang and that was a tighter fit than I expected. The other issue was getting a regular switch cover to fit the switch in the double gang. I had to trim off some drywall to get it to sit further into the wall so the cover sat flush with the wall. While getting the install cosmetics right were a bit of a hassle I think the tech works flawlessly. The app works great and I have this integrated with Google Assistant and Home Assistant. Using Home Assistant I can turn these switches on and off with the buttons on a Harmony Remote or through automation rules. If you find these on sale they are the best/cheapest you'll find for the time being.
Good:  Easy install, easy connection, easy APP.Bad: design not compatible with typical switch face panel, only fit faceplate inbox..

For the price, you cannot complain about how they work. The only problem I have ran into on this last install was that my electrician used a 4 gang + 1 gang boxes to create a 5 gang box total. Using non-smart enabled switches you are given the spacing and movement (left/right) to make the face plate fit, but since there is a larger box behind these switches you need to make sure that everything is in one box. I did make it work but only after a bit of "what am I going to do" thinking.All of my outdoor lights are on 4 of these switches (front soffit lights, front house lights, front seasonal electrical box, and my back deck lights).

I gave this 4 stars because the wiring instructions are not all that clear.  When it says a neutral wire is required, that is because most normal wall switches simply add a break in the hot line so if the switch is off, essentially the switch gets no power so is getting no wifi signal to control it.  What the neutral wire does is provide a return path for constant power to the switch so that the "smart" side of it is always on.  The first time I went to install this, the wiring to the switch had no white neutral wire, so I figured it would not work.  After viewing a YouTube video of the installation, I went back into the wall junction box to find a bundle of white neutral wires all junctioned together at the back of the box, so simply took off the cap and tied the switch's white wire into that bundle, and put the two black wires connected to the prior switch's hot wires.  Everything was up and running in minutes after that.

Switch works as advertised and I like it however Amazon sent me a switch that was returned by someone. Long screw at bottom of switch missing, (this screw attaches switch to electrical box) the tags were missing to attach to existing wiring, English instructions were missing, only French in the box. When I went to activate the switch it was difficult because it had prior information from a previous owner embedded in it. I overcame all of that, got it installed and it works well. This is my BEEF, I purchased a NEW switch and did not want a USED switch sent to me. That has me pissed off.

The hard part for my old house was finding out some of my electrical switches don't have a neutral wire.Installation into a box with a neutral was straight forward.  Lots of room even with all of the wire nuts.

Like the plugs, this switch is great. It installs easily on the Kasa app and attached to Alexa seamlessly. Physically, it is a very attractive switch and while it took me a longer time to install it into the electrical box, I don't install switches for a living. Anyway, once you have it correctly installed in your switch box, the rest is a breeze. Just follow the instructions on Kasa and you will be done in no more than 5 mins and that includes software updates.

Be sure to check you have a neutral wire before buying. I was going to set up this switch in all my rooms but I found one room without a neutral wire which is required for this product. The switch is also quite big at the back and I had some difficulties getting everything to fit right. Other than that I haven't had any problems with the device for the months I have had it.

The look and installation is Ok. The pricing when on sale is also attractive.I have installed at least seven of these at my home and the biggest issue that I have is that when there is a power loss, sometimes they forget the network which is not good at all. You will have to physically reset them by pressing the rest button on the device.

I have 3 of these in various locations, including one way deep in the basement where I thought it would struggle to get reception, but it still does! The Kasa app is great too. The crucial feature for me was the ability to set the timer to my local sunset, which changes every day obviously. Not all control apps can do that - not even Google Home.

I have a number of different smart products in my home now, and this is one of the easier ones to install and connect to WIFI. you need a neutral wire to install this product. the app is one i was already using with a different TP link product, it walks you through inistallation easily and the back is not too large to fit into a standard elecrtical box even with a bunch of wires shoved into the back. It easliy connected to google assistant.

First off, I absolutely love this. The install was very easy, the setup even easier and works like a charm. My only concern is the size of the unit in relation to how it fits back into a standard outlet. The back of this unit is large and bulky, by the time you add all your twist on caps to the wire ends, it was an absolute chore trying to get it all to fit. In the end, my outlet sits 2-3mm off the wall and not flush as there simply isn't enough room. If you were renovating a home and starting clean with outlets, you could always use a much larger wall socket to allow for the cables, however in a pre-built home where I don't have the luxury or ripping out the electrical box, it is an issue that needs to be addressed.

I love kasa products as they are so easy to install and connect with the app. This switch was very easy to install and my only gripe is that it is a bit bulky in the rear.  My receptacle was not too deep so I could not get it to be flush with the wall as the wiring and back of switch take a lot of room. Luckily it is next to my door frame so not too noticeable. Make sure you have neutral wire. Works flawlessly with my google home.

I don't use very many of these "smart home" devices, this is the first one I own. But I found this one fairly decent in its functionality.Installation: The installation is guided by the Kasa App associated with TP Link's smart devices. The process of installing it is mainly just matching the wire colors and twisting the 4 wires together correctly. Very trivial tasks if you don't have much electrical knowledge, but the experience may vary if 1. your house wiring was done by a cut rate electrician who didn't use the right color wires or 2. There's a missing/hard to reach earth and/or neutral wires. I personally had some issues getting the switch to fit in. My switch box had very thick solid copper wires which took up a lot of space. Thus it took a lot of effort to fit the Wi-Fi switch itself as it has more depth than the normal light switch I replaced.

I have tried other brands with the same functions as smart switches as well as manual switches with sensors.  They all performed great with quick responses.The tp link switch stands out as the best because it is quieter than most when switches on\off and no delayed response times. The most important factor is the price point.  It’s perfect price point.  Don’t bother looking for anything else.  Go with tp smart switches for your whole house.  Company has sales as well for more costly versions that have dimmer and 3 way functions.  By patient and wait for sales to get $10 off or more off regular prices for  these products.  No brainer. Smart tp link switch  or a manual timer switch?  for the cost it is a no brainer

This is replacing my Woods Wion that was recalled and  I will say that it is far more stable and the functionality is about the same.  I installed this in a three gang box and it was a nightmare.  Instead of connecting the wires directly to the switch like other models, this unit has additional 3-4" of wire length you need to accommodate in a very small space.  It also doesn't mount flush with the wall, it's thicker than standard switches so I had to chip out my drywall in order to get the triple face place back on and have everything line up.  Overall it's good but do not buy if you aren't comfortable with wiring jobs or want to install it in a multiple gang box as it's tricky.

I have had 9 of these installed and working flawlessly for 1 year now. It is critical for all IOT smart devices to have a good WIFI infrastructure - nothing can replace this and you should consider this factor before purchasing ANY wifi device. These are reliable and work great with the APP, on a timer, and work even better with Home Assistant - A free opensource platform to combine all of your smart devices in 1 location.

L'installation est aussi simple qu'un interrupteur ordinaire. Après avoir téléchargé l'application KASA, on suit simplement les instructions données sur l'app pour ajouter le nouvel interrupteur à l'app. J'en ai installé 4, je n'ai rencontré aucun problème . Maintenant que le test est fait, j'en ai commandé 6 autres.Le seul petit hic avec l'application, c'est que j'aurais aimé avoir une fonction ouverture et fermeture de lumière aléatoire lorsqu'on part à l'extérieur pour quelques jours.

Easy to install, just remember if you are not qualified, hire someone, or turn off the power before removing the old switch and installing the new device. Alexa was not used in our application. My son has this connected to his smart phone, he was tired of getting out of bed to turn off the bedroom light before actually going to bed..lazy bugger..lol
Pros:- Nice design.

J'ai essayé dans plusieurs boîtes électriques. Rien à faire, c'est trop volumineux!La switch entre parfaitement dans la boîte électrique, mais il ne faudrait pas qu'il y est de fils électriques! En plus, la switch vient avec une bonne longueur de fils attaché après, ce qui n'est pas pour nous faciliter la tâche. Si au moins, elle aurait été conçue comme nos switch que l'on a à la maison, où un peu y attacher nos fils direct.

I am in the process of making my home smarter and first thing I wanted was to automate the lights. I  did not want to spend $50 on every LED, so I decided on smart switches. I do not have any experience with electrical wiring and to add to it our house did not have color coded wires. Once I figured out, it was a breeze setting it up. I linked the TP link Kasa account to google home and till now I did not have any issue with commands.One suggestion I would like to give the first time installers is to open the switch( before doing this turn off the power at circuit breaker) where you want to install to confirm the following details:

I have the 1 way, non dimming version. I can confirm it works just fine with LED lights. It is a simple relay.I measured the same amperage and voltage at the original switch and at the smart switch after the change when the led lights were being driven.

I use the Google Assistant integration on this and use this switch daily for my kitchen lights.After looking at the instructions I felt I could have installed it on my own but did not feel confident and had an electrician friend tackle it for me. He said it was easy but he also knew what he was doing. A neutral wire is required to use this switch, so make sure you have one of those before buying!

Works with google, works with existing face-plates... single or double, easy to install two black wires go to switch,green to bare ground wire and white to white wire cluster in back of box. Giant face-plate that comes with it is removed by pulling really hard with bare hands in any of the 4 corners...does not break and yes that is the first thing you will look up online as no useful instructions ! Good solid brand with great plugs also.
Beware of this item. while the company stating work's with alexa it is not true.You have to install it before you can find out, so you wasted your time and money

Very happy with the product. Works as advertised. I love the light at night. Setup and installation is easy.I managed to configure these switches to work through Apple HomeKit (through IFTTT and Home Assistant). Works well with Alexa and Google home Assistant as well. I also managed to fit 3 of them in a row - tricky but possible, just need to strategically organize the cables.
Pros:- Fast: it switches much faster than my hue bulbs

This switch requires power (line and neutral) in order for it to work.  I forgot to check whether power comes into the switch, unfortunately, it doesn't.  I guess technically you could get neutral into the box, but it's too much work for me.  I ended up using it elsewhere.  The wifi setup was finicky.  It didn't work at first.  Apparently, it had to be connected to the app first to the Smart_Switch_Wifi link.  It was not the same setup procedure as the other brands.  But eventually, it connected and everything is working fine now.
I purchased this product to run my front yard/porch lights on a schedule and to add remote control functionality.Pros: 1) once it’s installed and set up, it does exactly what it’s supposed to do.

Great product, keep in mind you will need a neutral in your electrical box (Many switches have only a switch leg so this may not work for you) If you do have a neutral then the set up is pretty straight forward after installation. The electrical box you install this within will need plenty of space so the wire nuts provided may not allow it to fit (use tiny ones). Overall though way better than the garbage bluetooth versions as they have no connectivity on other floors, wifi is the way to go. Wonderful product

Easy to install, and works well with the Kasa app and Google Home.  Wiring is a combination of leads (ground and Neutral), and side terminals (load and ground ), which can help clean up a crowded electrical box.  Can be calibrated for brightness range with led lighting, but defaults worked perfect.  I would install more, if there was a three way version.Update: Removed a star, as it does not work with the popular SmartThings hub, without the installation of a custom device handler, which is complicated to do.

Good quality switch, works as expected. Able to turn off with Alexa or by hand. No issues with connectivity or software install. It wasn’t physically difficult to install either. Just follow the instructions. If anything, removing an old crusty switch and figuring out the crap wires your builder put in will be harder than the actual install.  I’m a total noob and I managed.

I have a number of Kasa devices,both dimmable and regular switches as well as several programmable plugs.  All work great and it is very easy to set up schedules using the app.  You can also control the devices remotely using the app.  The switch is easy to install if you have some basic knowledge of changing/installing electrical switches.  I would highly recommend to anyone who has a need for lights to be on a timer.  This most recent purchase was to put my exterior lights on a timer.

Good light, a little weird clicking mechanism, but definitely easy and intuitive. Setting up is a little bit of an electrical challenge, so make sure to get an electrician or watch a few videos on how to change the switch before attempting if you are unfamiliar on doing so. Setting up a schedule is a great feature and works great with Alexa on the Echo Dot. A faint light remains after installing however, so be aware of this if it does not fit your home's aesthetic. At $50 it is quite an expense, but it is probably one best in the market..

I'm not an electrician and was able to wire this up to control an indoor switch that is connected to our outdoor holiday light plug. I plan to use it as a timer, and have been testing the app to see how it works... so far so good.  I fumbled a little getting it wired up and it wasn't clear that the included instructions were actually IN the app.  Most electrical outlets/switches come with a better wiring diagram.  My only complaint so far.

I bought these based on the review I read. It was easy to install. But I am very disappointed that the product consistently disconnect from the network for no reason. I have to reset very frequently. This is a faulty product. The one sold by Costco were much better. I installed same time with the TP Link product and I did not have to reset at any given time. This product is garbage.

I wanted a switch that I could control from anywhere without the need for intermediate hardware/software like Alexa, although it is compatible with Alexa and Google. Installation and setup was incredibly easy, just like the TP-Link plug I bought several months prior. It offers various scheduling/timer functions, which are also easy to use.

Tried a number of switches for a smart home upgrade I was going. This was one of the nicer ones, but ultimately had to return as it didn't quite do what I needed it for (kind of an odd application). Also, it has a click sound like a mouse button, didn't really like that.

Once I completed the wiring and installation of this switch, I noticed that the internal switch must have been in the closed position and would not change state.  I confirmed with a multi meter that the switch is faulty.  I know that I cannot return this product (or can I?).  If I cannot, how can I activate the warranty and get it replaced?  Please advise.

Great product, paired perfectly with my google home mini. Simple enough to install. My only complaint is that the unit is so large (depth wise) that with all the wires in the switch box it didn't actually go in all the way. The end result is not very noticeable with the cover plate on but it sits slightly above the surface.

I bought this switch to control it through an Amazon Echo. Installation was not difficult. Joining to the wifi through the Kasa app was easy.  I can control it through the Kasa app, but Alexa is spotty. Alexa will control it only if the green wifi light it on, which defeats the purpose of getting it in the first place. It's like it goes to sleep or is in a standby state and can't be woken up through Alexa but can through Kasa. So in summary it seems that it works like it is supposed to if your use the native Kasa app but lacks something in Alexa integration.

This was an incredibly easy hookup.  Anyone with basic electrical knowledge can hook this up easily.  Works wonderfully for outside lights controlled with an inside  switch.  Now when I go to bed I just say "Alexa, turn off all lgihts" and even the outside lights go off with everything else.  I also have these in my garage so as soon as I step in the garage I just stay 'Turn on garage lights" and everything comes on automatically.  Super happy with these.  Still have manual control with these if I'm close enough to turn them off manually.

First of all, the KASA app works very well. I have tried with and without WIFI, both worked great. it is also compatible with Google Home.  The product looks good except that  the switch doesn't actually switch (i.e. flip) when it is manually turned ON/OFF. This is different from the traditional light switches.Secondly, the price is good I think. With the price and quality, I think it is a good buy.

This item requires no hub, however you can not use robots or automation from Wink or Smarthings either. For example you ring doorbell or security cam picks up motion. You cannot have the lights go on unless you figure out iftt. Well I just want a smart home. In not learning programming. I would  buy a switch that can integrate well with all of your smart home toys.

Finalmente no me tengo que levantar a pagar la luz.... esta de pelooooooos!Eso si, tuve que pedirle a un electricista que viniera a conectarlo porque yo no pude hacerlo, ya que el anterior controlaba dos focos y estaban conectados de manera directa (diferente)

solo funciona con UN foco, aunque de tu switch prendan 2 o 30 focos, lo deduje yo sola, después de cansarme hablando a soporte técnico en el teléfono 5591388104. Marquen con paciencia porque Se tardaron 18 minutos en atender, y cuando me tomaron la llamada, la señorita muy grosera me comenzó haciendo preguntas irrelevantes para mi ayuda culpándome que lo había instalado mal, y confesó que JAMAS ha instalado uno, no se en qué puede ayudar alguien que jamás ha instalado uno.quiero regresar el producto por el pésimo servicio al cliente que manejan.

Got this on Amazon - delivered in only a couple of days.  Simple to install if you have even a little electrical wiring experience.  Really simple to connect to the Kasa app on my iPhone 6S Plus.  Set-up quickly and paired seamlessly with Alexa.  While the Kasa app works well, and you can set up "Scenes" (routines in Alexa speak), and/or timer functions, I chose to run it mostly through Alexa.  I've installed this switch to control my soffit plug is so that I can remotely and easily control my outdoor Christmas lights.  TP-Link always!
I did not check the Alexa integration.However, the integration with Google is working perfectly.

Muy buen estilo, fácil de usar, fácil de configurar, tal vez si no cuentas con conocimientos de electricidad se te dificulte un poco la instalación, una vez instalado es fácil de usar como cualquier apagador normal, bonito diseño, se puede programar y prender y apagar desde la app, yo lo encontré en descuento y salio a muy buen precio

Tried every light switch. But it does not work properly for led lighting? Dimmable or not. Didn’t matter. Had a Kasa plug for my living room lamp and that works awesome with my iphone or Alexa. Figured I give these switches a try. Tried both switches. Same result. Very dim when the lights are on like they are barely On. Returned them.

These switches are very practical. Hands full - yell at Alexa.  Coming in the door to the garage where there’s no switch tell Alexa. Is located where it always gets left on - set an automatic time off say 10 minutes. One down side is that you can only set timers on 3 of these.

I currently use Lutron Caseta and installed the TP Link to deal with single pole switch. First, the price is worth every bit of the capability that the switch performs. I really enjoy how when the light isn't on, there is a small circle at the bottom that glows. I have connected the switch to my Google home and it works flawlessly.

I do like - Wiring is standard and hadware is nicely designed. Software is very intuitive and easy to set up. I dont like - On light is very dim. Wifi drops every other day. I have 3 switches and i have to keep resetting. I have google mesh and the switches are 20 feet from main router. Dissapointed at performance.

I've installed this switch twice now and there hasn't been any issues. I think the one thing everyone is needs to be aware of is the depth of the electrical box necessary to install it flush to the wall. Either get a 2.5 inch deep wall box (lots of work) or one or two 1/16th wall switch plate extenders (a lot less work).

Listen to me. These are awesome. Outdoor lights. Step lights. Garage lights. Indoors light all come on at a specific time. No coming home in the dark. Easy install and easy operation. Connect to Alexis and you can tell them to turn off. Loving these switches. You wouldn’t be disappointed.

I've installed light fixtures and replaced receptacles before, so I'm not shy with electrical work, but this product is a whole different level of tricky.It requires 4 electrical lines in your socket. Unfortunately, all of the light switches I took apart only had 2 or 3 lines, and this is in a fairly modern building (built in 2006). Had to return it.

Super duper easy install. Basically colour matching things. Turned off my main cause my panels poorly labeled. Crying baby and all and did it within 15 minutes (even with interruptions from said baby) connected power again, boom ! Light worked! The the wifi connection and connecting it to Alexa. Not super savvy with electrical but I googled how to do it before it came. All said and done I will be buying more and can’t wait to have all my switches switched over

Interrupteur au coût abordable qui fonctionne très bien. Actionné à partir de l'application KASA pour téléphone intelligent ou manuellement comme un interrupteur standard. S'installe facilement, des instructions claires sont fournies pour l'installation et la configuration. S'intègre bien avec d'autres interrupteurs classiques. Le kit contient tout le nécessaire.

Très facile à installer et fonctionne parfaitement. J’ai essayé quelques fois de m’en servir avec mon Écho Dot, mais sans succès. / Easy setup and works great. I tried only a couple of times to make it work with my Echo Dot, but not successfully. I don’t need it to work with Alexa, because I use it for my porch lights, and I programmed it at a certain time. Which was really easy to do in the app.

Terrific smart switches. With a little monkeying around you can make them work with IFTTT, and out of the box they work with Google Assistant. It's nice to be able to see if the bathroom fan is on when I get to work, or shut off the porch light from bed.Note: If you have 2x4 construction walls then you may have issues fitting them in electrical boxes. You'll have to make a spacer for the wallplate. I have an older mobile home I had to do this on. Jigsaw, some spruce board, and paint can do the trick easily though. They're pretty deep and since they have wire leads instead of screw-clamp terminals it gets tough to stuff it all in.

Conecté este interruptor a un "contractor" eléctrico de 30 amperes. El interruptor es de 15 amperes y tengo un calentador de agua eléctrico de 18 amperes que necesitaba controlar por medio de Alexa. Como no podía utilizar el interruptor directamente en el calentador de agua debido a la diferencia de amperaje, a mi electricista se le ocurrió utilizar un contractor, que es el interruptor que apaga y enciende el calentador de agua. Y este interruptor Wi-Fi está conectado al contractor para encenderlo y apagarlo. El electricista tuvo que insertar un nuevo cableado para el neutral desde el centro de carga de mi casa, así como cableado para la tierra. El electricista me cobró $1,500 pesos por todo (unos $80 dlls +/-).Una vez instalado, fue bastante sencillo conectarlo a Internet con la aplicación Kasa Smart de TP-Link y posteriormente a mi sistema Amazon Echo para controlarlo con Alexa o por medio del teléfono.

The product arrives in a nice box with easy instructions. The instructions need to be followed carefully. Programming took some 4 tries until the switch picked up wi-fi. Once that was done, Amazon's instructions were better at integrating with Alexa. After figuring it all out, it works really well.

Si vous avez des enfants, ou pour un oubli, avoir ces interrupteurs est une plus.  A l'aide de son téléphone (doté d'un réseau WI-Fi) on peut sans se déplacer "FERMER" les lumières!  Un petit luxe peut-être mais combien utile.  Il sert, c'est certain.  Fonctionne très bien.  Mais pour allumer manuellement, il faut juste presser une fois, il n'y a pas de "clic" habituel.  On s'y fait.  On recommande...oui.  Autres temps autres moeurs!
¡Funciona de maravilla! Una muy buena alternativa si no deseas estar cambiando focos, o si quieres también poder prender un ventilador de techo.Funciona perfecto con Alexa sin necesidad de un Hub.

Easy to install if you have “electrical “ knowledge. Keep the paper troubleshooting manual for reference. Our rowder glitched one day & the switch  was blinking green. Manual told us what that meant. And we just had to reboot rowder. And all was well.Love these switches. Pair easily with our Google Home assistant unit. We just ordered more of them from amazon ! This is a very good brand of wifi switches.

I bought a pair. They are a tight fit for a standard electrical box, in a ganged box you have extra room.The app seems laggy... Sometimes it takes 30 seconds for the lights to show up in the Kasa app. My Ubiquiti shows that one of them seems to lose wifi from time to time, even when they are within 20 feet of Access point.

Everything is great: clear installation instructions, easy setup process, stable connection, built-in Alexa and Google Home support. Homebridge plugin is also available and easy to set up if you want to add them to Homekit.The only downside is the size of the switch which is larger than the traditional one, making it hard to install if you are installing multiple of them side-by-side in a 2-gang or 3-gang box. For a 3-gang box, I spent 15 mins to do the wiring yet another 45 mins to manipulate with the wires so that I had enough room to fit these switches in. I even had to cut some wires short in order to save space.

Update Dec.17/2018 - still works perfectly, still works with the Kasa app, still able to control by voice through Google Home, or Google Assistant on my phone! Love this!Pairing this with the Kasa app and Google Home makes it so easy. I use it as an alarm every day to wake me up(Kasa app feature)! Much more difficult to ignore a bright light than it is to ignore an alarm sound!

Nothing negative to say about this. Easy installation and easy setup. Unlike other similar products that I've used, this doesn't seem to be able to share with other users. This means that you gotta create an account and pair it. If you want 2 phones to access this, both phones' gotta use the same user. Other products allows to share with other user.

Easy to use with the TP-Link Kasa App, and integrates well with Alexa. Installation was fairly easy, although people not comfortable doing electrical should have an electrician install.Wish the device used screw terminals for terminating the wire instead of pigtails that have to be maretted. This adds excess wire that can make it somewhat challenging to fit everything into place.

Great product.  Installation was simple and easy to use.  Setup was simple as well.  The Kasa app is simple to use and works well with Alexa.  Options includes setting up schedules, Away (vacation), and timer modes.  Didn't require a SmartHome hub to have these features either.  Planning to purchase their dimmer and 3-way switches as well.  Would definitely purchase again.

Good product. Overall, design is good, quality is good, and does its job for a very fair price.The only problems I’ve experienced, are with the initial connection to the wifi. You’ll have to at times reset/ restart the light a few times until it picks up the wifi.

La robustes del equipo da mucha seguridad y confianza para conectarle cualquier equipo de un máximo de 15A; muy fácil de configurar y desde que lo instale, no ha sido necesario reconfigurarlo por alguna falla de comunicación, aún fallando la energía eléctrica no pierde su configuración. Tengo conectados dos equipos y no me ha dado ninguna falla de conectividad.

Easy to install! Will fit in dual plate assembly. Downloaded the Kasa app for my iPhone. Created a guest 2.4ghz connection on my wifi router, followed the instructions on Kasa, thats it! Very good interface on Kasa. A lot of settings for turning on/off the device. Even turned off the router and back on while monitoring the switch and within 5 minutes the connection was re-established and back  in working order. Bought 3 at once and worth the price and looks good

Bought 3 different brands before th kasa. Kasa is the only one that Bennett consistently working on my network. Had friends telling me the problem was my network, that I needed a mesh but decided to try last the kasa and it's been working perfectly! I already owned 2 smart outlets from.kasa and like it. Ended up buying 2 more switches as a gift to my family!

Works perfectly. Wish I could program my lights to come on relative to sunset but haven’t figured out how to do that. Overall awesome product for the price. Installation was easy but was a bit confusing at first since my old switch was jumped to another switch. Software instal was easy as was integration with Alexa. I’m very happy with the purchase.

This is the third of these I have installed and all have been completely trouble-free. It is now my default choice for a simple smart switch.  Installation took less than 10 minutes - the tutorial is thorough but seriously it is so easy that the guide is almost redundant.  Set-up and linking to Google Home was virtually instantaneous.  Creating a timer for the light was much much easier than for other switches I have installed.

Trabaja de manera adecuada con Alexa y su app (Kasa), una vez configurado es una maravilla, se puede programaar encendido/apagado y el control de voz con alexa es muy útil.Para la instalación debes contar con conocimientos básicos/intermedios de electricidad ya que hay que realizar un ajuste en tu instalación.

This can be modified with dual control lights, but I can only install one according to the instruction manual, which is very embarrassing. Although I can control the lights with my mobile phone, the other switch is not used.

I tried to install this in my home but it just wouldn't fit and work. It comes with an extra wire that my previous switch doesn't have and i just couldn't get it to work. The unit itself is also quite thick behind it.

This is a great affordable option. It was very easy to install with clearly marked wires. The instruction booklet that comes with it is also in full colour and is written in well pronounced English. The light on the device is quite dim which is perfect because it won’t disturb you at night but it is also easy to find in the dark.Overall a great quality item especially for the price range.

Lo compre para prender o apagar un presurizador pequeño, más por comodidad, me ha funcionado al 100, muy facil de instalar y de configurar con la app. Al prender desde el celular la respuesta es inmediata, no hay ningún retraso. Además el precio que lo compre fue mejor que el de Usa.

This installed easily and works as described, though the iOS app widget doesn't work properly. It tells me to add my switch as a favourite to be able to manage it from the widget, but you can't actually add it from the app. I also wish this were homekit compatible, but it does work easily with Google home. Pretty good for the price, though I do wish I had sprung the extra $10 on a homekit compatible Wemo.

Revisar primero que en el apagador que vayas a reemplazar tengas el Neutro y la Corriente. En Mexico es común que el Neutro No esté en el apagador, sino en el foco, lo cual implica cableado por un eléctrico. Lo tuve que devolver por esta razón.

Exellent product. Very simple installation. Turn off electricity, then use orange caps on wires. Make sur you have a ground( green usualy)Set up was quick. Works very well with alexa. The app is good as well, set up routines and all. Make sure your wifi is good enough, for example your router is in the basement  and you set up the switch upstair opposite side. You might have issues.

Installing the switch was easy enough. My husband (who is no electrician but has basic knowledge of wiring) had it completely installed and set up in 20 minutes. Works great to turn the lights off once you’re in bed and don’t want to get up lol.It’s only been installed for a week and we already love it and will be ordering more.

Works great! Installation is easy and well described. If needed more just go on Youtube and watch some videos. The box itself is a little bulky and you might find it hard to fit it into the wiring enclosure of your home (especially if it's an old home). However, a little patience goes a long way. At the end once installed properly, it works great. Got it hooked with Alexa and works flawlessly. Great product!

Setup was fairly easy. The Kasa control app is fast and easy to use. Integration with Alexa doesn't always work, to can tell Alexa to turn the light on or off and sometimes she will say it's not responding. If you then turn on the light via the Kasa app it begins responding to Alexa for a while. I would have given the product 5 stars if it weren't for the Alexa integration problem.

If you want a soft touch light switch that’s all you can do. Waste of time. I bought a know brand so I would get something good. I have cheap wifi plugs that are awesome compared to this. It won’t connect to wifi and tech support got disconnected. No phone number to talk to anyone . Very disappointed won’t buy any tp-link product again
We love these, we have three in our house and keep buying more!! lol This style works with single switches, meaning if you have two light switches for the same light this will not work.

Works fine with Alexa, but the back of the switch is quite large, and it may be difficult to install based on the size of your box. I literally had to use a large amount of force to stuff it in and secure it with screws.

I like these lights switches and now have a few of them in my house, however it’s really surprising that the kasa smart software for your phone does not allow you to share access to these switches with multiple users in your home. Chinese knock off brands all typically have this functionality now, but not TP-link.

I have 8 of these in my house as I keep buying when they go on-sale. They work great it's way easier and cheaper to have these and install than to have an electrician move some of my outlets to better locations or implement a higher-end system. I will continue to install more and fully automate my whole home! I have them integrated with IFTTT, Google Home and August Lock, not Alexa.
Loses connection to wifi regularly even though the Wifi router is only 10 feet away from the switch.With no wifi there is no Alexa and no schedule.

Easy to install if you have some computer skills or knowledge. Google it if not. I use these on schedules for my security motion sensor lights and my front outside entrance lights. Works great and it's easy to change the schedule in the app as sunrise and sunset change. If your not comfortable doing the wiring hire a professional. I did it myself.

Fallo despues del mes, en automatico prende y apaga el relevador tambien se perdio la weñal wifi no hay manera de controlarlo ni local ni remoto, ya no funciona y esta fuera de la reclamacion de amazon y como es de importacion supongo que ya perdi mi dinero.

Me costó algo de trabajo conectarlo, la instalación ya existía y si no conectas el cable neutro no funciona, la tierra puede quedar sin conectar. Tuve que conectar el neutro a un cable desnudo de cobre y los dos negros a los cables del contacto anterior. Funciona bien pero necesitas una correcta instalación eléctrica para dejarlo bien conectado. La app es muy funcional y también logré que sirviera muy bien y fácil con Un echo dot

this is my 5th one and i got 2 more to buy and it works with alexa i can set timers to turn the lights on before i come home from work helps when it gets dark at 4pm in winter timedo i need to say more LOL

This product is from a very familiar company that has been around for some time. I had tried some other smart switches from overseas brands that did not work out and had sketchy instal manuals. This unit from TP-Link works great and integrates seamlessly with Amazon Alexa Echo. Instal instructions were all on my mobile and were very well done. Top marks from me on this smart switch

I have a few of the these Smart switches and so far they are working great. The setup up was simple and Kasa app is very easy to navigate. Really like being able to turn on a few lights including the exterior lights before we get home at night. They also work perfectly with Alexa.

+ Looks great, installs easily and the app guides you through it all- The schedules on the app don't work. Tried to use the sunset timing (the reason I bought it) so that it adjusts by itself, but then when I have a turn off time it works, but then turns on at sunrise even though I did not program it to do that in a schedule. Wife wasn't impressed.

Installation is really easy and works with the TP-link App but will not consistently work with Alexa. I follow the link instructions abd it works the first time then Alexa loses the link. Tried other devices with no issue and refuse to purchase a hub for every type of control device that I purchase. Too bad for this product. I will only choose devices that work directly with the Alexis App.

¡Excelente producto! Es muy práctico para controlar el apagado y encendido de las luces, sobre todo si no estás en casa. Puedes programar desde la app, la hora que quieres que se enciendan y te olvidas de hacerlo manualmente. De esta manera mis gatos no se quedan a oscuras y también ahorras energía eléctrica, ya que no tienes que dejar encendidas las luces todo el día. Saludos!

This works exactly what I expected. I bought 2 couple years ago, and bought 2 more for other 2 rooms. My wife found it helpful when we are out on travelling. She can remotely control the lights so it looks people at home.

Little hard to install because of its size and the amount of wires already in the receptable when I started. Once it was installed ran through the easy to understand setup and had it working in no time. Very satisfied with the product and its reliability. Bought it so I could put a shelf in front of the light switch and still be able to use it and it works perfectly

Love the look of the switch, very modern! Installation was quite easy except for the screws which are not standard for Canadian electrical boxes ; very hard to find replacements. Kasa app was a breeze to install, and setup the switch with my Wifi was easy. Love the scheduling feature, using it right away. Overall very happy with the purchase!!

After a few days I still couldn’t set up the connection between the switch and app. It connected to my wifi, the app was easy to install and find the TP switch, but the app wouldn’t allow it to turn on/off. And I’m a techie person, so I don’t think it’s me.I didn’t realize there was a return policy, if I knew would have returned it.

No easy to make it work with Google Assistant. Had to return the product even after investigating the issue form all its angle. Did contact the support of TP, but no success in finding the right solution. I then went with Leviton: cheaper, works better and I like how they keep the ON and OFF into their common places Top and Bottom.

Good looking product, internal components seems pretty good quality as well. Very easy to setup, works as expected. Kasa App is great and I'm also using Samsung SmartThings App to control it. It works perfectly.

Amazingly easy to get these working. Zero complaints and I have almost 12 installed. Will be keeping an eye on future sale to get some more.Use the kaza app, as well integrated with good home, which makes them accessible on my google hub.

Got these for a great price. They are one of my favorite smart light switches. Affordable and reliable. They work out of the box with Alexa and Google Home. For Samsung smartthings smart hub integration, I had too add custom code on the back end. But once setup, it works well.Some people may have issues with wifi connectivity. But a good router will good wifi signal would probably resolve these issues.

Very easy to install.  However, make sure you have neutral wire for powering the switch wifi electronics.  However, if you don't have neutral, you could normally use the ground as neutral.  That's what I did and it worked perfectly

You definitely need a neutral wire to make these switches work. The only issue I found was installation was painstaking as the switches are bigger than the normal switches and all the wires and connectors etc in the box make it difficult to install space wise. You will spend a more time fitting and pressing wires into the box trying to get it to fit, than you will actually connecting the switch.

Picked up two of these switches (HS200) despite one reviewer claiming that they did not work wit LED bulbs. I have two circa 2013 IKEA LED pendants wired to these switches and they work fine. They are connected to my Google Home Network and work perfectly with voice commands. would buy again for other rooms in the house.

Works awesome for my front porch lights. Easy setup and app installation on my iphone. I wanted to be able to remotely turn on my exterior house lights at night when I pulled up into the driveway. Also, has a timer feature so you can set lights to turn on for certain amount of time each day if you're away on vacation.
Some houses do not have a neutral wire in a switch light receptacle box because there was no need for one back in the day. So make sure you have a neutral wire available before you buy one.

It's a great device , works as advertised but for the price that you are paying you can get cheaper models from different brands on Amazon. I guess for the quality and reliability of the tp link brand then it would be worth it

Installed this for my front porch light switch.  Downloaded the app and had it turn off/on with dusk/sunup so I didn't need to turn my front porch light off and on anymore.  Had it set and haven't looked back and it's still functioning properly.  I've probably made my money back on the electricity charges that I would have received for all the times I forgot to turn off the light during the day.

Having access to turn on/off the light from your phone and home assistants is very convenient. I have the light to auto shut off at a set time in the night to prevent it being left on overnight. **Ensure the breaker is shut off when installing**

Because this switch requires the neutral cable, it is impossible to fit 2 of these into a 2 gang box. I could not find help for the wiring diagram for this situation either. So it probably will not fit unless you have a deep electrical box, and if it does, you had better know how to wire these.I have mine half hanging out of the wall now until I get a replacement that does not require the neutral cables.
I had an electrician install this switch. It was easy for him  to install and it works. I connected it to my phone and then to Alexa. No Problems. I need 1 more but it is on back order on Amazon.

Works quite well, but menu needs work to make it more friendly.  Have been using it on a small injection pump to run 15 minutes per day. Mysteriously pumps my barrel dry when it should last a month.  Short of sitting and watching during it's midnight run, I am not sure why the pump seems to run too long?
Se integra perfectamente, solo hay que tener en cuenta que van a necesitar adecuar su instalacion electrica ya que requieren1 Neutro

Product worked pretty well for about a year. Suddenly stopped working properly just recently. Spoke with a support rep, determined that the product is likely defective. They escalated to their RMA department. Initial call was placed on August 9, I’ve followed up 3 times, still no word on replacing this product. Would not recommend, they don’t seem to have good service and support for products.

This switch is installed in our garage, and controls a yard lamp in the front yard.  The schedule function allows me to turn on this lamp in the evening before bedtime, and again in the morning before we leave for work.  I can also turn the lamp on or off using my cellphone.It has never failed or caused any problems.

Easy to set up and use. I have these all over my house, they are the most affordable light switch that still looks great. Works with google home and home assistant. Definitely recommend kasa products. They even work offline.

I love this switch! I literally never have to get out of bed to turn off the lights and that’s all I’ve ever wanted. It works perfectly with my Google Home, it’s easy to install, and it has a clean design. I liked it so much that my sister got one too! I would definitely recommend it :)
Comme j’avais câblé moi-même à l’époque ma maison, j’avais amené un fil du neutre à chcune des boîtes des interrupteurs ce qui a facilité grandement l’utilisation des interrupteurs intelligents !

Works great.  Good for automating lights with multiple bulbs.  Integrates with Alexa easily.  Easy installation. There was a great instructions in the app showing you how to replace your existing switch.

I have 2 version 1 models and 2 version 2 models. What I find interesting is that the difference from v1 & v2 for both "sunset" and "sunrise" mode will be off by a little bit. (sometimes off by a minute or more) but it works.
Product looks solid, BUT, I need to install a brand new wiring box to fit it due to its depth! Stay tuned!Might be a limitation of an older home, but I need deeper boxes to make it work for me.
The kasa wifi switches have been very stable and have their own app as well as integrate with Google Home. When I saw then on sale I had to snap up more.

Setup could be confusing. When setting up the device, you will not able to find any wifi network if you are in area with poor wifi signal, however in contrast, where your cellphone will get decent wifi signal. After initial frustration, you will accidentally find out that when you reposition yourself to the middle point in between your router and the smart switch, you get both signal well!(one is for the router wifi, the other one is for the smart switch wifi)

Fue un poco complicado porque a fuerza necesitas un cable neutro, yo no tengo en todos los switches en mi casa pero en donde lo tengo instalado funciona perfectamente. Diseño minimalista y elegante aunque bastante caro. Agárralo en promoción o intenta otras marcas más baratas. Conectividad con Alexa excelente.

Loving this with Google speakers.  Only con is, the app is not supported by Apple so you can’t control it with Siri.  Works with Google Assistant though.  The unit is pretty thick too.  Some might have issues if their electrical box is not deep.

Let me start by saying it works fairly well. there are some issues that you need to know about. You need STRONG wifi for this device to work well. Also you need a 2.4 gig device to set it up, my phone would not work as it keeps using the 5gig wifi in my house. I should say that it DOES work with IFTTT and Google assitant as we us both services every day without fail.
